original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEmptiness‚Äù means the absence of anything.

original: gal te stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If there were some other phenomenon called ‚Äúemptiness,‚Äù

original: de lta na mi stong pa'i chos kyang yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na mi stong pa'i chos kyang yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then there would also be a phenomenon that is not empty.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur ba ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur ba ni gang yang med de /
translated: But there is no other phenomenon called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gis dri za'i grong khyer mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo skyes la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gis dri za'i grong khyer mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo skyes la /
translated: For example, when someone sees a phantom city, the idea of a city arises.

original: de nas grong khyer de nyid la legs par brtags te bltas na phyis ma mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo med par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas grong khyer de nyid la legs par brtags te bltas na phyis ma mthong nas grong khyer gyi blo med par gyur te /
translated: But when that city is carefully examined and looked at, it is not seen later on, and the idea of a city disappears.

original: stong pa'i blo skyes pa na /
analyzed: stong pa'i blo skyes pa na /
translated: When the idea of emptiness arises,

original: de la stong pa'i blo skyes pa'i phyir grong khyer gyi blos zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la stong pa'i blo skyes pa'i phyir grong khyer gyi blos zhes bya ba'i dngos po gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable to say that because the idea of emptiness arises, there is some other phenomenon called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sngar kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la gzugs su mthong nas chos kyi blo skyes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sngar kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la gzugs su mthong nas chos kyi blo skyes so //
translated: In the same way, here, having seen form and so on as previously imagined, the idea of a dharma arises.

original: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su btsal bas yongs su btsal na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma mthong ba'i phyir chos kyi blo ni med kyi /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su btsal bas yongs su btsal na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma mthong ba'i phyir chos kyi blo ni med kyi /
translated: Then, when one searches for it by investigating it as it really is, the idea of a dharma does not exist because it is not seen by the knowledge of reality as it really is.

original: stong pa'i blo skyes par zad de /
analyzed: stong pa'i blo skyes par zad de /
translated: Only the idea of emptiness arises.

original: de la stong pa'i blo skyes pas de la stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la stong pa'i blo skyes pas de la stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod do zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not possible to say that the idea of emptiness is a different dharma that exists there.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid med pas mi stong pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid med pas mi stong pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of emptiness, non-emptiness also does not exist.

original: mi stong pa med pas stong pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: mi stong pa med pas stong pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: Because of the non-existence of non-emptiness, emptiness also does not exist.

original: 'dir 'di skad du byang ni rung ste stong pa nyid med do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad du byang ni rung ste stong pa nyid med do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste //
translated: Here, one should not say that emptiness does not exist.

original: @56b 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @56b 'di ltar chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are empty.

original: stong pa nyid yod do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yod do zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that emptiness exists.

original: 'di ltar rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dpyad na stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when investigated in this way, there is no other existent called emptiness.

original: de bas na 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad la ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad la ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya /
translated: If all phenomena are empty, why is this entire world of moving and unmoving beings called dependent origination?

original: med pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: med pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: For dependent origination is impossible in the absence of something.üîΩIf a phenomenon of dependent origination exists, then that is how it is.

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos yod na ni de ltar gyur na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'gro ba mtha' dag yod par 'gyur ro zhes de snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos yod na ni de ltar gyur na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i 'gro ba mtha' dag yod par 'gyur ro zhes de snyam bsams nas /
translated: The entire world of moving and unmoving beings would exist.

original: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Having thought in this way, he determines as follows:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med de /
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is called ‚Äúdependently arisen.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di dag ni shin tu med pa yin yang ji srid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / mngon par shes pa rtogs pa med pa de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas thog ma med pa nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni shin tu med pa yin yang ji srid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba dang / mngon par shes pa rtogs pa med pa de srid du las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas thog ma med pa nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas so //
translated: Thus, although these are utterly nonexistent, as long as there is no realization of the direct perception of the way things really are, then, due to the nature of karma, afflictions, and ripening, they abide as the entities of cause and effect from beginningless time.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa de dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa de dag kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du stong pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, karma, afflictions, and ripening are all empty.

original: chos stong pa rnams la stong pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos stong pa rnams la stong pa nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who engage in the emptiness of phenomena as the nature of cause and effect are said to be ‚Äúengaged in dependent origination.‚Äù

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan 'ga' zhig gis sgyu ma'i sngags kyis sems can rnams kyi mig bslus nas glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung dang ri dang / 'bab chu dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar ston par byed de /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan 'ga' zhig gis sgyu ma'i sngags kyis sems can rnams kyi mig bslus nas glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung dang ri dang / 'bab chu dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar ston par byed de /
translated: For example, some magicians deceive the eyes of sentient beings with the spells of illusion and display things such as elephants, horses, chariots, infantry, mountains, waterfalls, oceans, and so on.

original: sems can sngags kyis mig bslus pa de dag la yang sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs par rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can sngags kyis mig bslus pa de dag la yang sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs par rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur la /
translated: For those sentient beings whose eyes are deceived by the spells, the display of illusory elephants and so on becomes the condition for the arising of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de dag mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de dag mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And those consciousnesses see those illusory elephants and so on.

original: de ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug pa gang yin pa @57a * //
analyzed: de ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug pa gang yin pa @57a * //
translated: Thus, the illusory elephants and so on and the consciousnesses engage in the relationship of cause and effect.

original: 'di la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called dependent origination.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de dag dang / rnam par shes pa de dag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni don dam par yod par mi srid do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa de dag dang / rnam par shes pa de dag gi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni don dam par yod par mi srid do //
translated: The dependent origination of those illusory elephants and so on and those consciousnesses is impossible in the ultimate.

original: de bzhin du byis pa ma rig pas bslus pa'i lta ba can thams cad kyang las kyi bzos kun brtags pa'i chos sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa ma rig pas bslus pa'i lta ba can thams cad kyang las kyi bzos kun brtags pa'i chos sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, all those who have the view of the childish, deceived by ignorance, see the imagined phenomena created by karma, such as illusory elephants and so on.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos de dag kyang rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos de dag kyang rang snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur la /
translated: Those imagined phenomena become the conditions for the arising of consciousness that perceives them.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang chos de dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag gis kyang chos de dag mthong ngo //
translated: And those consciousnesses see those phenomena.

original: de ltar kun brtags pa gzung ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dzin pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa gzung ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dzin pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, this engagement of the imagined phenomena of the apprehended and the phenomena of the apprehender in the relationship of cause and effect is called dependent origination.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag ni don dam par yod mi srid pas de'i phyir chos rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de dag ni don dam par yod mi srid pas de'i phyir chos rnams rang bzhin med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the dependently arisen apprehended object and apprehending subject are impossible in the ultimate, therefore phenomena are said to be essenceless.

original: gal te chos rnams bcos ma ma yin zhing rang bzhin can du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yod na de ltar na ni chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis gzhan la rag lus shing 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi bdag nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig
analyzed: gal te chos rnams bcos ma ma yin zhing rang bzhin can du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yod na de ltar na ni chos rnams rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis gzhan la rag lus shing 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi bdag nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig
translated: If phenomena were not fabricated and had an essence, then they would not arise in dependence on other causes and conditions, but would arise by themselves.

original: na 'di ltar chos rnams rkyen gzhan rnams la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: na 'di ltar chos rnams rkyen gzhan rnams la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But in fact, phenomena arise in dependence on other conditions, and they arise in dependence on others.

original: rang gi dngos po bcos ma ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po bcos ma ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis ni 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise by themselves, nor do they arise by their own nature.

original: de bas na de dag rang gi dngos po yod pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag rang gi dngos po yod pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that they do not exist by their own nature.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi dngos po med pa de'i phyir de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rang gi dngos po med pa de'i phyir de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are like that, they are said to be ‚Äúessenceless.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de dag ngo bo nyid med pa de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ngo bo nyid med pa de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are essenceless, they are empty.

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don no //
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of essencelessness is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: stong pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi don ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of emptiness is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba skyes nas ma rig pa'i sngags kyi mthu rab tu bcom par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba skyes nas ma rig pa'i sngags kyi mthu rab tu bcom par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the vision of reality, just as it is, arises, the power of the spell of ignorance is destroyed.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa kun brtag pa'i chos rnams dang / de la 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i @57b chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis mi snang zhing shin tu nub par gyur pa 'di ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa kun brtag pa'i chos rnams dang / de la 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i @57b chos rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis mi snang zhing shin tu nub par gyur pa 'di ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya bya'o //
translated: The phenomena of the imaginary nature, which are like an illusory elephant, and the phenomena of the consciousness that apprehends them are not apparent and are completely absent by the nature of dependent origination, which is the characteristic of the entity of cause and effect. This is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of the great.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na ni don dam pa'i chos kyang stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na ni don dam pa'i chos kyang stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: If all phenomena are empty, then the ultimate truth would also be empty.

original: gal te de stong par gyur na de ltar dam pa'i don du 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de stong par gyur na de ltar dam pa'i don du 'gyur /
translated: If that is empty, then how could it be the ultimate truth?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de la ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could the vajra-like concentration of the buddhas also be focused on that?

original: gal te chos de yod na de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: gal te chos de yod na de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Having thought in this way, he determines that

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med de /
translated: there is no phenomenon whatsoever that is called ‚Äúultimate.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po grub pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /üîΩde yod do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po grub pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te / de yod do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: That which becomes the state of the establishment of the essence of the TathƒÅgata is not the nature of phenomena.üîΩIt cannot be said to exist

original: med do zhes bya bar brjod mi nus so //
analyzed: med do zhes bya bar brjod mi nus so //
translated: or to not exist.

original: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs de ni yod do zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs de ni yod do zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: That state of complete establishment cannot be said to exist

original: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /üîΩmed pa'i mtshan nyid la ni yod do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis med pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te / med pa'i mtshan nyid la ni yod do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: because it is established as having the characteristic of the nonexistence of the duality of the imagined object and subject.üîΩIt is not correct to say that it exists because it has the characteristic of nonexistence.

original: de med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ste /
translated: It cannot be said to not existüîΩbecause it is the nature of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar gnyis dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid du ni yod do //
translated: Thus, it exists in the nature of the absence of duality.

original: de ltar gyur pa de la gal te yod do zhes brjod na dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de la gal te yod do zhes brjod na dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If that which is so were said to exist, it would exist as the nature of a thing.

original: sgro btags pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: That would be the extreme of superimposition.

original: ji ste rdzas su med do zhes brjod na yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste rdzas su med do zhes brjod na yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were said not to exist substantially, it would be non-existent like the horn of an ass.

original: skur pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur pa'i mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: That would be the extreme of denial.

original: de bas na gnyis ka ltar yang brjod du mi rung bas /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka ltar yang brjod du mi rung bas /
translated: Therefore, since it is not suitable to say either,

original: de ltar brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: it should not be investigated in that way.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de la dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de yang ma brtags par smras pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin de la dmigs so zhes gang smras pa de yang ma brtags par smras pa ste /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúIt is observed in that vajra-like concentration,‚Äù that is also said without analysis.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ci la yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni ci la yang mi dmigs te /
translated: The non-conceptual supramundane wisdom of the buddhas does not observe anything at all.

original: de'i tshe gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur pas ci la yang mi dmigs mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang thog ma @58a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du gnas par gyur pas ci la yang mi dmigs mod kyi / 'on kyang thog ma @58a * //
translated: At that time, because there is no aspect of object or subject, it abides in the nature of complete purity. Therefore, it does not apprehend anything at all.

original: med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du goms pas de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi gzung ba med du zin kyang /
analyzed: med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du goms pas de'i tshe rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid kyi gzung ba med du zin kyang /
translated: However, because of being accustomed to the nature of a subject in beginningless cyclic existence, at that time, although there is no object of consciousness,

original: rang nyid kyi 'dzin pa bzhin du 'jug pa nye bar gdags so //üîΩde ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi 'dzin pa bzhin du 'jug pa nye bar gdags so // de ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is designated as engaging in the nature of a subject.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúequality‚Äù because the entity of the object of apprehension and the apprehender are equal.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúequality‚Äù because the object of apprehension and the apprehender are the same.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i don dam pa de chos gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag nyid med pa de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i don dam pa de chos gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag nyid med pa de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The ultimate that is not a self-entity that is a different object is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of the ultimate.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na 'dus byas kyi chos dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams med par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf all phenomena are emptiness, then conditioned phenomena and unconditioned phenomena would not exist.üîΩSince the expression ‚Äòconditioned and unconditioned‚Äô is a provisional designation, it is not suitable to say ‚Äòthey do not exist.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su brjod pa'ang lung las gnas skabs su ma dag pa'i snang bas med ces bya bar mi rung ngo snyam nas yang 'di gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su brjod pa'ang lung las gnas skabs su ma dag pa'i snang bas med ces bya bar mi rung ngo snyam nas yang 'di gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Thus, he determines this:

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no other phenomenon called ‚Äòconditioned.‚Äô

original: gal te yod par gyur na 'dus byas zhes bya ba nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te yod par gyur na 'dus byas zhes bya ba nyid mi rigs te /
translated: If it existed, it would not be suitable to call it ‚Äòconditioned.‚Äô

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus pas byas pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu rkyen rnams tshogs shing 'dus pas byas pa la bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ‚Äòconditioned‚Äô refers to that which is produced by the assembly and convergence of causes and conditions.

original: gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos shig don dam par yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos shig don dam par yod na ni /
translated: If a phenomenon called ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù existed ultimately,

original: de gzhan gyis byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gzhan gyis byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be produced by another.

original: don dam pa'i chos ni sus kyang bya mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ni sus kyang bya mi nus so //
translated: But an ultimate phenomenon cannot be produced by anything.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pas de'i phyir byis pa kun brtags pa las gyur pas de lta bu'i ming gis brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pas de'i phyir byis pa kun brtags pa las gyur pas de lta bu'i ming gis brjod do //
translated: Since there is no phenomenon called ‚Äúconditioned,‚Äù therefore, it is designated by such a name due to the imputations of fools.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag kyang brtags pa'i yod pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of conditioned phenomena, called ‚Äúarising,‚Äù ‚Äúenduring,‚Äù and ‚Äúceasing,‚Äù are also imputedly existent.

original: mtshan nyid brtags pa'i yod par bshad pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang brtags pa'i yod pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung dgos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid brtags pa'i yod par bshad pas mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yang brtags pa'i yod pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung dgos te /
translated: Since the characteristics are explained to be imputedly existent, it is necessary to ascertain that the basis of those characteristics is also only imputedly existent.

original: don dam pa'i chos ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos ni btags pa'i mtshan nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that an ultimate phenomenon is a characteristic that is imputed.

original: gal te don dam par 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba zhig yod na yang chos gcig la mtshan nyid gsum mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te don dam par 'dus byas kyi chos zhes bya ba zhig yod na yang chos gcig la mtshan nyid gsum mi rigs so //
translated: If there were something called a conditioned phenomenon in the ultimate, it would be illogical for a single phenomenon to have three natures.

original: de bas @58b na 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas @58b na 'di ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this is the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: 'dus byas rnams ni 'dus byas pa yin pa'i phyir stong par 'gyur gyi 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de dag 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams ni 'dus byas pa yin pa'i phyir stong par 'gyur gyi 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de dag 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: ‚ÄúSince conditioned phenomena are conditioned, they are empty. But whatever is unconditioned is not conditioned, and therefore it is the ultimate nature.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang yang med do /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni gang yang med do /
translated: Thus, he determines that there is no other phenomenon called ‚Äúunconditioned.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba yang 'dus byas kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la bya'i /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba yang 'dus byas kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la bya'i /
translated: ‚ÄúUnconditioned‚Äù refers to the nature of the nonexistence of conditioned things.

original: don dam par yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist ultimately.

original: 'di ltar dper na nam mkha' ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'i de las gzhan pa shin tu grub pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na nam mkha' ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'i de las gzhan pa shin tu grub pa'i mtshan nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, space is the mere absence of form, and it is not a real entity with a distinct characteristic.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos rnams thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang 'dus byas kyi chos rnams thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: The cessation that is due to discrimination is the mere absence of all conditioned phenomena.

original: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'du byed kyi chos rnams zhig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'du byed kyi chos rnams zhig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cessation that is not due to discrimination is the mere absence of the conditioned phenomena that have been destroyed.

original: nyan thos kyi tshul gyis kyang 'di dag don dam par yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid kyi tshul la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshul gyis kyang 'di dag don dam par yod pa ma yin na stong pa nyid kyi tshul la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If these are not ultimately existent even according to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, then what need is there to mention emptiness?

original: de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa 'di ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The realization of these as empty is called the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na gang sngon gyi mtha' las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba de dag mkhyen pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na gang sngon gyi mtha' las 'das pa'i chos zhes bya ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la ma 'ongs pa'i chos zhes bya ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' la da ltar byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba de dag mkhyen pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If all phenomena are empty, then it would be reasonable to think that the Buddha BhagavƒÅn is omniscient because he knows what is called a phenomenon that has passed beyond the prior limit, what is called a phenomenon that will come in the future limit, and what is called a phenomenon that occurs in the present limit.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i ye shes 'das pa'i dus la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba dang / lha'i mig ces bya ba la sogs pa dus gsum du gtogs pa de dag lung las kyang 'byung bar yod par rigs so snyam du bsams nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de'i ye shes 'das pa'i dus la thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba dang / lha'i mig ces bya ba la sogs pa dus gsum du gtogs pa de dag lung las kyang 'byung bar yod par rigs so snyam du bsams nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: And it would be reasonable to think that the unshared qualities of a buddha, such as the knowledge of the Buddha BhagavƒÅn is unimpeded with respect to the past, and so on, and the divine eye and so on, which are included in the three times, exist because they are found in the scriptures.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang yod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that any phenomenon called ‚Äúthe limit of the past,‚Äù ‚Äúthe limit of the future,‚Äù or ‚Äúthe limit of the middle‚Äù exists.

original: 'di ltar @59a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @59a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: chos gcig kho na ni ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa zhes bya ba mtha' gsum du brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gcig kho na ni ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa zhes bya ba mtha' gsum du brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A single phenomenon would not be described as having three limits: the future, the present, and the past.

original: gal te don dam pa'i chos shig yin na ni gcig tu brjod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don dam pa'i chos shig yin na ni gcig tu brjod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a phenomenon of ultimate reality, it would be described as one.

original: dus gsum du yang ji ltar 'thad de /
analyzed: dus gsum du yang ji ltar 'thad de /
translated: How could it be tenable in the three times?

original: gal te gcig kho na la phyi ma'i mthar ni ma 'ongs par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gcig kho na la phyi ma'i mthar ni ma 'ongs par gyur la /
translated: If it were the future in the future,

original: dbus kyi mthar da ltar byung bar gyur cing sngon gyi mthar 'das par 'gyur ro zhe na yang de lta na ni dus gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbus kyi mthar da ltar byung bar gyur cing sngon gyi mthar 'das par 'gyur ro zhe na yang de lta na ni dus gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: the present in the middle, and the past in the past, then it would be one time only.

original: dper na nag pa grong du ma phyin pa dang / grong nas byung ba yang gcig ste /
analyzed: dper na nag pa grong du ma phyin pa dang / grong nas byung ba yang gcig ste /
translated: For example, it would be like a black cow that has not gone to the village and a black cow that has come from the village.

original: gzhan ma yin pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be the same cow, not another.

original: gzhan yang ci dus 'di ltos pa las grub pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci dus 'di ltos pa las grub pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is this time established through dependence on something else?

original: 'on te rang grub pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rang grub pa yin /
translated: Or is it established through itself?

original: gal te rang grub pa yin no zhe na de ni mi 'thad de dngos po gnas pa rnams ni rang grub par 'thad kyi mi gnas pa rnams ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te rang grub pa yin no zhe na de ni mi 'thad de dngos po gnas pa rnams ni rang grub par 'thad kyi mi gnas pa rnams ni mi 'thad do //
translated: If you say that it is established through itself, that is untenable. It is tenable that things that endure are established through themselves, but it is not tenable that things that do not endure are established through themselves.

original: dus kyang gnas pa ma yin te 'di skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / nyin zhag gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang zla ba gcig dang / dus tshigs dang / klungs su 'jug pa dang / lo khyud 'khor dang / dus la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i tshul can yin pas /
analyzed: dus kyang gnas pa ma yin te 'di skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / nyin zhag gcig dang / zla ba phyed dang zla ba gcig dang / dus tshigs dang / klungs su 'jug pa dang / lo khyud 'khor dang / dus la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i tshul can yin pas /
translated: Time does not endure because it is a phenomenon that changes into moments, instants, seconds, days, half months, months, seasons, solstices, years, and so on.

original: dus ni skad cig kyang mi gnas so //
analyzed: dus ni skad cig kyang mi gnas so //
translated: Time does not endure even for a moment.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus kyi cha dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi cha gcig tu bsdus pa la yud tsam zhes bya bar gdags te /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus kyi cha dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi cha gcig tu bsdus pa la yud tsam zhes bya bar gdags te /
translated: The past part and the future part of time are designated as a second.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gcig tu bsdus pa la nyin mtshan zhes bya bar gdags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gcig tu bsdus pa la nyin mtshan zhes bya bar gdags so //
translated: In the same way, the past and the future together are designated as ‚Äúday and night.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba mi gnas pa'i dngos po rnams la rang 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i dus med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba mi gnas pa'i dngos po rnams la rang 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i dus med do //
translated: Therefore, for things that do not endure, there is no time called ‚Äúpresent,‚Äù nor is there any time called ‚Äúpast‚Äù or ‚Äúfuture.‚Äù

original: ji ste dus ni ltos pa las 'grub ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ste dus ni ltos pa las 'grub ste 'di lta ste /
translated: If time is established in dependence, then

original: 'das pa la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: 'das pa la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: the future and the present would exist in the past.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba la ltos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba la ltos te /
translated: In the same way, the past and the future would exist in the present.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dus gnyis su 'gyur ba la sogs pa yod do zhe na yang /üîΩgal te 'das pa la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis su 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dus gnyis su 'gyur ba la sogs pa yod do zhe na yang / gal te 'das pa la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gnyis su 'gyur na /
translated: And so on for the other two times.üîΩIf the present and the future exist in the past,

original: de lta na ni da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the present and the future would exist in the past.

original: @59b ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gnyis 'das pa la med na ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @59b ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba gnyis 'das pa la med na ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the future and the present do not exist in the past, they would not be dependent on the past.

original: ji ste ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod na ni de lta na de gnyis kyang de na yod pas 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod na ni de lta na de gnyis kyang de na yod pas 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the future and the present exist in the past, then in that case, they would exist there and so would be past.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa gnyis kyang gal te ma 'ongs pa la ltos te 'byung ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa gnyis kyang gal te ma 'ongs pa la ltos te 'byung ba /
translated: In the same way, if the present and the past exist in dependence on the future,

original: de lta na ni da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa gnyis ma 'ongs pa la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa gnyis ma 'ongs pa la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then the present and the past would exist in the future.

original: de na med pa dag ni de la ltos par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na med pa dag ni de la ltos par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they do not exist there, they would not be dependent on it.

original: ji ste ma 'ongs pa de la de gnyis yod par 'gyur na de lta na ni de gnyis kyang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste ma 'ongs pa de la de gnyis yod par 'gyur na de lta na ni de gnyis kyang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they existed there in the future, then in that case, they would be future.

original: de bzhin du gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar byung ba la ltos te 'byung na de lta na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar byung ba la yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar byung ba la ltos te 'byung na de lta na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis da ltar byung ba la yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if the past and future exist in dependence on the present, then the past and future would exist in the present.

original: de na med pa dag ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na med pa dag ni de la ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But those that do not exist there would not depend on it.

original: ji ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de gnyis da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod na ni de lta na de gnyis de na yod pa'i phyir da ltar byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de gnyis da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod na ni de lta na de gnyis de na yod pa'i phyir da ltar byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the past and future exist in the present, then they would be present because they exist there.

original: de lta na yang dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, they would be the same time.

original: de bas na rnam pa de dag la sogs pas don dam par sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med kyi /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa de dag la sogs pas don dam par sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med kyi /
translated: Therefore, in reality, there is no such thing as a phenomenon called ‚Äúthe prior limit,‚Äù ‚Äúthe later limit,‚Äù or ‚Äúthe middle‚Äù in the sense described above.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du de dag bstan to snyam pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du de dag bstan to snyam pa 'di ni /
translated: The Transcendent Lord taught them in terms of the conventions of the world.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúemptiness of what transcends limits.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni ring ngo //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byis pa rnams kyi 'khor ba ni ring ngo //
translated: If all phenomena are emptiness, why did the Bhagavat say that the cycle of existence of the childish is long?

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes 'khor ba yod pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di la thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes 'khor ba yod pa nyid du gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, this cycle of existence has no beginning or end. ‚Äù Thus, he taught that the cycle of existence exists.

original: de bas na 'khor ba yod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba yod do //
translated: Therefore, the cycle of existence exists.

original: de yod pas 'khor ba po yang yod de /
analyzed: de yod pas 'khor ba po yang yod de /
translated: Since it exists, the transmigrator also exists.

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyang de'i sgo nas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyang de'i sgo nas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena exist from that perspective.

original: de yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: This is also determined in the following way:

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever called ‚Äúcycle of existence.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i thog @60a * //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // gal te 'khor ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de'i thog @60a * //
translated: Because it is said that it has no beginning or end.

original: ma yang yod la tha ma yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma yang yod la tha ma yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a phenomenon called ‚Äúcycle of existence‚Äù existed, then it would have a beginning and it would have an end.

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang yod pa'i chos ni gang yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang yod pa'i chos ni gang yang yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see any existent thing that has a beginning or an end.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon gyi mtha' mi snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang sngon gyi mtha' mi snang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has also said, ‚ÄúThe prior limit is not seen.‚Äù

original: ji ste thog ma dang tha ma gnyis ni bkag gi dbus ma ma bkag ste /
analyzed: ji ste thog ma dang tha ma gnyis ni bkag gi dbus ma ma bkag ste /
translated: If you say that the beginning and end are refuted, but not the middle,

original: de bas na dbus yod do zhe na yang de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bas na dbus yod do zhe na yang de yang mi rigs te /
translated: then that is not tenable, because

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: how could there be a middle where there is no beginning and end?

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma dag la ltos te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma dag la ltos te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called middle arises in dependence on the beginning and end.

original: ji ste 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig med na sems can rnams gang du 'khor bar 'gyur bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'khor bar ni gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ste 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig med na sems can rnams gang du 'khor bar 'gyur bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'khor bar ni gsungs te /
translated: If there is no other phenomenon called ‚Äúsa·πÉsƒÅra,‚Äù in what do sentient beings revolve? The Lord has also said, ‚ÄúMonks, this sa·πÉsƒÅra has no beginning or end.‚Äù

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di thog ma dang tha ma med de thog ma'i mtha' mi snang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba 'di thog ma dang tha ma med de thog ma'i mtha' mi snang ngo //
translated: The prior limit is not seen.

original: sems can ma rig pas bsgribs pa sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba can rnams kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zhes na yang 'di ltar lan btab pa 'khor bar 'gyur ba de nyid don dam par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can ma rig pas bsgribs pa sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba can rnams kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zhes na yang 'di ltar lan btab pa 'khor bar 'gyur ba de nyid don dam par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But we reply: It is not tenable that that which circles in samsara exists ultimately.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig 'khor bar 'gyur na yang brtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor grang na rtag pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig 'khor bar 'gyur na yang brtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor grang na rtag pa ni 'khor bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
translated: If something circles in samsara, it must be either a permanent or an impermanent thing. But it is not tenable that a permanent thing circles in samsara.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is changeless.

original: mi rtag pa yang 'khor bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang 'khor bar 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
translated: Nor is it tenable that an impermanent thing circles in samsara.

original: skad cig pa rnams ni de dang de nyid du zhig ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa rnams ni de dang de nyid du zhig ste /
translated: Because momentary things disintegrate in that and that moment.

original: yang skad cig gnyis pa la gzhan kho na skye bas de la 'khor ba ga la yod /
analyzed: yang skad cig gnyis pa la gzhan kho na skye bas de la 'khor ba ga la yod /
translated: Since only another thing arises in the second moment, how could it circle?

original: de bas na 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyun gyis dngos pos 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun ma chad pa la 'khor ba zhes bya bar btags te /
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyun gyis dngos pos 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun ma chad pa la 'khor ba zhes bya bar btags te /
translated: Therefore that which is called samsara is the uninterrupted continuum of things that is, the continuum of formations that is imputed to be samsara through the continuity of arising and ceasing.

original: 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of what is beginningless and endless.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: 'khor ba dmigs su med kyang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan du gyur pa ni yod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dmigs su med kyang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan du gyur pa ni yod do //
translated: Although samsara is not perceived, it is not the case that there is no other thing called nirvana.

original: 'gogs pa'i bden pa ni med do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'gogs pa'i bden pa ni med do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to say that the truth of cessation does not exist.üîΩThe Blessed One has declared in the sutras:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag ma skyes pa ma byas pa ma byung ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag ma skyes pa ma byas pa ma byung ba /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the unborn, the unproduced, the non-arisen, the non-existent,

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ni yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du bstan te /
translated: the unmanifest, the unconditioned, does exist.‚Äù

original: de bas na dor ba med pa yod do //
analyzed: de bas na dor ba med pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the unforsaken exists.

original: dor bar bya @60b zhing med par bya ba'i phyir dor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya @60b zhing med par bya ba'i phyir dor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúforsaken‚Äù refers to the five aggregates that are to be abandoned and destroyed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la ni phung po la dor bzhes bya ba'i ming du btags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi gsung rab la ni phung po la dor bzhes bya ba'i ming du btags so //
translated: In the scriptures of the Tathagata Kasyapa, the aggregates were called ‚Äúthe forsaken.‚Äù

original: da ltar yang dor bar bya ba'i srid pa gcig dang / dor bar bya ba'i srid pa lnga zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: da ltar yang dor bar bya ba'i srid pa gcig dang / dor bar bya ba'i srid pa lnga zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: It is also said that there is one existence to be abandoned and five existences to be abandoned.

original: dor ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dor ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is not an existent thing is called ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: phung po gang du 'gags par gyur pa de la dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po gang du 'gags par gyur pa de la dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the cessation of the aggregates is called ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa yin no snyam nas yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: 'gog pa yin no snyam nas yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Thinking that this is cessation, the bodhisattva determines that

original: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang yod par mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni gang yang yod par mi rigs kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that any existent thing called ‚Äònon-existence‚Äô exists.

original: phung po med pa la ni dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po med pa la ni dor ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the non-existence of the aggregates is called ‚Äònon-existence.‚Äô

original: phung po med pa de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ni gang gi bdag nyid du yang chos gzhan du gyur par rnam par gzhag mi nus so //
analyzed: phung po med pa de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas de ni gang gi bdag nyid du yang chos gzhan du gyur par rnam par gzhag mi nus so //
translated: Moreover, that non-existence of the aggregates is the nirvana that is the remainderless cessation of the aggregates, the characteristic of the non-existence of all things. Therefore, it is not possible to posit it as a different thing that is the nature of something else.‚Äù

original: de bas na dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / dor ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / dor ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù refers to nirvana, cessation, the complete pacification of all conditioned things, the unconditioned, and so on.

original: ji ste mya ngan las 'das pa med na ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ste mya ngan las 'das pa med na ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If nirvana does not exist, why do conditioned things not arise?

original: de bas na phyis 'du byed rnams yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na phyis 'du byed rnams yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, nirvana is the antidote that prevents conditioned things from arising again in the future.‚Äù

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also untenable.

original: 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar yang mi srid do //üîΩgal te 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na yang rtag pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar yang mi srid do // gal te 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur na yang rtag pa'am /
translated: Nirvana is not possible in any way for conditioned things.

original: mi rtag pa zhig mya ngan las 'da' grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhig mya ngan las 'da' grang na /
translated: If conditioned things were to attain nirvana, would they attain nirvana as permanent or impermanent?

original: gal te rtag pa 'ga' zhig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar ni de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa 'ga' zhig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar ni de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúA permanent thing attains nirvana,‚Äù that is untenable.

original: rtag pa ni dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa dang / de la mya ngan las 'das pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pa dang / de la mya ngan las 'das pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permanence is the absence of change at all times, and nirvana is not necessary for that.

original: ji ste 'ga' zhig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar ni de mi rtag pa'i phyir zhig pa las phyis skye ba med de /
analyzed: ji ste 'ga' zhig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar ni de mi rtag pa'i phyir zhig pa las phyis skye ba med de /
translated: If someone were to say, ‚ÄúNirvana is the destruction of something,‚Äù then it would not be permanent, because after the destruction of something, it would not arise again.

original: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni mya ngan las 'da' bas ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni mya ngan las 'da' bas ci yang byar med do //
translated: And for that which is essentially non-arisen, nirvana would not do anything at all.

original: ji ste 'du byed gzhan dag de'i rgyu la skye ba'i gnyen por byed do zhe na yang /
analyzed: ji ste 'du byed gzhan dag de'i rgyu la skye ba'i gnyen por byed do zhe na yang /
translated: If you say that other formations arise as the antidote to the cause of that,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'jig rten @61a * //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te / 'jig rten @61a * //
translated: that also does not exist.

original: las 'das pa'i lam gyi mes nyon mongs pa'i shing gi sa bon sreg pa'i phyir yang mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i lam gyi mes nyon mongs pa'i shing gi sa bon sreg pa'i phyir yang mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Because the fire of the supramundane path burns the seed of the tree of the afflictions, it does not arise again.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba de la mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes btags so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba de la mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes btags so //
translated: That which is essentially non-arisen is designated as ‚Äúnirvana.‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi tshul la yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan du gyur pa ci yang med na stong pa nyid kyi tshul la lta smos kyang ci dgos te 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshul la yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba chos gzhan du gyur pa ci yang med na stong pa nyid kyi tshul la lta smos kyang ci dgos te 'di ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If in the ≈örƒÅvaka system there is not even any other thing called nirvƒÅ·πáa, what need is there to mention the system of emptiness? This is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of non-rejection.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, a bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad stong pa yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are empty,

original: gang sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gi dbang gis bsam pa dang /
analyzed: gang sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / mos pa dang / khams dang / rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gi dbang gis bsam pa dang /
translated: then what is the nature of sentient beings, which is the basis for their conduct of attachment and so on, their thoughts, their latent tendencies, their interests, their elements, their lineages, and so on, on the basis of which they are said to be of definite or indefinite potential, to be of sharp or dull faculties, to be of the MahƒÅyƒÅna or the Hƒ´nayƒÅna?

original: bag la nyal sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag la nyal sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The various kinds of knowledge of the Buddha, such as the knowledge of the various latent tendencies, the knowledge of the various aspirations, and the knowledge of the various elements, and so on, would not be tenable.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyi chos de dag ni don dam par yod do snyam nas /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyi chos de dag ni don dam par yod do snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, thinking that these natural phenomena exist ultimately,

original: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: they are determined in this way.

original: de dag ni chos gzhan du gyur par brjod par mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni chos gzhan du gyur par brjod par mi rigs kyi /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that they are other phenomena.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni sems can gyi rgyud du gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni sems can gyi rgyud du gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag rnams te /
translated: In this way, they are the various states that occur in the mindstreams of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni sems can rnams las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can rnams las tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be established as either different or not different from sentient beings.

original: de bas na chos gzhan du gyur pa de lta bu dag ni med do snyam pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos gzhan du gyur pa de lta bu dag ni med do snyam pa 'di ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, thinking that such other phenomena do not exist, this is called the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad med pa yin na de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de dag ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad med pa yin na de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de dag ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If all phenomena are nonexistent, how could the phenomena of their impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and so on exist?

original: chos can med par ni chos yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: chos can med par ni chos yod par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for a phenomenon to exist without a basis.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Thus all conditioned phenomena are impermanent.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: All defiled phenomena are suffering.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are selfless.

original: de lta bas na de dang de mthong na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes @61b pa thob pa dang / srid pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal las rnam par thar pa 'grub bo snyam nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dang de mthong na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes @61b pa thob pa dang / srid pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal las rnam par thar pa 'grub bo snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, when one sees this and that, one attains knowledge of reality just as it is and one accomplishes liberation from the suffering of all cyclic existence.

original: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Thus he determines this:

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos 'di ni don dam pa'i chos su mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos 'di ni don dam pa'i chos su mi rung ste /
translated: This phenomenon of impermanence is not suitable as an ultimate phenomenon.

original: don dam pa'i chos mi rtag pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos mi rtag pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the ultimate be impermanent, arising and ceasing?

original: 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos ni don dam pa zhes byar mi rung gi //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos ni don dam pa zhes byar mi rung gi //
translated: It is not tenable to call that which has the property of changing and transforming the ultimate.

original: bden pa gang yin pa dang / phyin ci mi log pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa gang yin pa dang / phyin ci mi log pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi don dam pa nyid do //
translated: But that which is true and non-erroneous is the ultimate for them.

original: de bas na don dam pa la 'gyur ba dang ldan pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa la 'gyur ba dang ldan pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate does not have the property of changing.

original: de bzhin du gal te sdug bsngal du gyur pa'i chos don dam par gyur pa zhig yod na ni de lta na sdug bsngal de rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te sdug bsngal du gyur pa'i chos don dam par gyur pa zhig yod na ni de lta na sdug bsngal de rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if a phenomenon that is suffering existed ultimately, then that suffering would be permanent.

original: de ltar gyur na rtag par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rtag par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten nam /
translated: If that were the case, since permanent suffering would exist at all times, then mundane

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and supramundane happiness would not arise.

original: de bzhin du gal te bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos shig don dam par yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos shig don dam par yod par 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if a phenomenon called selflessness existed ultimately,

original: 'o na ni chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid dang ldan pas rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid dang ldan pas rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then all things would be permanent, since they are endowed with the selflessness of all things.

original: de ltar gyur na thar pa zhes bya ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na thar pa zhes bya ba nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that were so, then what is called ‚Äúliberation‚Äù would not be established.

original: de bas na kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di dag ni kun brtags pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin 'di dag ni kun brtags pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of all imagined things is just imagined.

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni gzhig par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni gzhig par mi nus so //
translated: The emptiness of all things cannot be destroyed.

original: de bas na 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of all things.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te re zhig mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir med du zin kyang 'di dag ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir med du zin kyang 'di dag ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid de gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf impermanence and so on are indeed general characteristics, then even if they do not exist, these are the intrinsic natures of things: the intrinsic nature of form is that it is capable of form,

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag ni yod do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag ni yod do //
translated: the intrinsic nature of feeling is experience, and so on.

original: de dag yod pas gzugs la sogs pa yang yod pa nyid do snyam nas /
analyzed: de dag yod pas gzugs la sogs pa yang yod pa nyid do snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, form and so on also exist.

original: yang bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid kyis 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: But when he himself analyzes this, he determines that

original: ci mtshan nyid 'di dag mtshan nyid kyi gzhi rnams las tha dad dam /
analyzed: ci mtshan nyid 'di dag mtshan nyid kyi gzhi rnams las tha dad dam /
translated: are these characteristics different from the bases of those characteristics?

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin /üîΩgal te tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na de nyid mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin / gal te tha dad pa ma yin par gyur na de nyid mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Or are they not different?

original: de nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin zhes byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin zhes byar mi rung ste /
translated: If they are not different, it is not tenable to say that that very thing is a characteristic and that very thing is a basis of those characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma grub na @62a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ma grub na @62a * //
translated: If the basis of those characteristics is not established,

original: mtshan nyid kyang de dang tha dad pa ma yin pas grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang de dang tha dad pa ma yin pas grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: since the characteristic is not different from that, it is not established.

original: de'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be established as a characteristic?

original: gal te tha dad par gyur na de lta na ni 'di dpyad dgos te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par gyur na de lta na ni 'di dpyad dgos te /
translated: If they are different, then this must be analyzed:

original: ci mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid byung ngam /
analyzed: ci mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid byung ngam /
translated: Do characteristics arise prior to the bases of those characteristics,

original: 'on te phyis 'byung ngam 'on te dus gcig tu byung /
analyzed: 'on te phyis 'byung ngam 'on te dus gcig tu byung /
translated: or do they arise later, or do they arise simultaneously?

original: gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid byung na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med par de gang gi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid byung na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi med par de gang gi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: If the characteristic arises prior to the basis of the characteristic, then what would the characteristic be the characteristic of, since there would be no basis of the characteristic?

original: gzhi med par mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig sngar byung bar gyur na phyis kyang gzhi med pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi med par mtshan nyid 'ba' zhig sngar byung bar gyur na phyis kyang gzhi med pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the characteristic alone existed prior to the basis, then it would also arise later without a basis.

original: ji ste mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni sngar byung la mtshan nyid phyis byung bar gyur na de lta na ni mtshan nyid byung ba'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de mtshan nyid med par byung bas phyis kyang mtshan nyid med par ci'i phyir mi 'byung /
analyzed: ji ste mtshan nyid kyi gzhi ni sngar byung la mtshan nyid phyis byung bar gyur na de lta na ni mtshan nyid byung ba'i sngon rol du mtshan nyid kyi gzhi de mtshan nyid med par byung bas phyis kyang mtshan nyid med par ci'i phyir mi 'byung /
translated: But if the basis of the characteristic arose first and the characteristic arose later, then since the basis of the characteristic would arise without a characteristic prior to the arising of the characteristic, why would it not arise without a characteristic later?

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi sngar byung du zin na phyis mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i tshe rgyu med par 'byung bar gyur pas mtshan nyid de ci yang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid kyi gzhi sngar byung du zin na phyis mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i tshe rgyu med par 'byung bar gyur pas mtshan nyid de ci yang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the basis of the characteristic arose without a characteristic prior to the arising of the characteristic, then since it would arise without a cause when the characteristic arises later, that characteristic would not perform any function.

original: ji ste mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dus gcig tu 'byung bar gyur na /üîΩde lta na ni mtshan nyid las mtshan gyi gzhi tha dad par gyur pa dang / mtshan gyi gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad par gyur pa sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji ste mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dus gcig tu 'byung bar gyur na / de lta na ni mtshan nyid las mtshan gyi gzhi tha dad par gyur pa dang / mtshan gyi gzhi las mtshan nyid tha dad par gyur pa sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: If the characterized and the characteristic were to occur at the same time,

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'o zhes gnyis su rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'o zhes gnyis su rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: then since it has never been seen that the characterized is different from the characteristic and the characteristic is different from the characterized, how could it be tenable to make a twofold distinction, saying, ‚ÄúThis is the characteristic‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is the characterized‚Äù?

original: de bas na kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyang kun brtags pa nyid yin pas don dam par rtag bzod pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di ni //
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyang kun brtags pa nyid yin pas don dam par rtag bzod pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di ni //
translated: Therefore, since the characteristics of imagined phenomena are themselves imagined, they are not permanent and stable in an ultimate sense.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of defining characteristics.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med pa yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are unobservable,

original: de lta na ni dmigs su med pa'i chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: de lta na ni dmigs su med pa'i chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig yod do //
translated: then an unobservable phenomenon would exist as something other.

original: gal te dmigs su med pa med du zin na chos rnams dmigs su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dmigs su med pa med du zin na chos rnams dmigs su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the non-apprehension of things did not exist, then things would be apprehended.

original: de bas na dmigs su med pa ni yod do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs su med pa ni yod do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of things exists.

original: 'di la dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di la dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa ni yod par mi rigs so //
translated: But this is not tenable.

original: gal te dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur @62b pa zhig yod na ni dmigs su med pa de las gud na dmigs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur @62b pa zhig yod na ni dmigs su med pa de las gud na dmigs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-apprehension of things were a different thing, then the apprehension of things would exist apart from the non-apprehension of things.

original: de'i phyir dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of things would have the nature of apprehension.

original: de yang bkag pa'i phyir de ltar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang bkag pa'i phyir de ltar mi rung ste /
translated: But this is not tenable, because that has been refuted.
