original: de nyid dmigs pa yin la de nyid dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa yin la de nyid dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that the apprehension of things is itself the non-apprehension of things.

original: ji ste yang 'di snyam du dmigs su med pa la ni dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na yang /
analyzed: ji ste yang 'di snyam du dmigs su med pa la ni dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na yang /
translated: But if you think that the apprehension of things does not exist in the non-apprehension of things,

original: de lta na ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa yang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa yang med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then since it would not be observed, non-observation would be non-existence.

original: de'i phyir dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa yod do zhes bya ba mi dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa yod do zhes bya ba mi dmigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that ‚Äúa different existent thing called non-observation‚Äù is found.

original: chos rnams kyi dmigs pa med pa nyid la de dang der dmigs su med pa zhes tha snyad btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dmigs pa med pa nyid la de dang der dmigs su med pa zhes tha snyad btags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: It is only in the non-observation of things that the expression ‚Äúnon-observation‚Äù is used.

original: de bas na 'di ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called ‚Äúthe emptiness of non-observation.‚Äù

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas think as follows:

original: chos thams cad na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad de /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said that all phenomena are the nature of non-entityness.

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bcal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bcal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of all phenomena called non-entityness should be sought.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i chos ni yod do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i chos ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, because it is established as the nature of non-entityness, a phenomenon called the nature of non-entityness exists.‚Äù

original: ji ste 'di snyam du gal te chos rnams dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: ji ste 'di snyam du gal te chos rnams dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: But if you think that if phenomena are entities that are non-things,

original: de ltar na ni chos rnams med do zhes bya ba nyid du gsung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni chos rnams med do zhes bya ba nyid du gsung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then you would be saying that phenomena do not exist,

original: 'di la rnyed pa ci zhig yod snyam sems na /üîΩde lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rnyed pa ci zhig yod snyam sems na / de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: what would you be gaining by that?

original: kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med do zhes khas blangs na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med do zhes khas blangs na /
translated: That is not so, because if you accept that all imagined phenomena are in every way completely nonexistent,üîΩthen by saying that those very imagined phenomena exist as entities that are non-things, you would be teaching that some phenomena exist.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos de dag nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes smras pas chos rnams kyi phyogs gcig yod par bstan par 'gyur bas rnyed pa cher yod do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos de dag nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes smras pas chos rnams kyi phyogs gcig yod par bstan par 'gyur bas rnyed pa cher yod do snyam nas yang 'di ltar gtan la 'bebs te /
translated: Therefore, thinking that you would be gaining a great deal, you would then determine that

original: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is the meaning of the words ‚ÄúAll phenomena are entities that are non-things‚Äù?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena‚Äù refers to the imagined reality and the perfected reality.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i chos rnams ni med pa'i phyir shin tu dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod do //üîΩyongs @63a * //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i chos rnams ni med pa'i phyir shin tu dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod do // yongs @63a * //
translated: The imagined reality is said to be ‚Äúthe nature of the absence of an essential nature,‚Äù because it does not exist.

original: su grub pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid dngos po las bzlog pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: su grub pa'i chos rnams ni de bzhin nyid dngos po las bzlog pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The perfected reality is the aspect that is the opposite of an entity.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Having taken up the meaning of ‚Äúnon-entity,‚Äù it is said to be ‚Äúthe nature of the absence of an essential nature.‚Äù

original: byung ba'i phyir dngos po zhes bya bas na 'dus byas kyi chos la dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i phyir dngos po zhes bya bas na 'dus byas kyi chos la dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is produced, it is called an ‚Äúentity.‚Äù Thus, conditioned entities are called ‚Äúentities.‚Äù

original: de las bzlog pa brjod du med pa so so rang gis rig pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa brjod du med pa so so rang gis rig pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The aspect that is the opposite of that, which is inexpressible and is to be realized personally, is the ‚Äúnature of the absence of an essential nature.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya bar bstan to //
translated: This is taught to be ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'di nyid kyis chos rnams kyi yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di nyid kyis chos rnams kyi yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this very emptiness teaches the existence and nonexistence of phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang na gang med pa de na des stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang na gang med pa de na des stong par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: For the Lord also says, ‚ÄúWhatever is nonexistent, that is empty of that. One should know that just as it is, in reality.üîΩWhatever is left there as a remainder, that exists here. One should know that just as it is, in reality.‚Äù

original: de na lhag ma ma lus pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pas chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa ma yin
analyzed: de na lhag ma ma lus pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir yod pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes gsungs pas chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa ma yin
translated: Thus, one does not understand the characteristic of the unreality of all things.

original: te / 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: te / 'di ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of unreality.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad du yang de bzhin nyid ni gcig mod kyi 'on kyang de'i gzhi la 'jug pa tha dad pas rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad du yang de bzhin nyid ni gcig mod kyi 'on kyang de'i gzhi la 'jug pa tha dad pas rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
translated: The suchness of all phenomena, the suchness of the dharma-element, and the suchness of the very limit of reality are all the same everywhere. However, they are established as three kinds because their bases are different.üîΩThe suchness of the path of seeing is the suchness of the path of meditation. The suchness of the path of meditation is the suchness of the path of no-more-learning.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid kyis pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyis pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid kyis pa'o //
translated: The suchness of the path of no-more-learning is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects. The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of paths. The suchness of the knowledge of paths is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos gang yin pa de dag gi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos gang yin pa de dag gi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i de bzhin nyid dang / dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / sgra'i de bzhin nyid dang / dri'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩThe suchness of the

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gnas gyur pa chos kyi sku ni gnyis pa chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po gnas gyur pa chos kyi sku ni gnyis pa chos kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The second reality is the thusness of the dharma-dhƒÅtu, which is the transformed essence of the tathƒÅgatas, the dharmakƒÅya of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The third reality is the thusness of the perfect end, which is the nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: 'dis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'khor @63b ba yang mi len to zhes bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes de dang de dag las bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi bya'o zhes bya ba dang / 'khor @63b ba yang mi len to zhes bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes de dang de dag las bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: because it is explained in this and that text that ‚Äúthis does not actualize the perfect end,‚Äù ‚Äúit does not take up a retinue,‚Äù and ‚Äúit does not actualize the perfect end.‚Äù

original: yang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ces pa snga ma ni sa brgyad pa la lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pas rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ces pa snga ma ni sa brgyad pa la lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pas rtog pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: Again, the suchness of all dharmas is mentioned in the former passage in order to show the non-conceptualization by means of the spontaneous non-conceptuality on the eighth stage.

original: 'dir ni mthar phyin pa'i sa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mthar phyin pa'i sa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: But here it should be understood that it is mentioned in order to show the stage of culmination.

original: sa'i rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa de dag shes par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa las rdul phra rab kyi rdul la mkhyen pa 'jug pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams bstan pa'o //üîΩsor mo gcig gi rtse mos gzhil bar bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas rlung bcil ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sa'i rdul phra rab ji snyed yod pa de dag shes par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa las rdul phra rab kyi rdul la mkhyen pa 'jug pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can rnams bstan pa'o // sor mo gcig gi rtse mos gzhil bar bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas rlung bcil ba de bzhin du /
translated: As many atoms as there are in the earth, he wishes to know them all. This is the special quality taught in the Dasabh≈´mika S≈´tra, the penetration of knowledge into the atoms, etc.üîΩHe wishes to cover with the tip of one finger all the wind-circles that are to be covered. Just as a wall, etc. stops the wind,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par 'jig pa'i rlung yang sor mo'i rtse mo gcig gis rtsig pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jil bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab par 'jig pa'i rlung yang sor mo'i rtse mo gcig gis rtsig pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jil bar byed pa'o //
translated: in the same way, with the tip of one finger he stops the wind of destruction that pervades all world-spheres, as if it were a wall, etc.

original: skyil mo krung gcig gis rgyas par dgang bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi stan gyis khebs par 'dod na nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa'o //üîΩbsod snyoms gcig gis zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu zas kyis te /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gcig gis rgyas par dgang bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi stan gyis khebs par 'dod na nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa'o // bsod snyoms gcig gis zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu zas kyis te /
translated: The phrase one who wishes to fill the vast means that if one wishes to cover one's own seat, one fills the vast sky.üîΩThe phrase with one alms-bowl means with one meal,

original: dus mthun par zas kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus mthun par zas kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, with one meal at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa ji lta bus btsal na zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pus ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa ji lta bus btsal na zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pus ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase Blessed One, by what kind of generosity should a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva seek means by what kind of perfection of generosity should he perfect the six perfections.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / kun tu rtog pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sbyin pa gtong ba na rnam par mi g-yeng la de la kun tu rtog pa yang med la de'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin paüîΩyongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / kun tu rtog pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sbyin pa gtong ba na rnam par mi g-yeng la de la kun tu rtog pa yang med la de'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of meditative concentration is fulfilled.

original: chos thams cad rab tu shes pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad shes rab kyis shes so zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu shes pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad shes rab kyis shes so zhes bya bar mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are known by means of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: sha'i mig dang lha'i mig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sha'i mig dang lha'i mig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eye of flesh, the divine eye, and so on.

original: gzugs kyi sku'i spyan ni sha'i mig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i spyan ni sha'i mig go //
translated: The eye of the form body is the eye of flesh.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thams cad ni lha'i mig go //üîΩthams cad @64a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thams cad ni lha'i mig go // thams cad @64a * //
translated: All the wisdoms of meditative concentration, meditative attainment, and the superknowledges are the divine eye.üîΩAll the wisdoms of the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of the path of all aspects are the wisdom eye.

original: mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi mig go //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi mig go //
translated: The eye of Dharma is the eye of omniscience.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa ni chos kyi mig go //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa ni chos kyi mig go //
translated: The knowledge of the path going everywhere, the knowledge of the various higher and lower faculties, the knowledge of the various aspirations, and the knowledge of the various elements are the Dharma eye.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi mig go //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bsdus pa dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi mig go //
translated: The knowledge of the path of the arhat included in the vajra-like samadhi is the Buddha eye.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na chos ston pa de dag thams cad thos nas dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas gcad du mi chod pas yang dag par
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na chos ston pa de dag thams cad thos nas dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas gcad du mi chod pas yang dag par
translated: Moreover, Shariputra, the bodhisattva mahasattva, having heard all the teachings of the Buddhas, the Bhagavans, in all the worlds of the ten directions, by generating the power of mindfulness, without interruption,

original: gzung bar 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du thams cad chud mi za bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung las 'byung bar zad
analyzed: gzung bar 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du thams cad chud mi za bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung las 'byung bar zad
translated: One should train in the perfection of wisdom if one wishes to not waste anything, from the initial thought of enlightenment up to the full awakening of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and if one wishes to not waste one's desire to apprehend.

original: do // mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi bar dag ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: do // mun pa mun nag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi bar dag ni mun pa'o //
translated: Darkness and gloom refers to the darkness between worlds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam la bslab par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sku'i gsang ba sa bcu thob pa'i spyod yul yin pas de skad bshad do //üîΩglang po che'i lta stangs zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyi lta stangs te de dag ni steng na 'dug pa la bskyed de mi lta /üîΩ'og nas 'dug pa la btud de mi lta /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam la bslab par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sku'i gsang ba sa bcu thob pa'i spyod yul yin pas de skad bshad do // glang po che'i lta stangs zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyi lta stangs te de dag ni steng na 'dug pa la bskyed de mi lta / 'og nas 'dug pa la btud de mi lta /
translated: One who wishes to train in the conduct of the Tathagata refers to the secret of the body, which is the domain of those who have attained the ten grounds.üîΩThe elephant's gaze refers to the gaze of the noble ones. They do not look up at those above them,üîΩnor do they look down on those below them.

original: g-yas g-yon na 'dug pa la ni mig bzur te mi lta /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon na 'dug pa la ni mig bzur te mi lta /
translated: They do not look sideways at those to the right and left.

original: rgyab na 'dug pa la ni mjing pa bsgyur te mi lta /üîΩthag ring po ni 'dug pa la bsgrims te mi lta /
analyzed: rgyab na 'dug pa la ni mjing pa bsgyur te mi lta / thag ring po ni 'dug pa la bsgrims te mi lta /
translated: One does not look at someone behind one by turning the neck.üîΩOne does not look at someone far away with a focused gaze.

original: thag nye ba na 'dug pa la bsgrims pa med par yang mi lta'i /
analyzed: thag nye ba na 'dug pa la bsgrims pa med par yang mi lta'i /
translated: One does not look at someone nearby without a focused gaze.

original: ji ltar 'dug pa'i spyod lam dang / ji ltar lta ba'i mig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad la lta ba ni glang po che'i lta stangs zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dug pa'i spyod lam dang / ji ltar lta ba'i mig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad dang / chos thams cad la lta ba ni glang po che'i lta stangs zhes 'chad do //
translated: The way of looking at the world with the eyes in whatever posture one is in, at all sentient beings and all phenomena, is called the elephant‚Äôs way of looking.

original: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi snying por ni spyod lam rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'greng ba dang 'dug pa zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi snying por ni spyod lam rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs so //
translated: As for ‚Äúwalking, standing, sitting,‚Äù the Buddha remained in these three postures at the site of enlightenment.

original: nyal zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ste /
analyzed: nyal zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLying down‚Äù is great parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: dus de gnyis ka yangs tha mal pas ldeg mi nus so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: dus de gnyis ka yangs tha mal pas ldeg mi nus so zhes 'chad do //
translated: It is explained that in both of these situations, the Buddha cannot be moved by ordinary means.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyis @64b bcags pa'i sa gzhi thams cad rdo rje lta bur gyur na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyis @64b bcags pa'i sa gzhi thams cad rdo rje lta bur gyur na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with the ground that the Tathagata has trodden becoming like vajra?

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgra bcom pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa dang shin tu bral te de dag la nyon mongs pa kun
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar 'dzin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams dgra bcom pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa dang shin tu bral te de dag la nyon mongs pa kun
translated: Because the five sense objects would not arise.üîΩThe five sense objects are taken up in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: tu 'byung ba shin tu phra mo yang med pas na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la yongs su spyod mi srid mod kyi /
analyzed: tu 'byung ba shin tu phra mo yang med pas na 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la yongs su spyod mi srid mod kyi /
translated: On the eighth level, bodhisattvas are like arhats, completely free of defilements and since they have no subtle defilements, it is impossible for them to indulge in the five sense objects.

original: 'on kyang bdag cag gi byang chub sems dpa' ni bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag cag gi byang chub sems dpa' ni bsdu ba'i dngos po la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Nevertheless, our bodhisattvas are skilled in the means of attracting disciples.

original: don mthun pas sems can rnams bsdu ba'i phyir bud med nyi khri bzhi stong re re la yang bdag gi lus kyang de snyed du sprul te /
analyzed: don mthun pas sems can rnams bsdu ba'i phyir bud med nyi khri bzhi stong re re la yang bdag gi lus kyang de snyed du sprul te /
translated: By means of the concordance of purpose, in order to gather beings, he emanated as many of his own bodies as there were of the twenty-four thousand women.

original: de dag thams cad dga' bar mdzad do //üîΩde bas na sa tshom la sogs pa bud med nyi khri bzhi stong dang / gar mkhan mo dgu stong dang / de dag gi g-yog 'khor mang po dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba bstan pa rnams dang / lha dang /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dga' bar mdzad do // de bas na sa tshom la sogs pa bud med nyi khri bzhi stong dang / gar mkhan mo dgu stong dang / de dag gi g-yog 'khor mang po dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba bstan pa rnams dang / lha dang /
translated: He delighted them all.

original: tshangs pa rnams kyi nang na theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par ma mdzad pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: tshangs pa rnams kyi nang na theg pa gsum gyis yongs su smin par ma mdzad pa gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there was not a single one of the twenty-four thousand women, such as Sth≈´lanandƒÅ, or the nine thousand dancing girls, or their many retinues, or those who had been taught about old age, sickness, and death, or the gods and Brahmas, who was not ripened by the three vehicles.

original: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa la spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa la spyod pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in order to ripen beings, he demonstrated the enjoyment of desire.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: As it is said, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: bdag gis 'dod pa dag gi skyon rnams mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bdag gis 'dod pa dag gi skyon rnams mtha' yas pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe faults of desire are limitless.

original: 'chi dang khon bcas sdug bsngal can te mya ngan rtsa //
analyzed: 'chi dang khon bcas sdug bsngal can te mya ngan rtsa //
translated: Death, enmity, and suffering are the roots of sorrow.

original: 'jig par byed cing dug dang 'khrul 'khor 'dra ba dang // me 'bar 'dra zhing ral gri'i so 'drar shes pas na //
analyzed: 'jig par byed cing dug dang 'khrul 'khor 'dra ba dang // me 'bar 'dra zhing ral gri'i so 'drar shes pas na //
translated: They are like a poison, a trap, a fire, and a sword.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan dag la bdag 'dun 'dod chags med //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan dag la bdag 'dun 'dod chags med //
translated: Therefore, I have no desire for the objects of desire.

original: bud med khyim na gnas pa bdag la mi mdzes kyis //
analyzed: bud med khyim na gnas pa bdag la mi mdzes kyis //
translated: I do not find it attractive to live in a house with a woman.

original: bdag ni nags kyi 'dab tu song ste mi smra bar //
analyzed: bdag ni nags kyi 'dab tu song ste mi smra bar //
translated: I will go to the forest and live alone,

original: bsam gtan ting 'dzin sgo nas sems zhi gnas par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ting 'dzin sgo nas sems zhi gnas par bya // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and with a mind at peace, I will practice meditation.

original: des yang de ltar brtags nas thabs mkhas pas mngon sum du mdzad de /
analyzed: des yang de ltar brtags nas thabs mkhas pas mngon sum du mdzad de /
translated: Having examined things in this way, the bodhisattva, through his skill in means, manifested his desire for a wife.

original: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir thugs rje chen po bskyed nas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir thugs rje chen po bskyed nas /
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, he generated great compassion.

original: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: At that time, he spoke this verse:

original: ku mu da ni 'dam rdzab nang na skye //
analyzed: ku mu da ni 'dam rdzab nang na skye //
translated: ‚ÄúA lotus is born in the mud,

original: mi yis gang ba'i nang nas rgyal pos mchod pa thob //
analyzed: mi yis gang ba'i nang nas rgyal pos mchod pa thob //
translated: and is worshipped by people, having been found in the middle of the water.

original: gang tshe byang chub sems @65a * //
analyzed: gang tshe byang chub sems @65a * //
translated: When the Bodhisattvas

original: dpa' g-yog 'khor mang brnyes pa //
analyzed: dpa' g-yog 'khor mang brnyes pa //
translated: have gained many followers and retinues,

original: de tshe sems can bye ba khrag khrig bdud rtsis 'dul //
analyzed: de tshe sems can bye ba khrag khrig bdud rtsis 'dul //
translated: then they discipline many quintillions of sentient beings with the nectar of immortality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gang dag sngon byung ba //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gang dag sngon byung ba //
translated: All the wise Bodhisattvas of the past

original: kun gyis sras dang btsun mo bud med bsten gyur kyang //
analyzed: kun gyis sras dang btsun mo bud med bsten gyur kyang //
translated: depended on sons, wives, and women,

original: 'dod pas chags med bsam gtan bde las nyams ma gyur //üîΩde bas de dag yon tan rjes su bdag gis bslab //
analyzed: 'dod pas chags med bsam gtan bde las nyams ma gyur // de bas de dag yon tan rjes su bdag gis bslab //
translated: but they did not lose the bliss of concentration through attachment to desire.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgal te 'dod pa la spyod pa bden pa ma yin na sgra gcan zin sras yin no zhes bya ba yang brdzun par 'gyur ro zhe na yang brdzun ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // gal te 'dod pa la spyod pa bden pa ma yin na sgra gcan zin sras yin no zhes bya ba yang brdzun par 'gyur ro zhe na yang brdzun ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, I will train in the qualities of those Bodhisattvas.üîΩIf the enjoyment of desire is not true, then it would be false to say that RƒÅhula is the son.

original: bu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la yongs su spyod pa'i rgyus mngal nas skyes pa 'ba' zhig la bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la yongs su spyod pa'i rgyus mngal nas skyes pa 'ba' zhig la bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not false, because the word ‚Äúson‚Äù does not refer only to one born from the womb through the cause of the enjoyment of desire.

original: brdzus te skye ba de dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: brdzus te skye ba de dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also those who are miraculously born.

original: sgra gcan zin bzang po yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin bzang po yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
translated: And Subh≈´ti, too, is a bodhisattva great being.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis mngal na gnas pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis mngal na gnas pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: He demonstrated the way of dwelling in the womb for a reason.

original: sems bskyed pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: This was the chapter on the generation of mind, the second.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni 'dir mngon par 'dod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni 'dir mngon par 'dod pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, mind refers to what is desired.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa bstan pa la sems bskyed pa'i le'u zhes bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mngon par 'dod pa skyes pa bstan pa la sems bskyed pa'i le'u zhes bya'o / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: The generation of the mind that is the arising of the desire for all the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and all the dharmas of the buddhas is taught in the chapter on the generation of mind.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir brtson par bya ba zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dir bslab pa'i brtson par bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir brtson par bya ba zhes bya ba la / 'dir bslab pa'i brtson par bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, in the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.üîΩIn the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.

original: da ni ji ltar brtson par bya zhes bya ba la sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar brtson par bya zhes bya ba la sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: In the chapter on the generation of mind, the desire for the dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas is taught.

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du byang chub sems dpar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du byang chub sems dpar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: and while being a bodhisattva, he does not see a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see many bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see ‚Äúpractice.‚Äù

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //üîΩspyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see ‚Äúnon-practice.‚ÄùüîΩHe does not see ‚Äúpracticing and not practicing.‚Äù

original: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see ‚Äúneither practicing nor not practicing.‚Äù

original: gzugs yang @65b dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs yang @65b dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis 'dir spyad pa'i brtson par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis 'dir spyad pa'i brtson par bya ba ston to //
translated: Likewise, the passage beginning ‚ÄúHe does not see feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness‚Äù teaches the effort to be made here.

original: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni chos rnam pa gsum dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis zhus te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa ni chos rnam pa gsum dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis zhus te /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra‚Äôs question to the Lord, ‚ÄúHow should a bodhisattva practice the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù is a question about the three topics‚Äîthe bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the practice‚Äîin terms of their having a reference point and having a sign.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de la spyod pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, the perfection of wisdom, and the practice.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / spyod pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa bzhin bstan pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa de dag bsal ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa dang / spyod pa mi dmigs pa rnam pa bzhin bstan pas mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: Then, in order to eliminate those views, the Lord taught the emptiness of non-observation, by means of the three kinds of non-observation of the bodhisattva, the non-observation of the perfection of wisdom, and the four kinds of non-observation of practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mi dmigs pa gsum ni sems dpa' mi dmigs pa dang ming mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mi dmigs pa gsum ni sems dpa' mi dmigs pa dang ming mi dmigs pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of non-observation of the bodhisattva are the non-observation of the bodhisattva, the non-observation of the name, and the non-observation of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: As a bodhisattva means as one who has the reality of a bodhisattva, because he exists.

original: 'dis ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
translated: This avoids the extreme of denial.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni sems dpa' mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni sems dpa' mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see the bodhisattva means that he does not observe the bodhisattva.

original: ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: He does not see even the name. This is because of the imagined nature.

original: byang chub kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bar ni gnas gyur pa ma gtogs par byang chub ces bya ba'i ming gi chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya bar ni gnas gyur pa ma gtogs par byang chub ces bya ba'i ming gi chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see even enlightenment. This is because, apart from the transmutation, there is no dharma called enlightenment, which is the name.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see even the perfection of wisdom. This is because, apart from the purity of the dharma-element, there is no dharma called perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see even the practice. This is because all dharmas are without action.

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byed pa med du zin kyang chos kyi dbyings sbyang bar bya bar yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩspyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag @66a * //
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni byed pa med du zin kyang chos kyi dbyings sbyang bar bya bar yod pa'i phyir ro // spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag @66a * //
translated: The phrase one does not see the statement 'one does not practice' means that, even though there is no agent, the dharma-dhƒÅtu is still to be purified.

original: par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus nas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus nas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: The phrase one does not see the statement 'one practices and does not practice' means that one does not see the combination of the two in the statement one practices and does not practice.

original: skyon gnyis po de nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon gnyis po de nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two faults would follow.

original: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar gnyis su med par brjod mod kyi 'on kyang gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa de ni rnam pa med pa'i phyir de
analyzed: spyod pa yang ma yin mi spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar gnyis su med par brjod mod kyi 'on kyang gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa de ni rnam pa med pa'i phyir de
translated: The phrase one does not see the statement 'one neither practices nor does not practice' means that, although it is said that there is no duality, still, because the aspect of nonduality is itself devoid of aspect,

original: ltar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ltar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: one does not see it in that way.

original: de ltar sngar gang zag stong pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngar gang zag stong pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having previously taught that a bodhisattva does not exist due to the emptiness of the person,

original: da ni chos bdag med pas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: da ni chos bdag med pas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba dang / tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: now, due to the selflessness of phenomena, he teaches that one does not see form, and one does not see feeling, etc.

original: de bas na phung po lnga'i rnam pa yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na phung po lnga'i rnam pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the aspects of the five aggregates do not exist.

original: spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ltar dmigs su med par bstan nas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ston to //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ltar dmigs su med par bstan nas de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs ston to //
translated: Having taught that such conceptual thoughts of practice are not observed, the question Why is that? shows the reason.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming la sogs pa dmigs su med pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid dmigs su yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming la sogs pa dmigs su med pa dang / de'i stong pa nyid dmigs su yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the name, etc. of a bodhisattva is not observed, and that its emptiness is observed,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming de ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi /
translated: it is said that the name of a bodhisattva is empty of the entityness of a name,

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: but not empty of the emptiness of a name, and so on.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: Thus, the name ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù is a designation.

original: de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni med kyi /
analyzed: de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni med kyi /
translated: It does not exist by way of its imagined nature.

original: des na med pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: des na med pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of what does not exist is.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid des ni stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid des ni stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, that emptiness is not empty of that emptiness.

original: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
translated: This passage rejects the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the name ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù does not exist by way of its own nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rnam par ni med kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang kun brtags pa'i chos kyi rnam par ni med kyi /
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not exist as a phenomenon that is imagined.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rnam par ni yod do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rnam par ni yod do //
translated: It does exist as the pure realm of phenomena.

original: phung po rnams kyang phung po'i ngo bo nyid du ni med kyi /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang phung po'i ngo bo nyid du ni med kyi /
translated: The aggregates do not exist as the nature of the aggregates.

original: phung po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phung po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: They do exist as the nature of the absence of aggregates.

original: 'di la yang the tshom yod do snyam pa la de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la yang the tshom yod do snyam pa la de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: Here, thinking ‚Äúthere is doubt about this,‚Äù the reason is stated with ‚Äúwhy is that?‚Äù

original: the tshom yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is the doubt?

original: gal te chos thams cad de dag chos kyi ngo bo nyid du med la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad de dag chos kyi ngo bo nyid du med la /
translated: If all phenomena do not exist as the nature of phenomena,

original: stong @66b pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du ni yod na /
analyzed: stong @66b pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du ni yod na /
translated: and they exist as the nature of emptiness,

original: de lta na ni chos rnams yod do zhes bya ba nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos rnams yod do zhes bya ba nyid du 'gyur /
translated: then it would be the case that phenomena exist.

original: gang chos rnams yod do zhes bya ba de nyid kyis chog pas stong pa nyid dam gzhan gyis kyang rung ste zhes bya ba des ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang chos rnams yod do zhes bya ba de nyid kyis chog pas stong pa nyid dam gzhan gyis kyang rung ste zhes bya ba des ci zhig bya snyam pa la /
translated: Since it is sufficient to say that phenomena exist, what is the point of saying ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù or ‚Äúsomething else‚Äù?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ming ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, it is said, ‚ÄúThe emptiness that is the name of a bodhisattva is not the name of a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is taught here?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gzhan la stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang gzhan la stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yin te /
translated: The name of a bodhisattva and emptiness are not different.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because emptiness exists,üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yod do zhes brjod par mi nus so//üîΩde bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yod do zhes brjod par mi nus so// de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan la /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that ‚Äúthe name of a bodhisattva exists because emptiness exists.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yin te /üîΩde bas na stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yin te / de bas na stong pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, a bodhisattva is not one thing and emptiness another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang yod do zhes brjod du yang mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang yod do zhes brjod du yang mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to say that ‚Äúa bodhisattva exists because emptiness exists.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to everything.

original: de skad bstan pa dang / gzhan dag the tshom za ste /
analyzed: de skad bstan pa dang / gzhan dag the tshom za ste /
translated: When this was taught, others doubted this,

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la chos kyang gzhan yin na /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyang gzhan la chos kyang gzhan yin na /
translated: thinking, ‚ÄúIf emptiness is one thing and phenomena another,

original: da lta na ni chos las chos nyid gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: da lta na ni chos las chos nyid gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: then now the intrinsic nature would be different from phenomena,

original: chos nyid kyang chos las gzhan yin par gyur te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang chos las gzhan yin par gyur te /
translated: and the intrinsic nature would be different from phenomena.

original: de yang mi rigs so snyam pa la /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so snyam pa la /
translated: But that is not reasonable.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa'i ming med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa'i ming med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To address this, it is said, ‚ÄúApart from emptiness, there is no bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de las byang chub sems dpa'i ming gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de las byang chub sems dpa'i ming gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the name of a bodhisattva is not other than a bodhisattva.

original: de bas na chos nyid las chos gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid las chos gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the reality of a bodhisattva is not other than a bodhisattva.

original: de la gzhan the tshom za ste gal te stong pa nyid las chos gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de la gzhan the tshom za ste gal te stong pa nyid las chos gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Here, someone else has a doubt: if the reality of a bodhisattva is not other than emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid de yang yod na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de yang yod na /
translated: and that emptiness exists,

original: de ltar ni chos de yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ni chos de yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: then in that case, a bodhisattva would exist.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ming nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ming nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe name of a bodhisattva is emptiness.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: The name of a bodhisattva that is imagined to be separate from the perfected nature is itself emptiness.

original: de las gzhan pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni med do //
translated: There is no other emptiness apart from that.

original: stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i ming yin zhes bya ba yang mjug sdud de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i ming yin zhes bya ba yang mjug sdud de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúemptiness is the name of a bodhisattva‚Äù is a summary.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya'i /
translated: Thus, the perfected nature is what is called the ‚Äúname‚Äù of the bodhisattva here.

original: kun brtags pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: It is not the imagined.

original: @67a * // de bas na stong pa nyid kho na byang chub sems dpa'i ming yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @67a * // de bas na stong pa nyid kho na byang chub sems dpa'i ming yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, emptiness alone is the name of the bodhisattva. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub ces bya ba der yang de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub ces bya ba der yang de ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva and enlightenment should be connected in this way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of the bodhisattva is not the bodhisattva.

original: stong pa nyid las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa' med do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na yang byang chub sems dpa' med do // byang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not exist apart from emptiness.üîΩThe bodhisattva is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Emptiness is the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar bshad pa 'di la sngar byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi / stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes smras pas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa 'di la sngar byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi / stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes smras pas /
translated: In this explanation, it was said earlier that the bodhisattva is empty of the essence of a bodhisattva, but not empty of emptiness.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du yod na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du yod na /
translated: If the bodhisattva existed as the essence of emptiness,

original: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa la /
translated: then the bodhisattva would exist.üîΩIt was said that the emptiness of the bodhisattva is not the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid dang tha dad pa'i phyir de la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te kun brtags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid dang tha dad pa'i phyir de la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: This means that there is no fault because the imagined bodhisattva is different from emptiness.

original: go // de skad smras pa dang / gzhan na re chos dang chos nyid tha dad na ni chos las chos nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de la stong pa nyid las gud na byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: go // de skad smras pa dang / gzhan na re chos dang chos nyid tha dad na ni chos las chos nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de la stong pa nyid las gud na byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: And when it is said that if the Dharma and the ultimate are different, the ultimate would be different from the Dharma, it is said that the bodhisattva does not exist apart from emptiness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fully accomplished bodhisattva is not different from emptiness.

original: de nyid byang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub sems dpa' nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That itself is the bodhisattva, emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattva is emptiness.

original: yang stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya bas ni mjug sdud de /
analyzed: yang stong pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya bas ni mjug sdud de /
translated: And again, emptiness is the bodhisattva. This is the conclusion.

original: stong pa nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Emptiness and the fully accomplished bodhisattva are not different.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: de skad smras pa dang / gzhan dag the tshom du gyur pa la /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / gzhan dag the tshom du gyur pa la /
translated: When he said that, others had doubts,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs bstan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas gtan tshigs bstan tshigs bstan to //
translated: and he taught the reason with ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dang stong pa nyid la tha dad pa cung zad kyang med na ni byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' dang stong pa nyid la tha dad pa cung zad kyang med na ni byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If there were not the slightest difference between a bodhisattva and emptiness, then a bodhisattva would be the entity of emptiness.

original: byang chub @67b sems dpa' med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub @67b sems dpa' med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de'i phyir /
translated: Then it would follow that there is no bodhisattva.

original: 'di ltar 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore he said, ‚ÄúIt is like this: ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô is merely a name,‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid nga 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid nga 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: That is exactly what I assert.

original: khyod kyis yod do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de de ltar yod na ni byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis yod do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de de ltar yod na ni byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: If what you call ‚Äúexistence‚Äù existed in that way, then it would be a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming ngam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming ngam /
translated: or the name ‚Äúbodhisattva,‚Äù

original: byang chub la sogs pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: byang chub la sogs pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: or enlightenment, and so on.

original: de dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But all of those do not exist.

original: kun brtags pa rnams ni ming tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa rnams ni ming tsam du zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The imaginary are just names.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe stong pa nyid yod do snyam du sems pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di lta ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe stong pa nyid yod do snyam du sems pa de'i tshe /
translated: ‚Äú It is just a name, namely, ‚Äòemptiness,‚Äô‚Äù means that when one thinks ‚Äúemptiness exists,‚Äù

original: de yang rnam par brtags na ming tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang rnam par brtags na ming tsam du zad kyi /
translated: then that also, when analyzed, is just a name.

original: ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not established as an entity.

original: 'dir yang gtan la dbab mi nus nas /
analyzed: 'dir yang gtan la dbab mi nus nas /
translated: Here, if one is unable to ascertain,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: the reason is stated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gal te chos de dag med na med pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag kyang ji ltar snang /
analyzed: gal te chos de dag med na med pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag kyang ji ltar snang /
translated: If those phenomena do not exist, then how could arising and ceasing appear in what does not exist?

original: ji ltar ngan 'gro 'grib cing bde 'gro 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar ngan 'gro 'grib cing bde 'gro 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the lower realms decrease and the higher realms increase?

original: ci'i phyir sngar kun nas nyon mongs la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sngar kun nas nyon mongs la /
translated: Why would there be affliction first

original: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur snyam pa la de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa la ni skye ba med 'gag pa med /
analyzed: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur snyam pa la de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa la ni skye ba med 'gag pa med /
translated: and purification later? Therefore, for that which is essenceless, there is no arising, no ceasing,üîΩno decrease,

original: 'phel ba med /
analyzed: 'phel ba med /
translated: no increase,

original: 'grib pa med /
analyzed: 'grib pa med /
translated: There is no decrease.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
translated: There is no affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba med ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: There is no purification.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are essenceless,

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i ming la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i ming la sogs pa nas /
translated: then how could the name of a bodhisattva, and so on, up to

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bar la thug pa de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bar la thug pa de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: the essence of form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness exist ultimately?

original: de dag la skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could arising, ceasing, increasing, or decreasing, affliction, or purification exist in them?

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gcig yod par gyur na /üîΩkun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid gcig yod par gyur na / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: In this way, if an essence existed,üîΩit would be either an imagined essence

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: or an actual essence.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu med pa nyid de /
translated: The imagined essence is like an illusion and so on; it does not exist at all.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i dus na skye ba yang @68a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i dus na skye ba yang @68a * //
translated: Just as, for example, when an illusory form appears, it does not arise,

original: med / mi snang ba'i dus na 'gag pa yang med cing /
analyzed: med / mi snang ba'i dus na 'gag pa yang med cing /
translated: and when it disappears, it does not cease.

original: gcig tu gyur kyang 'grib pa med la /
analyzed: gcig tu gyur kyang 'grib pa med la /
translated: Even when it becomes one, it does not diminish,

original: mang por gyur kyang 'phel ba med de de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /üîΩrnam par byang bar gyur pa cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyang shin tu med pa'i phyir skye ba'am /
analyzed: mang por gyur kyang 'phel ba med de de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am / rnam par byang bar gyur pa cung zad kyang med pa de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams kyang shin tu med pa'i phyir skye ba'am /
translated: and even when it becomes many, it does not increase.üîΩAnd even though it is not the case that it is in any way defiled or

original: 'gag pa med la /
analyzed: 'gag pa med la /
translated: purified, in the same way, since the imagined nature is utterly nonexistent, it does not arise or cease.

original: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do //
translated: It does not increase or diminish, and it is not defiled or purified.

original: byang chub kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /üîΩde yang shin tu dben pa yongs su rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' lta bu yin pas skye ba yang med /
analyzed: byang chub kyang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de / de yang shin tu dben pa yongs su rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' lta bu yin pas skye ba yang med /
translated: Enlightenment is the perfected nature,

original: 'gag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med do //
translated: and since it is utterly isolated, it transcends all conceptualization, and since it is like space, it does not arise or cease.

original: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa yang med do //
translated: It does not increase or diminish.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: There is no defilement because of complete purity.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba yang med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba yang med de /
translated: There is no purification because of natural purity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu tshor ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu tshor ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: Form is like an illusion, feeling is like an illusion, etc.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su ston to //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su ston to //
translated: That is taught in two ways.

original: sgyu ma med pa dang / sgyu ma la 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa med par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: sgyu ma med pa dang / sgyu ma la 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa med par 'gyur ro /
translated: The non-existence of the illusion and the non-existence of the consciousness that apprehends the illusion.

original: sgyu ma ni ming tsam du zad de yul na gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: sgyu ma ni ming tsam du zad de yul na gnas pa ma yin /
translated: The illusion is just a name, it does not exist in a place,üîΩit does not exist in a direction.

original: phyogs na gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma kun brtags pa yin pas yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma kun brtags pa yin pas yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the imagined illusion does not exist.

original: sgyu ma mthong ba ni log par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mthong ba ni log par gyur pa ste /
translated: The seeing of the illusion is mistaken.üîΩIt does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni rnam par shes pa yod pa ma yin par ston to //
translated: This teaches that the consciousness does not exist.

original: de la yul na mi gnas zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid min par bstan te /
analyzed: de la yul na mi gnas zhes bya bas ni sgyu ma gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid min par bstan te /
translated: The phrase not located in a place indicates that the illusory person is not characterized by form.

original: gzugs can gyi chos rnams ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi chos rnams ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because material things are not located in a place.

original: phyogs na mi gnas zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas zhes bya bas ni gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par bstan te /
translated: The phrase not located in a direction indicates that the illusory person is not characterized by the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni yul na gnas pa ma yin du zin kyang mig la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa'i nye bar gdags pa'i phyir /üîΩphyogs na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni yul na gnas pa ma yin du zin kyang mig la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa'i nye bar gdags pa'i phyir / phyogs na gnas pa yin no //
translated: Although the things that are characterized by the formless realm, such as consciousness, are not located in a place, they are said to be located in a direction because they are designated as being located in the direction of the eye, etc.üîΩThe phrase not located in a direction indicates that the illusory person is not characterized by the formless realm.

original: log par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin par bstan pa'o //üîΩyod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: log par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa ma yin par bstan pa'o // yod pa ma yin zhes bya bas ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: The phrase not real indicates that the illusory person is not real.üîΩThe phrase not existent indicates that the illusory person is not characterized by non-entityness.

original: @68b ngo bo nyid dang bral ba zhes bya bas ni ngo bo nyid du med pa ston to //
analyzed: @68b ngo bo nyid dang bral ba zhes bya bas ni ngo bo nyid du med pa ston to //
translated: The phrase devoid of intrinsic nature indicates that the illusory person does not exist as an intrinsic nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma lta bur so sor rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma lta bur so sor rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is called the ‚Äúone who discerns as illusion-like.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva practices the perfection of wisdom in this way,

original: chos gang la yang skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: chos gang la yang skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: he does not see any dharma as arising, and so on.

original: de la kun brtags pa la ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa gnyis med de /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa la ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa gnyis med de /
translated: Among them, the imagined does not have the two of arising and ceasing,

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba tsam du zad do //
translated: but is merely appearance and non-appearance.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa gnyis med de kun brtags pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa gnyis med de kun brtags pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The dependent does not have the two of increase and decrease, but is merely imagined.

original: yongs su grub pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med de rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid du zad do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med de rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid du zad do //
translated: The perfected does not have the two of afflictive and purified, but is merely naturally pure.
