original: de ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid du med par gyur kyang /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ngo bo nyid du med par gyur kyang /
translated: Thus, although all dharmas become devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: yang the tshom bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang the tshom bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to dispel doubts,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming ni bcos ma ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni bcos ma ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause a name is a fabrication.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa'i ming dang / mtshan ma gang yin pa de dag ni bcos ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa phung po la sogs pa'i ming dang / mtshan ma gang yin pa de dag ni bcos ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Whatever names and signs there are for the aggregates, etc., such as ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù ‚Äúperception,‚Äù etc., are fabrications, and do not exist by way of their own intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, all things should be understood to be without an intrinsic nature.

original: ngo bo nyid ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bcos ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an intrinsic nature is not a fabrication.

original: bcos ma nyid ni rten cing 'brel ba'i chos de dag ni brtags pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: bcos ma nyid ni rten cing 'brel ba'i chos de dag ni brtags pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The very fabrication is taught by ‚ÄúThose dependently arisen phenomena are imagined,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par brtags pa'i rkyen la brten pa'i chos de dag la de lta de ltar brtags pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par brtags pa'i rkyen la brten pa'i chos de dag la de lta de ltar brtags pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those phenomena that are based on the causes and conditions of imagination are imagined in such and such a way, and are therefore called ‚Äúdependently arisen.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: des ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught by the following:

original: gal te gzhan la brten na ni des chos de dag gzhan gyi mthus 'byung gi rang gi mthus 'byung ba ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la brten na ni des chos de dag gzhan gyi mthus 'byung gi rang gi mthus 'byung ba ni ma yin na /
translated: If they arose in dependence on something else, then those phenomena would arise by the power of something else, not by their own power.

original: de ji ltar ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar ngo bo nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could they be intrinsic?

original: de bas na rang gi dngos po med pas de gzhan gyi dngos por gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi dngos po med pas de gzhan gyi dngos por gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since they do not have their own intrinsic reality, they become the intrinsic reality of something else.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par grub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par grub po //
translated: Thus it is established that all phenomena are without intrinsic reality.

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid med pa'i don ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don to zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúwithout intrinsic reality‚Äù is said to be the meaning of ‚Äúdependently arisen.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu yang kun brtags pa'i ming gi rgyu las ming gi tha snyad 'byung /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang kun brtags pa'i ming gi rgyu las ming gi tha snyad 'byung /
translated: After that, the expression of the name arises from the cause of the imagined name.

original: ming gi tha @69a * //üîΩsnyad kyi dbang gis de ltar mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: ming gi tha @69a * // snyad kyi dbang gis de ltar mngon par zhen par 'gyur /
translated: The expression of the nameüîΩarises from the power of the name.

original: de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis yang ming gi rgyu la rtog pa 'byung /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis yang ming gi rgyu la rtog pa 'byung /
translated: The conception of the cause of the name arises from the power of that kind of clinging.

original: de'i dbang gis yang ming gi tha snyad 'byung /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis yang ming gi tha snyad 'byung /
translated: From the power of that, the expression of the name arises.

original: ming gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis kyang yang mngon par zhen pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ming gi tha snyad kyi dbang gis kyang yang mngon par zhen pa 'byung ste /
translated: From the power of the expression of the name, clinging arises again.

original: rim pa 'di lta bur 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rim pa 'di lta bur 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this process occurs in this way, he says:

original: glo bur du btags pa'i ming gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: glo bur du btags pa'i ming gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne imputes the conventional in accordance with the name that is adventitiously designated.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa glo bur la brten nas btags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ming gi brdas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs shing mngon par brjod de 'dis ni ming gi tha snyad bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa glo bur la brten nas btags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi ming gi brdas rjes su tha snyad 'dogs shing mngon par brjod de 'dis ni ming gi tha snyad bstan to //
translated: Since it is designated in dependence upon what is adventitious and not real, one imputes the conventional in accordance with the name that is a conventional symbol of another. This demonstrates the conventional usage of names.

original: yang ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to zhes bya bas ni de mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin par ston to //
analyzed: yang ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to zhes bya bas ni de mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin par ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne becomes attached to things just as one imputes the conventional‚Äù demonstrates that this is the cause of attachment.

original: mngon par brjod pa la 'dris pa'i stobs kyis byung ba'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'di nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes mngon par zhen pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa la 'dris pa'i stobs kyis byung ba'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'di nyid chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes mngon par zhen pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the attachment arises with the thought, ‚ÄúThis is the reality of things,‚Äù due to the power of the ignorance that arises from familiarity with verbalization.

original: de ltar byis pa rnams kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byis pa rnams kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the occurrence of improper mentation in the childish,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: the passage from ‚ÄúWhen a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom‚Äù

original: ming de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rim pa bstan te /
analyzed: ming de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rim pa bstan te /
translated: up to ‚Äúhe does not see any of those names as having any essence‚Äù teaches the stages of proper mentation in the bodhisattvas.

original: ming thams cad ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rnams te /
analyzed: ming thams cad ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ming dang mtshan ma rnams te /
translated: All names refers to the names and signs that are imputed.

original: glo bur yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: glo bur yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because they are adventitious, he does not see them as having any essence.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because he does not see them, he does not become fixated on them.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa tsam kho na'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa tsam kho na'o //
translated: Because they have no essence, they are mere error.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su rtogs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de nyid rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su rtogs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa de nyid rgyas par ston to //
translated: Then, after that, it is said, Moreover, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he/she thoroughly investigates in this way, and so forth, which elaborates on that very proper mental attention.

original: gang zag byang chub sems dpa' dang / chos byang chub dang / gang zag sangs rgyas dang / chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i @69b chos kyi ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang ming tsam nyid du so sor rtog go //
analyzed: gang zag byang chub sems dpa' dang / chos byang chub dang / gang zag sangs rgyas dang / chos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i @69b chos kyi ming dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang ming tsam nyid du so sor rtog go //
translated: He/she individually investigates that the person, the bodhisattva, and the phenomena, enlightenment, are mere names, and the person, the Buddha, and the phenomena, the perfection of wisdom, and the names of phenomena such as form, and the bodhisattva, are mere names.

original: de la yang dper bstan pa /
analyzed: de la yang dper bstan pa /
translated: There, the example is taught:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na bdag bdag ces bya ba 'di ni tha snyad du brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na bdag bdag ces bya ba 'di ni tha snyad du brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, it is like this: for example, 'self' and 'self' are conventionally expressed.

original: kun rdzob tu dmigs su yod kyang don dam par stong pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs su med de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dmigs su yod kyang don dam par stong pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs su med de /
translated: Although it is found to exist conventionally, ultimately it is not found because of emptiness.

original: dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The characteristic of non-apprehension is because of the nature of non-entityness.

original: de nas yang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe dang bstun pa'i mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de nas yang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe dang bstun pa'i mjug sdud de /
translated: Then, again, ‚Äúin the same way, the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva‚Äù and so on, concludes with a comparison.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa lnga yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //üîΩde yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas rgyu med pa'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i chos rnam pa lnga yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas rgyu med pa'i phyir ming dang mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva and so on do not see the five dharmas.üîΩSince they do not see them, they do not see names and signs because there is no cause.

original: de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas rgyu med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen par mi byed do//
analyzed: de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas rgyu med pa'i phyir mngon par zhen par mi byed do//
translated: Since they do not see them, they do not cling because there is no cause.

original: gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de yang des yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mngon par zhen pa med pas mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yang mi dmigs par ston to //
analyzed: gang gis mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de yang des yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mngon par zhen pa med pas mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yang mi dmigs par ston to //
translated: Because he does not see that by which he would become attached, and he does not see that to which he would become attached.

original: mtshan ma'i brda gang yin pa dang / yang dag par ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i sems gang gis mngon par zhen par byed pa'i mtshan ma de'am sems de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i brda gang yin pa dang / yang dag par ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i sems gang gis mngon par zhen par byed pa'i mtshan ma de'am sems de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the sign by which he would become attached, or the mind by which he would become attached, which is the imagination of what is not real.

original: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i spyod pa bstan nas de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi shes rab zil gyis gnon te zhes bya bas ni de'i rgyu mthun pa ston to //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs su med pa'i spyod pa bstan nas de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi shes rab zil gyis gnon te zhes bya bas ni de'i rgyu mthun pa ston to //
translated: Having thus taught the practice of non-apprehension, subsequently, he surpasses the wisdom of all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, except for the Tathagata.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs su med pa'i spyod pa 'di la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pas gdul ba'i 'khor de dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs su med pa'i spyod pa 'di la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pas gdul ba'i 'khor de dag spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to generate enthusiasm in the retinue to be tamed by teaching the greatness of the bodhisattva who has entered this non-apprehending conduct,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mong gal gyi bu lta bu sha stag gis yongs su gang bar gyur ces bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis dbye ba ston to //üîΩ'dam bu'i tshal lam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste dper na 'dzam bu'i gling 'di dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mong gal gyi bu lta bu sha stag gis yongs su gang bar gyur ces bya ba la sogs pas dmigs kyis dbye ba ston to // 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
translated: it is said, For example, Shariputra, if this world were completely filled with monks like Shariputra and Maudgalyayana... and so forth, it teaches the distinctions.üîΩA forest of reeds,

original: 'od ma'i tshal lam /üîΩbu ram shing gi tshal lam /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal lam / bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
translated: a forest of bamboo,üîΩa forest of sugarcane,

original: smyig ma'i tshal lam /üîΩ'bras kyi zhing ngam /
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal lam / 'bras kyi zhing ngam /
translated: a forest of hemp,üîΩa field of rice,

original: til gyi zhing ltar zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: til gyi zhing ltar zhes bya ba ni //
translated: or a field of sesame.

original: @70a * // shing ljon pa dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa bas sman gyi rnam pa dag sdug pa'i phyir sman dag kho na bstan to //
analyzed: @70a * // shing ljon pa dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa bas sman gyi rnam pa dag sdug pa'i phyir sman dag kho na bstan to //
translated: Because the various types of medicine are more beautiful than trees, vines, and so forth, only the medicines are taught.

original: de dag la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And they are of three types:

original: shin tu sdug cing shin tu mtho ba dang / 'bring du sdug cing 'bring du mtho ba dang // tha mar sdug cing tha mar mtho ba rnams so //
analyzed: shin tu sdug cing shin tu mtho ba dang / 'bring du sdug cing 'bring du mtho ba dang // tha mar sdug cing tha mar mtho ba rnams so //
translated: The rice and the sesame are less beautiful and less tall.üîΩThe rice and the sesame are less beautiful and less tall.

original: de la 'dam bu dang smyig ma gnyis ni shin tu sdug cing shin tu mtho'o //üîΩbu ram shing dang smyig ma dag ni de bas dma' ste 'bring yin pa'i phyir bar du smos so //
analyzed: de la 'dam bu dang smyig ma gnyis ni shin tu sdug cing shin tu mtho'o // bu ram shing dang smyig ma dag ni de bas dma' ste 'bring yin pa'i phyir bar du smos so //
translated: The reeds and the sugar cane are very beautiful and very tall.üîΩThe rice and the sesame are less beautiful and less tall.

original: 'bras dang ti la dag ni de bas srab cing dma' bas tha ma par brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras dang ti la dag ni de bas srab cing dma' bas tha ma par brjod do //
translated: The rice and the sesame are less beautiful and less tall.üîΩThe reeds and the sugar cane are very beautiful and very tall.

analyzed: de la yang smyig ma dang 'dam bu gnyis la yang / 'dam bu khong stong du 'dug la tsher ma mang zhing de dag nyid rab tu sdug pa'i phyir sngar bstan te / smyig ma ni phyis bstan to //

original: bu ram shing dang smyig ma gnyis las kyang bu ram shing lo ma bzang zhing sdug ste /üîΩsmyig mas de tsam mi phod pas bu ram shing sngar bstan to //
analyzed: bu ram shing dang smyig ma gnyis las kyang bu ram shing lo ma bzang zhing sdug ste /üîΩsmyig mas de tsam mi phod pas bu ram shing sngar bstan to //
translated: The rice and the sesame are less beautiful and less tall.üîΩThe reeds and the sugar

original: 'bras dang til gnyis las kyang til bas 'bras che zhing sdug pas ni sngar smos so //
analyzed: 'bras dang til gnyis las kyang til bas 'bras che zhing sdug pas ni sngar smos so //
translated: Rice is larger and more beautiful than sesame seeds, so it is mentioned first.

original: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a hundredth part.üîΩIt does not approach even a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part, a millionth part, a count, a fraction, a comparison, or an example.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu dag la yang gtan la phab na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu dag la yang gtan la phab na rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: This is a fourfold classification of the same kinds of things.

original: char yongs su bcad pa 'am /
analyzed: char yongs su bcad pa 'am /
translated: It is a classification of parts,

original: bgrang ba'am / dpe'am /
analyzed: bgrang ba'am / dpe'am /
translated: a count, a comparison,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: and a cause and effect.

original: de la char yongs su bcas pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni brgya'i char yang zhes bya ba nas 'bum gyi char yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la char yongs su bcas pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni brgya'i char yang zhes bya ba nas 'bum gyi char yang zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Among them, the domain of the classification of parts is shown by ‚Äúit does not approach even a hundredth part‚Äù up to ‚Äúit does not approach even a millionth part.‚Äù

original: grangs su bgrang du mi rung bar bstan pa ni grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grangs su bgrang du mi rung bar bstan pa ni grangs dang cha dang bgrang ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The domain of the count is shown by ‚Äúa count, a fraction, and a comparison.‚ÄùüîΩThe domain of the comparison is shown by ‚Äúit does not approach even a comparison.‚Äù

original: dper byar yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni dper yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper byar yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni dper yang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not even suitable as an analogy is taught by ‚Äúnot even as an analogy.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni rgyur yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang mi rung bar bstan pa ni rgyur yang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not suitable as the state of cause and effect is taught by ‚Äúnot even as a cause.‚Äù

original: de la brgya'i char yang zhes bya ba la cha dang cha shas dang yan lag ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: de la brgya'i char yang zhes bya ba la cha dang cha shas dang yan lag ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Therein, even a hundredth part is taught by ‚Äúeven a hundredth part.‚Äù Part, portion, and branch are synonyms.

original: dge slong de dag gi shes rab de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis brgyar byas pa'i cha'am /üîΩstong du byas pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gi shes rab de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyis brgyar byas pa'i cha'am / stong du byas pa'am /
translated: The wisdom of those monks is not even a hundredth part of the wisdom of a bodhisattva.üîΩIt is not even a thousandth part.üîΩIt is not even a hundred thousandth part.

original: brgya stong du byas pa'i @70b char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brgya stong du byas pa'i @70b char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: grangs su bgrang bar yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /üîΩgang la tshig gi spyod yul du gyur pa de la ni gcig dang gnyis dang gsum zhes pa nas /
analyzed: grangs su bgrang bar yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te / gang la tshig gi spyod yul du gyur pa de la ni gcig dang gnyis dang gsum zhes pa nas /
translated: Counting is threefold:üîΩThat which is the domain of words is counted by words as one, two, three, and so on up to a hundred and a thousand.

original: brgya dang stong zhes bya ba'i bar du tshig gis bgrang ba las grangs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brgya dang stong zhes bya ba'i bar du tshig gis bgrang ba las grangs zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called counting.

original: de yang grangs su yang zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang grangs su yang zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The word also indicates that it is counted.üîΩIn the case of something that is an object of words, it is counted, and the number is indicated by one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, and ten, and so on up to a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, and so on up to a quintillion.

original: gang la tshig gi yul du gyur pa de la ni brtsi ba dang / byung ba gdab pa dang / bsdom pa dang / cha la dbri ba la sogs pa'am /üîΩshod dgod pa'am /
analyzed: gang la tshig gi yul du gyur pa de la ni brtsi ba dang / byung ba gdab pa dang / bsdom pa dang / cha la dbri ba la sogs pa'am / shod dgod pa'am /
translated: It is also indicated by one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, and so on up to one quintillion.üîΩIt is also indicated by one hundred million, one billion, one trillion, and so on up to one quintillion.üîΩIt is also indicated by one hundred million million, one billion billion, one trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion.

original: 'gron bu la sogs pa dgod pa'am /üîΩlag rtsis kyis brtsi ba dag la ni cha zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde yang char yang zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'gron bu la sogs pa dgod pa'am / lag rtsis kyis brtsi ba dag la ni cha zhes bya ba ste / de yang char yang zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: It is also indicated by one hundred million million million, one billion billion billion, one trillion trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion quintillion.üîΩIt is also indicated by one hundred million million million million, one billion billion billion billion, one trillion trillion trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion.

original: gang la de lta bur brtsi mi nus pa de la ni mngon par shes pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig gis bye ba khrag khrig phrag brgya'i cha dang zhes bya ba nas /üîΩgrangs med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bgrang ba la ni bgrang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de lta bur brtsi mi nus pa de la ni mngon par shes pa'i stobs 'ba' zhig gis bye ba khrag khrig phrag brgya'i cha dang zhes bya ba nas / grangs med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du bgrang ba la ni bgrang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is also indicated by one hundred million million million million million, one billion billion billion billion billion, one trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion.üîΩIt is also indicated by one hundred million million million million million million, one billion billion billion billion billion billion, one trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion.

original: de yang bgrang bar yang zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang bgrang bar yang zhes pas bstan to //
translated: It is also indicated by one hundred million million million million million million million, one billion billion billion billion billion billion billion, one trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion trillion, and so on up to one quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion quintillion.

original: de bzhin du kha cig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs pa ma yin du zin kyang cha shas 'ga' zhig 'ol byir 'dra ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs pa ma yin du zin kyang cha shas 'ga' zhig 'ol byir 'dra ba yang yod do //
translated: In the same way, even though there is no similarity in all respects, there is similarity in some respects.

original: de las nges par byar rung ba ni dper na smyig glang ni ba lang 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de las nges par byar rung ba ni dper na smyig glang ni ba lang 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúAn ox is like a cow.‚Äù

original: de lta bu yang med pas dper yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu yang med pas dper yang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no such example, it says ‚Äúeven as an example.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du kha cig dngos po shin tu tha dad du zin kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig dngos po shin tu tha dad du zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, even though there is a great difference in things,

original: du ba mthong nas rgyu'i dngos po las me'i blo 'byung ste /
analyzed: du ba mthong nas rgyu'i dngos po las me'i blo 'byung ste /
translated: when smoke is seen, the idea of fire arises from the state of being a cause.

original: rjes su dpag pa de lta bu yang med pas rgyur yang mi phod ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de lta bu yang med pas rgyur yang mi phod ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no such inference, it says ‚Äúnot even as a cause.‚Äù

original: gling bzhi ba ni gling bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: gling bzhi ba ni gling bzhi pa ste /
translated: The four continents is the four continents.

original: de dag stong la stong gcig ces bya'o //üîΩstong gcig pa stong la stong gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag stong la stong gcig ces bya'o // stong gcig pa stong la stong gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: One thousand of those is called one chiliocosm.üîΩOne thousand of those is called one dichiliocosm.

original: stong gnyis pa stong la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams te /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa stong la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams te /
translated: One thousand of those is called one great trichiliocosm.

original: khor yug gi ri bye ba phrag brgyal stong sum gyi stong chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khor yug gi ri bye ba phrag brgyal stong sum gyi stong chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The mountains surrounding it are called the ‚Äúgreat trichiliocosm.‚Äù

original: gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed ces bya ba ni grangs kyi bye brag yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed ces bya ba ni grangs kyi bye brag yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: ‚ÄúAs many as there are sand particles in the Ganges‚Äù is a specific number.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / 'khor de dag gi nang na kha cig gi bsam pa shes nas the tshom bsal ba'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa dang / 'khor de dag gi nang na kha cig gi bsam pa shes nas the tshom bsal ba'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Thus, having taught the greatness of the bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom, knowing the thoughts of some in that assembly, in order to dispel their doubts, the elder Shariputra asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang 'di nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa'i @71a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang 'di nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa'i @71a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavan, this is the wisdom of the sravaka stream-enterer.üîΩThis is the wisdom of the sravaka once-returner.üîΩThis is the wisdom of the sravaka nonreturner.üîΩThis is the wisdom of the sravaka arhat.

original: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the wisdom of the pratyekabuddha.üîΩThis is the wisdom of the bodhisattva.üîΩThis is the wisdom of the tathagata.

original: shes rab de dag thams cad ni tha mi dad pa /
analyzed: shes rab de dag thams cad ni tha mi dad pa /
translated: All of these wisdoms are undifferentiated,

original: dben pa / ma skyes pa /
analyzed: dben pa / ma skyes pa /
translated: isolated, and unborn.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa lags te zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi shes rab kyang gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog cing 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin no snyam nas sems can rnams the tshom skye bas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa lags te zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi shes rab kyang gnas gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog cing 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid yin no snyam nas sems can rnams the tshom skye bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpty by nature‚Äù means that the wisdom of all of them is non-conceptual and supramundane by the very nature of its transformation.

original: tha mi dad ces bya ba ni gcig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha mi dad ces bya ba ni gcig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúUndifferentiated‚Äù means that it is of the nature of unity.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIsolated‚Äù means that it is of the nature of purity.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnproduced‚Äù means that it is of the nature of the unconditioned.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpty by nature‚Äù means that it is of the nature of being free from the imagined nature which is not real.

original: tha dad du dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis glo bur pa dag ni tha dad do //
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis glo bur pa dag ni tha dad do //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferentiated‚Äù means that they are differentiated by the power of causes and conditions, and are adventitious.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinction‚Äù means difference in nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la ji ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab rang bzhin gcig pa rnams gcig la gcig zil gyis gnon pa mi rigs so zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la ji ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab rang bzhin gcig pa rnams gcig la gcig zil gyis gnon pa mi rigs so zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn what way, O Lord?‚Äù means that it is not reasonable for those of the same nature of wisdom to overpower one another.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid de la bye brag med du zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus rgyu tha dad pa dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa yod do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ngo bo nyid de la bye brag med du zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus rgyu tha dad pa dang / 'bras bu tha dad pa yod do zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat do you think, ≈öƒÅriputra?‚Äù and so on, the Lord teaches that even though there is no difference in that nature, there is a difference in cause and effect due to the power of former vows.

original: rgyu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cause is threefold:

original: bsam pa dang / spyod pa dang / bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / spyod pa dang / bya ba'o //
translated: intention, practice, and action.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The effect is twofold:

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: complete enlightenment and setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni bsam pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúendowed with the most excellent of all aspects‚Äù teaches the greatness of intention.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas zhes bya bas ni spyod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas zhes bya bas ni spyod pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: By practicing the knowledge of all aspects he shows the greatness of the practice.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa zhes bya bas ni bya ba'i tshe ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa zhes bya bas ni bya ba'i tshe ba'i bdag nyid bstan to //
translated: By working for the welfare of all sentient beings he shows the greatness of the activity.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byas te zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i bye brag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byas te zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i bye brag mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan to //
translated: By having fully awakened to all aspects of all dharmas he shows the distinction of the result, full awakening.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o zhes bya bas ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o zhes bya bas ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bstan to //
translated: By having led all sentient beings to nirvana he shows the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: de'i 'og @71b tu 'gres gsum bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og @71b tu 'gres gsum bstan te /
translated: The rest is taught by way of three triads.

original: nyan thos dang ngar sangs rgyas rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi smon lam med pa'i 'gres dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i smon lam med pa'i 'gres dang / byang chub sems dpa' la de gnyi ga yod pa'i 'gres so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ngar sangs rgyas rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi smon lam med pa'i 'gres dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i smon lam med pa'i 'gres dang / byang chub sems dpa' la de gnyi ga yod pa'i 'gres so //
translated: The first is the section on the absence of the bodhisattva's former prayers in the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, the second is the section on the absence of causal and resultant prayers in the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the third is the section on the presence of both in the bodhisattvas.

original: de la sngon gyi smon lam med pa'i 'gres ni /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi smon lam med pa'i 'gres ni /
translated: The section on the absence of former prayers is indicated by the passage beginning with:

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Sariputra?üîΩDo all the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas think thus: 'We will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood'?

original: ji ga nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad 'di snyam du bdag cag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ji ga nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad 'di snyam du bdag cag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: and ending with:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab zil gyis gnon to zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab zil gyis gnon to zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: The wisdom of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is surpassed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi smon lam ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyis ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzung /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sngon gyi smon lam ni shes rab dang snying rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyis ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bzung /
translated: The bodhisattvas' former prayers are of the nature of wisdom and compassion. By means of wisdom, they take hold of manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: snying rjes ni sems can rnams bzung nas bdag sangs rgyas te gzhan yang byang chub par bya'o zhes rnam pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: snying rjes ni sems can rnams bzung nas bdag sangs rgyas te gzhan yang byang chub par bya'o zhes rnam pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: By means of compassion, they take hold of sentient beings and engage in the two aspects of enlightenment, thinking, I will become a buddha and I will bring others to enlightenment.

original: de bas na sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'gres 'di la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'gres 'di la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in this context of former prayers, the manifest, complete enlightenment and the full liberation of sentient beings are taught.

original: de'i 'og tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i smon lam med pa'i 'gres bstan pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i smon lam med pa'i 'gres bstan pa /
translated: After that, the context of the absence of causal and resultant prayers is taught.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, ≈öƒÅriputra?

original: ji ga nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad 'di snyam du /
analyzed: ji ga nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad 'di snyam du /
translated: Do all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas think,

original: bdag cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bdag cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: We will practice the six perfections and so forth,

original: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o snyam du sems snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan te /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o snyam du sems snyam mam zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan te /
translated: The passage continues up to the point where it says, ‚ÄúI will lead all sentient beings to complete nirvana.‚Äù

original: 'gres 'di la bdag nyid yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba ste rgyu bzhi dang ;
analyzed: 'gres 'di la bdag nyid yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba ste rgyu bzhi dang ;
translated: Here, the four causes are presented: maturing oneself, maturing sentient beings, purifying a buddhafield, and maturing the qualities of a buddha.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba zhes bya ba'i bas bu gnyis dang / chos drug bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sems can yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba zhes bya ba'i bas bu gnyis dang / chos drug bstan to //
translated: The two results are presented: complete enlightenment and leading sentient beings to complete nirvana.

original: spyod pa'i dus kyi smon lam 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: spyod pa'i dus kyi smon lam 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The prayer for the time of action will come later.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la de gnyis ka yod par bstan pa'i 'gres @72a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la de gnyis ka yod par bstan pa'i 'gres @72a * //
translated: The following passage shows that both of these are present in the bodhisattva:

original: ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' ni 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o snyam du sems so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o snyam du sems so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: The passage from I will liberate all sentient beings up to this point teaches the bodhisattva's compassion.

original: de'i 'og tu nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi dpe srin bu me khyer gyis bstan pa dang / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i dpe nyi ma 'char bas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi dpe srin bu me khyer gyis bstan pa dang / de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i dpe nyi ma 'char bas bstan pa ste /
translated: After that, the example of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is taught by the firefly, and after that, the example of the bodhisattva is taught by the rising sun.

original: dpe'i 'gres gnyis kyi don ni gsal bar bstan pas yang don bstan mi dgos so //
analyzed: dpe'i 'gres gnyis kyi don ni gsal bar bstan pas yang don bstan mi dgos so //
translated: Since the meaning of the two examples is clearly taught, it is not necessary to teach the meaning again.

original: yang de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis 'khor gyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis 'khor gyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to clear away the doubts of the retinue, the elder Subh≈´ti says,üîΩBhagavƒÅn, how are bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: and so on.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa'i gnas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa'i gnas dang / byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba'i gnas gsum zhus pa dang / de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa dang po 'das nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa'i gnas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa'i gnas dang / byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba'i gnas gsum zhus pa dang / de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa dang po 'das nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: He asked about the stage that transcends the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the stage of attaining irreversibility, and the stage of training in the path to enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rtog pa'i rgyus nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rtog pa'i rgyus nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Then the BhagavƒÅn explained that after the first incalculable eon had passed, from the generation of the mind called ‚ÄúVery Joyful‚Äù up to the realization of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness of all phenomena, one transcends the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag las 'das nas sa brgyad pa la phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag las 'das nas sa brgyad pa la phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Having transcended those, on the eighth ground one becomes irreversible.

original: rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar bstan to //
translated: He taught that the perfections of complete maturation purify the path to enlightenment.

original: yang ci nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das ma thag tu /
analyzed: yang ci nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das ma thag tu /
translated: Again, immediately after transcending the levels of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas,üîΩ

original: de dag gis mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ram /üîΩ'on te dus gzhan zhig na 'gyur snyam du gnas brtan yid gnyis su gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag gis mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ram / 'on te dus gzhan zhig na 'gyur snyam du gnas brtan yid gnyis su gyur nas /
translated: Moreover, does one become an object of worship immediately after passing beyond the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas?üîΩOr does one become so at some other time?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang la gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang la gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: The elder had doubts about this, and so he asked the Blessed One, ‚ÄúBlessed One, when one is abiding in what?‚Äù and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma sems dang po bskyed phyin chad ces bya ba la sogs pas sa rab tu dga' ba thob ma thag tu mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma sems dang po bskyed phyin chad ces bya ba la sogs pas sa rab tu dga' ba thob ma thag tu mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Then the Blessed One taught that one becomes an object of worship immediately upon attaining the ground of Supreme Joy, with the passage beginning, ‚ÄúFrom the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment. ‚Äù

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la brten nas dge ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de'i gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: With the passage beginning, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, it is like this: all good qualities arise in the world on the basis of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva,‚Äù he taught the reason for that.

original: @72b de'i 'og tu chos de dag bstan pa la 'gres gsum ste zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan pa'i 'gres dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan pa'i 'gres so //
analyzed: @72b de'i 'og tu chos de dag bstan pa la 'gres gsum ste zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan pa'i 'gres dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan pa'i 'gres so //
translated: After that, there are three repetitions for teaching those dharmas: the repetition for teaching contaminated and uncontaminated virtuous dharmas, the repetition for teaching the maturation of contaminated virtuous dharmas, and the repetition for teaching the maturation of uncontaminated virtuous dharmas.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres la ni /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos bstan pa'i 'gres la ni /
translated: Among those, in the repetition for teaching contaminated and uncontaminated virtuous dharmas,

original: khyim pa dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i chos bstan pa dang / nyan thos kyi chos bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i chos bstan pa dang / nyan thos kyi chos bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa ste /
translated: there are three repetitions: teaching the Dharma to householders, teaching the Dharma to male and female lay practitioners, and teaching the Dharma to ≈õrƒÅvakas and buddhas.

original: 'gres gsum bstan to //
analyzed: 'gres gsum bstan to //
translated: These three repetitions are taught.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba chos de gsum ni tshul khrims dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i chos so //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba chos de gsum ni tshul khrims dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma'i chos so //
translated: The three dharmas of morality, the morality of the upasaka and upasika, the ten paths of virtuous action, the morality endowed with five limbs, and the morality endowed with eight limbs,

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i lam gyi mtha' la thug gi bar dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i lam gyi mtha' la thug gi bar dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
translated: the dharmas of the sravaka, from the path of meditation up to the end,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas byed pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mtha' la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas byed pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: and the dharmas of the Buddha, from the perfections up to the end with the unshared qualities of the Buddha, which are the dharmas that make a Buddha.

original: de'i 'go dge ba'i chos de dag 'jig rten du byung bas rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams bstan pas ni /
analyzed: de'i 'go dge ba'i chos de dag 'jig rten du byung bas rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag yod pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams bstan pas ni /
translated: The statement because these virtuous dharmas have appeared in the world, there are great sal-tree like ksatriya families and so on, indicates the sentient beings belonging to the desire, form and formless realms.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
translated: The maturation of contaminated virtue has been taught.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bstan pas ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bstan pas ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bstan to //
translated: The appearance in the world of Stream-enterers, etc. teaches the appearance of all the Listeners and the Self-realized Buddhas. The appearance of the Perfectly Awakened Ones teaches the maturation of uncontaminated virtue.

original: sbyin pa yongs su sbyong zhes bya ba ni gang de la sbyin pa byed pa de dag 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la sbyin pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su sbyong zhes bya ba ni gang de la sbyin pa byed pa de dag 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la sbyin pa yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Purifying generosity means that those who practice generosity in regard to that [giving] will have a great result and will be purified.

original: sbyin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: sbyin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid de /
translated: Because generosity is extremely pure means that this is the reality of the bodhisattva's generosity.

original: sbyin pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: sbyin pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: It shows that [the bodhisattva] is a giver.

original: de ltar ji ltar brtson par bya ba bstan @73a * //
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar brtson par bya ba bstan @73a * //
translated: Thus, having taught how one should strive,

original: nas / de ni brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nas / de ni brtson par byed pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach what the characteristics of one who is diligent are,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa dang / de nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson pa zhes bgyi ba lags zhes zhus pa dang / de nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang /
translated: Subh≈´ti asks, ‚ÄúBlessed One, how is it that a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who is diligent in the perfection of wisdom is said to be diligent?‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbang gis chos thams cad so sor phung po bdun du bsdus te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbang gis chos thams cad so sor phung po bdun du bsdus te /
translated: Then, by the power of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena being included in the seven groups of phenomena‚Äîthe aggregates, elements, sense bases, noble truths,üîΩdependent origination, and all phenomena‚Äî

original: rnam pa bdun gyis stong pa nyid la spyod pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis stong pa nyid la spyod pa na /
translated: when one practices emptiness with the seven aspects,

original: de tsam gyis brtson par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir re zhig brtson pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis brtson par bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir re zhig brtson pa zhes kyang mi bya'o //
translated: since that alone does not complete the practice, it is not called ‚Äúdiligent‚Äù for the time being.

original: brtson par bya ba brtsams pa'i phyir brtson pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir brtson zhe 'am mi brtson zhes mi brjod do zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: brtson par bya ba brtsams pa'i phyir brtson pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir brtson zhe 'am mi brtson zhes mi brjod do zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Translation: ‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æ©‡Ωº‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ωò‡ºã‡Ω°‡Ω≤‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ωì‡Ωº‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡ΩÄ‡æ±‡ΩÑ‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æó‡Ωº‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ωî‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωò‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ωñ‡æ±‡Ω†‡Ωº‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¶‡æü‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ωî‡Ω†‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ωï‡æ±‡Ω≤‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æ©‡Ωº‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡ºã‡Ω†‡Ωò‡ºç‡Ωò‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æ©‡Ωº‡Ωì‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωò‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æó‡Ωº‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ωë‡Ωº‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡ΩÇ‡Ω¶‡Ω¥‡ΩÑ‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ω¶‡Ωº‡ºã‡ºç‡ºç

original: 'o na ji ltar na brtson pa yin snyam du the tshom za ba la de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na brtson pa yin snyam du the tshom za ba la de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: How then is one diligent?üîΩ

original: de skad ces gsungs nas gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang /
analyzed: de skad ces gsungs nas gzugs la sogs pa so so'i bye brag gi ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dang /
translated: Having said that, the nature of each individual thing, such as form, is not observed, the nature of the composite is not observed, the individual characteristics are not observed, and all phenomena are not observed.

original: rnam pa bzhis stong pa nyid la spyod na brtson pa zhes bya bar ston te /üîΩ'di ltar des gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis stong pa nyid la spyod na brtson pa zhes bya bar ston te /üîΩ'di ltar des gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It shows that if one practices emptiness in four ways, it is called ‚Äúendeavor.‚ÄùüîΩThus, it is said that one does not see form as a thing that arises or a thing that ceases.

original: rang byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mtha' la thug gi bar gyis rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: rang byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mtha' la thug gi bar gyis rgyas par bstan to //
translated: In this way, the Buddha taught in detail up to the point where he said, ‚ÄúI do not see any such thing as the fruit of a once-returner, a non-returner, an arhat, individual enlightenment, buddhahood, or enlightenment.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar des gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i ngo bo nyid dam 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam 'gag pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i ngo bo nyid dam 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In this passage, the phrase ‚Äúa dharma that has the quality of arising‚Äù means ‚Äúa dharma that has the nature of arising.‚Äù

original: gal te gzugs skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs skye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If form had the nature of arising, it would not have the nature of ceasing.

original: gal te 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na skye ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na skye ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it had the nature of ceasing, it would not have the nature of arising.

original: dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a single thing to have two natures.

original: gal te gzugs la skyes ba zhes bya ba'i chos @73b shig yod na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la skyes ba zhes bya ba'i chos @73b shig yod na yang /
translated: If form were a dharma that arises,

original: bdag las skye ba'am /
analyzed: bdag las skye ba'am /
translated: it would arise either from itself,

original: gzhan las skye'am /
analyzed: gzhan las skye'am /
translated: from another,üîΩfrom both,

original: gnyis ka las skye'am /
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye'am /
translated: Or do they arise from both?üîΩ

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ram zhes rnam par rtog pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ram zhes rnam par rtog pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: There are four alternatives:

original: de la bdag las skye ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la bdag las skye ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that something arises from itself.

original: de'i tshe chos ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the phenomenon has not arisen.

original: med pa'i bdag nyid ni skye ba'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i bdag nyid ni skye ba'i rgyur mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not suitable for a nonexistent entity to be the cause of arising.

original: gal te skye ba'i sngon rol na chos de yod par 'gyur du ni de yang mi rigs te yod pa ni yang skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i sngon rol na chos de yod par 'gyur du ni de yang mi rigs te yod pa ni yang skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the phenomenon existed prior to arising, that also is not logical because it is not logical that an existent arises again.

original: yod pa las skye bar rtag na ni dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa las skye bar rtag na ni dus thams cad du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is logical that something arises from an existent, it would arise at all times.

original: nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would never not arise.

original: de bas bdag la skye ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas bdag la skye ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, arising from itself is not logical.

original: gzhan las skye ba yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba yang mi rigs te /
translated: Arising from another is also not logical.

original: gal te gzhan las gzhan dag skye bar 'gyur na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las gzhan dag skye bar 'gyur na ni thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If something arose from another, everything would arise from everything.

original: gnyis ka las skye zhes bya bar yang skyon de gnyis las mi thar ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye zhes bya bar yang skyon de gnyis las mi thar ro //
translated: If it is said that something arises from both, the error of both of those is not avoided.

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that it arises without a cause,

original: thams cad du thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would arise everywhere from everything.

original: de ltar rnam par dpyad na don dam par skye ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dpyad na don dam par skye ba med de /
translated: Thus, when analyzed, ultimately there is no arising.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji skad du bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: ji skad du bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from itself, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,üîΩthere is no existence of things

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: anywhere through any arising.

original: 'gag pa'i chos can du 'ang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can du 'ang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that it has the attribute of ceasing,

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise.

original: 'di ltar skyes pa ni 'gag par 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa ni 'gag par 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that which has arisen ceases, but that which has not arisen does not cease.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'gag pa zhes bya ba'i chos shig yod par gyur na ni yod pa'am med pa'i chos shig yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'gag pa zhes bya ba'i chos shig yod par gyur na ni yod pa'am med pa'i chos shig yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, if a phenomenon called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù exists, it would be either an existent or a nonexistent phenomenon.

original: de la yod na ni 'gag par mi 'thad de //
analyzed: de la yod na ni 'gag par mi 'thad de //
translated: If it is existent, it is untenable that it ceases,

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis dngos po gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis dngos po gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for existence and nonexistence to be one thing.

original: med pa yang 'gag par mi 'thad de med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang 'gag par mi 'thad de med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is also untenable that a nonexistent ceases, because it is nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la 'gag pa yod do zhes byar mi dung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong gi rva la 'gag pa yod do zhes byar mi dung ste /
translated: Thus, one should not say that the horn of a rabbit ceases.

original: dngos po kun gyi skye ba dag mi 'thad pa ni gang yin pa //üîΩde nyid dngos po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi skye ba dag mi 'thad pa ni gang yin pa // de nyid dngos po thams cad kyi //
translated: The non-tenability of the arising of all things

original: 'gag pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: is precisely the non-tenability of the cessation of all things.

original: yod pa dang ni med pa gnyis //
analyzed: yod pa dang ni med pa gnyis //
translated: Existence and nonexistence

original: gcig la 'thad pa ma yin no //üîΩyod pa min pa'i dngos po la //
analyzed: gcig la 'thad pa ma yin no // yod pa min pa'i dngos po la //
translated: are not tenable for a single thing.

original: 'gag pa 'thad pa ma yin te /üîΩji ltar mgo la lan gnyis su //
analyzed: 'gag pa 'thad pa ma yin te / ji ltar mgo la lan gnyis su //
translated: Cessation is not tenableüîΩfor a nonexistent thing.üîΩJust as it is impossible

original: bcad @74a * //
analyzed: bcad @74a * //
translated: to cut off a head twice,

original: du med pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: du med pa de bzhin no //
translated: so it is with cessation.

original: zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: This is also explained.

original: de bas na skye ba zhes bya ba dang / 'gag pa zhes bya ba de ni kun brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba zhes bya ba dang / 'gag pa zhes bya ba de ni kun brtags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, what is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and what is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù are imputed.

original: tha snyad tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni med do //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni med do //
translated: They are mere conventions, but ultimately they do not exist.

original: de bas na gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so // de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: He also does not see them as having the nature of cessation.üîΩSimilarly, it is not tenable that form and so on are afflicted

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'thad de /
translated: or purified.

original: gal te dngos po rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If things have the nature of affliction,

original: ngo bo nyid ni btang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nam yang rnam par byang bar ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni btang bar mi nus pa'i phyir nam yang rnam par byang bar ma 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be purified, because a nature cannot be relinquished.

original: gal te rnam par byang zhing yongs su dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ngo bo nyid btang du mi rung ba'i phyir nam yang chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa zhig yin na kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gal te rnam par byang zhing yongs su dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ngo bo nyid btang du mi rung ba'i phyir nam yang chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang gal te chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa zhig yin na kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
translated: If they have the nature of purification and complete purity, they will never be afflicted, because a nature cannot be relinquished.üîΩMoreover, if things are afflicted, they would be afflicted

original: rnam par dag pa las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las 'gyur grang na /
translated: either as afflicted or as purified.

original: gal te kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If those that are already thoroughly afflicted were to become thoroughly afflicted again, then affliction would be pointless,

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur zin pa rnams la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed mi dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur zin pa rnams la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed mi dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no fear that those that are already thoroughly afflicted will generate affliction again.

original: yang gcig kun kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dang yang skye ba nam yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gcig kun kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dang yang skye ba nam yang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, one who is thoroughly afflicted again and again would never become purified.

original: rnam par dag pa rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'thad de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnams kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'thad de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not tenable that those that are already purified become thoroughly afflicted again, because that is contradictory.

original: dngos po gcig la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa gnyis cig car 'byung ba mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that both affliction and purification occur simultaneously in a single entity,

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du rnam par byang ba yang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis med pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du rnam par byang ba yang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
translated: because there is no second nature.üîΩSimilarly, it is not tenable that purification occurs in that which is already thoroughly afflicted,

original: rnam par dag pa las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las 'gyur grang na /
translated: or that affliction occurs in that which is already purified.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa la ni rnam par byang ba med de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa la ni rnam par byang ba med de /
translated: There is no purification for that which is thoroughly afflicted,

original: chos de gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two dharmas are contradictory.

original: rnam par dag pa yang rnam par byang bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang rnam par byang bar mi rigs te /
translated: Nor is it tenable that that which is pure is purified,

original: rnam par dag pas don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pas don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because purification would be pointless.

original: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par bang ba don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par bang ba don dam par yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, affliction and purification do not exist ultimately,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid la so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs @74b pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid la so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs @74b pa la /
translated: but in the suchness that is pure by nature, the adventitious afflictions are designated as affliction in the state of ordinary beings,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gdags shing rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la rnam par byang ba zhes gdags par zad de /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid du ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gdags shing rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa la rnam par byang ba zhes gdags par zad de / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid du ni mi rigs so //
translated: and the absence of adventitious afflictions is designated as purification in the state of purity.üîΩBut it is not tenable that they are the reality of form and so on.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that form is a dharma that is thoroughly afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: One does not see them as having the nature of purification.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the mode of non-entityness of form and so on,

original: da ni gzugs ni tshor ba dang lhan cig yang dag par 'du zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus pa la phung po'i mtshan nyid med par ston te phung po zhes bya ba ni spungs pa zhes byaüîΩba'i don yin la /
analyzed: da ni gzugs ni tshor ba dang lhan cig yang dag par 'du zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dus pa la phung po'i mtshan nyid med par ston te phung po zhes bya ba ni spungs pa zhes bya ba'i don yin la /
translated: now, in the passage beginning ‚ÄúOne does not see form as truly existent together with feeling,‚Äù he teaches that the aggregates do not have the characteristics of aggregates in the context of their being assembled. The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is ‚Äúheap.‚Äù

original: sbungs pa yang dag par 'du ba yod na srid par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sbungs pa yang dag par 'du ba yod na srid par 'gyur na /
translated: If a heap, an assembly, were to exist, it would be possible to have existence.

original: ji ltar chos rnams la yang dag par 'du ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams la yang dag par 'du ba med de /
translated: But how can phenomena be truly assembled?

original: de bas na phung po'i mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po'i mtshan nyid kyang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he teaches that they do not have the characteristics of aggregates.

original: chos rnams lhan cig yang dag par 'dun yang /
analyzed: chos rnams lhan cig yang dag par 'dun yang /
translated: Even if phenomena were truly assembled,

original: 'khrul pa yod pa'am mtshan nyid gcig pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yod pa'am mtshan nyid gcig pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: they would be either mistaken or have the same characteristics.

original: gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'khrul pa med pa ma yin zhing mtshan nyid tha dad do //
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'khrul pa med pa ma yin zhing mtshan nyid tha dad do //
translated: Form is not non-erroneously mixed with feeling, etc., and their characteristics are different.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzugs dang lhan cig yang dag par 'du ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzugs dang lhan cig yang dag par 'du ba mi rigs so //
translated: Similarly, it is not reasonable that feeling, etc., are correctly mixed with form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyang mtshan nyid so so tha dad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyang mtshan nyid so so tha dad de /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, dispositions, and consciousness also have their own individual characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid so so zhing shin tu tha dad pa de dag ji ltar phung po'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan nyid so so zhing shin tu tha dad pa de dag ji ltar phung po'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu yang dag par 'du bar 'gyur /
translated: How could those that are very different in their individual characteristics be correctly mixed into a single essential nature of a heap?

original: gzhan yang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa las gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtags pa ste /
