analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa las gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that which is the nature of form and feeling, etc., apart from form and feeling, etc., is imagined.

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin par rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin par rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Like an illusion, it is empty of essence.

original: de la ji ltar sgyu ma'i dngos po rta dang glang po che la sogs pa don dam pa gcig tu 'du ba med pa de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang gcig tu 'du ba med do //
analyzed: de la ji ltar sgyu ma'i dngos po rta dang glang po che la sogs pa don dam pa gcig tu 'du ba med pa de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang gcig tu 'du ba med do //
translated: Just as the illusory things, horses, elephants, and so on, are not ultimately included in one, so also the imagined forms and so on are not included in one.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: The nature of the reality of forms and so on is just emptiness by intrinsic reality.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas ni ji ltar @75a * //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas ni ji ltar @75a * //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúbecause of emptiness by intrinsic reality‚Äù shows how,

original: nam mkha' nam mkha' dang lhan cig 'du ba med pa ltar chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: nam mkha' nam mkha' dang lhan cig 'du ba med pa ltar chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes ston to //
translated: just as space is not included with space, so also the forms and so on of reality are not included with them.

original: 'di ni sgo tsam zhig bstan par thad de /üîΩ'di ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
analyzed: 'di ni sgo tsam zhig bstan par thad de / 'di ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
translated: This is just an indication of the door.üîΩThus, form is not included with feeling and so on,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzugs dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang gzugs dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
translated: and feeling and so on are not included with form.

original: tshor ba ni 'du shes pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med 'du shes la sogs pa yang tshor ba dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
analyzed: tshor ba ni 'du shes pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med 'du shes la sogs pa yang tshor ba dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
translated: Feeling does not co-occur with perception and so on. Perception and so on do not co-occur with feeling.

original: 'du shes ni 'du byed la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du byed la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
translated: Perception does not co-occur with formation and so on.

original: 'du byed la sogs pa yang 'du shes dang lhan cig 'du ba med /üîΩ'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa yang 'du shes dang lhan cig 'du ba med / 'du byed ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba med /
translated: Formation and so on do not co-occur with perception.üîΩFormation does not co-occur with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa yang 'du byed dang lhan cig 'du ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang 'du byed dang lhan cig 'du ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: Consciousness does not co-occur with formation.

original: da ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi mtshan nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi mtshan nyid bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to dispel the characteristics of form and so on,

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: it is taught that ‚ÄúThe emptiness of form is not form‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid la brtson par byas na gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi snang gi /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid la brtson par byas na gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi snang gi /
translated: If one exerts oneself in this way with respect to emptiness, the imagined forms and so on will not appear as the characteristics of form and so on.

original: de dag stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: de dag stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du snang ste /
translated: They appear as the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de'i tshe gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dag gzugs ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dag gzugs ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the emptiness of form is not form.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid la brtson par byas na gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi snang gi /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid la brtson par byas na gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi snang gi /
translated: Thus, when one exerts oneself in emptiness, the imagined forms, etc. do not appear as the characteristics of form, etc.

original: de dag stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzugs zhes bya na /
analyzed: de dag stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzugs zhes bya na /
translated: But if they are called ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc. in the sense of the characteristic of emptiness,

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la ni gzugs su med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la ni gzugs su med de /
translated: then emptiness is not form,

original: de'i phyir gzugs ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ma yin no /
translated: and therefore it is not form.

original: 'di ltar tshor bar byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor bar byed pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no feeling,

original: de'i phyir tshor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not feeling.

original: 'di ltar 'dus nas shes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus nas shes pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no consciousness of a composite,

original: de'i phyir 'du shes ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not perception.

original: 'di ltar mngon par 'du byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par 'du byed pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no active formation,

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it is not formation.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid de la rnam par shes par byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid de la rnam par shes par byed pa med de /
translated: Thus, there is no consciousness of emptiness,üîΩand therefore it is not consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid bsal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid bsal te /
translated: In this way, the intrinsic identity of form and so on is refuted.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / gal te @75b gzugs la sogs pa gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du med na /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / gal te @75b gzugs la sogs pa gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du med na /
translated: When this was said, since the sound of form and so on would be without an object if form and so on did not exist as the identity of that which is suitable to be form and so on,

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra yul med par 'gyur ro snyam du the tshom zos nas /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra yul med par 'gyur ro snyam du the tshom zos nas /
translated: doubt arose, thinking, ‚ÄúWell then, the sound of form and so on would be without an object.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Since the sound of form and so on refers to the intrinsic reality of form and so on,üîΩform and so on are not different from emptiness.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa med par gzugs kyang rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa la tha dad pa med par gzugs kyang rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Form is not intrinsically real,

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and emptiness is not different.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin la gzugs kyang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Emptiness is not different, and form is not different.

original: de bas na thams cad du yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni stong pa nyid la bya ste /üîΩstong pa nyid kyi sgra yang chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la bya bar gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni stong pa nyid la bya ste / stong pa nyid kyi sgra yang chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la bya bar gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in all cases, the words ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on refer to emptiness.üîΩThe word ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù refers to the emptiness of the reality of form and so on.

original: sngar smos pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad bstan to //
analyzed: sngar smos pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad bstan to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúform itself is emptiness, and emptiness itself is form‚Äù teaches that all aspects are taught by the emptiness mentioned previously.

original: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu stong pa nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, emptiness does not arise or cease‚Äù and so on teaches that emptiness is not subject to arising and cessation.

original: 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med pa ste /
translated: It is not diminished and not increased.

original: 'das pa 'ang ma yin /üîΩma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa 'ang ma yin / ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not past,üîΩnot future,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par phyir chos thams cad kyang de la dmigs su med de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin no // gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par phyir chos thams cad kyang de la dmigs su med de /
translated: and not present.üîΩSince it is not the characteristic of form and so on, all phenomena are not observed in it.

original: de bas na chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de la ni gzugs med do //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de la ni gzugs med do //
translated: Therefore, in that which is not observed, all phenomena, there is no form.

original: tshor ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba med do //
translated: There is no feeling.

original: 'du shes med do zhes bya ba nas /üîΩsangs rgyas med do //
analyzed: 'du shes med do zhes bya ba nas / sangs rgyas med do //
translated: There is no discernment.üîΩThere is no awakening.

original: byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ston to //
analyzed: byang chub med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ston to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that there is no buddha.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu gcig gis brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu gcig gis brtson pa'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the characteristics of diligence in this way through eleven aspects,

original: de'i 'og tu bdag la brtson zhes bya ba dang / mi brtson zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams la brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag la brtson zhes bya ba dang / mi brtson zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams la brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang /
translated: he then teaches the elimination of the concepts of ‚ÄúI am diligent‚Äù and ‚ÄúI am not diligent,‚Äù the elimination of the concepts of ‚Äúdiligence‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-diligence‚Äù with regard to the doors of liberation,

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams mtha' dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mtha' rnams gcig la gcig sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brtson pa dang / mi brtson pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams mtha' dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mtha' rnams gcig la gcig sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang /
translated: the elimination of the concepts of ‚Äúdiligence‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-diligence‚Äù with regard to the intrinsic characteristics of phenomena, the elimination of the connection of phenomena with extremes, and the elimination of the connection of extremes with each other.

original: chos rnams dus gsum dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams rnam @76a * //üîΩpa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos thams cad 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos thams cad rtag pa la sogs pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang /
analyzed: chos rnams dus gsum dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams rnam @76a * // pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos thams cad 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos thams cad rtag pa la sogs pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang /
translated: It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with the three times.üîΩIt is to completely avoid associating phenomena with omniscience. It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with arising and ceasing. It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with permanence and so forth.

original: de dag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams 'dres par sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa'i bya ba dang sbyor ba yongs su spang pa dang /
analyzed: de dag nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / chos rnams 'dres par sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa dang sbyor ba yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par shes pa'i bya ba dang sbyor ba yongs su spang pa dang /
translated: It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with the doors of liberation. It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with mixing. It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with superknowledge. It is to completely avoid associating phenomena with the activities of superknowledge.

original: 'du ba dang bral ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / stong pa nyid la sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba ste /
analyzed: 'du ba dang bral ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / stong pa nyid la sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba ste /
translated: the aspect of impermanence, the aspect of pain, the aspect of emptiness, the aspect of selflessness, the aspect of detachment, the aspect of cessation, the aspect of calm, the aspect of excellence, the aspect of escape, the aspect of the body, the aspect of the feelings, the aspect of mind, the aspect of dharmas, the aspect of the knowledge of suffering, the aspect of the abandonment of origination, the aspect of the realization of cessation, and the aspect of the cultivation of the path.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug gis stong pa nyid la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug gis stong pa nyid la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bstan to //
translated: Thus, when one practices emptiness with these sixteen aspects, one is said to be striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gzugs la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la gzugs la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Here, one does not see form as either striving or not striving.

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni bdag la byed pa po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni bdag la byed pa po la sogs par rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that there is no conceptualization of the self as an agent, etc., and the engagement of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù does not occur.

original: stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa na /
translated: One does not join emptiness with emptiness.

original: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan zhig yod do snyam du bsgoms na ni /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos gzhan zhig yod do snyam du bsgoms na ni /
translated: If one meditates thinking that there is some other phenomenon called emptiness,

original: de'i tshe stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang / stong pa nyid sbyor bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang / stong pa nyid sbyor bar 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time, emptiness would have an intrinsic reality and emptiness would be joined with something else.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyi rnam par yang rnam pa med par bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyi rnam par yang rnam pa med par bsgom pa ste /
translated: But it is not like that. One meditates on the non-apprehension of all phenomena, and even the aspect of emptiness is meditated on as without aspects.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúemptiness is not joined with emptiness.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Nor is it the yoga of emptiness. The yoga of emptiness is the meditative stabilization of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de yang stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dang mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de yang stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dang mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That yoga of emptiness is not joined with another intrinsic reality of the yoga of emptiness.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i chos gzhan du rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos gzhan du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i chos gzhan du rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos gzhan du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, one should apply ‚Äúnon-conceptualization of other phenomena as signless‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-conceptualization of other phenomena as wishless.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid ni rnal 'byor yang ma yin /üîΩrnal 'byor ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid ni rnal 'byor yang ma yin / rnal 'byor ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is neither yoga nor not yoga.

original: 'di ltar stong @76b pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa gzhan thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi rnam pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong @76b pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa gzhan thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi rnam pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Thus, emptiness is free from the aspect of yoga of all other imagined forms and so on.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not yoga.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis brjod du med cing mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis brjod du med cing mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, it is inexpressible and has the nature of signless concentration.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma yin pa yang ma yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor ma yin pa yang ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is not not yoga.

original: gzugs mi sbyor mi 'byed ces bya ba ni chos kyi gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi gzugs su yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par ma mthong bas mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs mi sbyor mi 'byed ces bya ba ni chos kyi gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi gzugs su yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par ma mthong bas mi sbyor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not unite or divide form‚Äù means that one does not unite it, because one does not see the characteristics of form, etc., as having the nature of form, etc., which is empty of intrinsic identity.

original: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya ba yin pas mi 'byed do //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya ba yin pas mi 'byed do //
translated: One does not divide it, because it is to be cultivated as having the nature of reality.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúOne enters into the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of things. ‚Äù

original: gzugs dang sngon gyi mthar mi sbyor zhes bya ba bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: gzugs dang sngon gyi mthar mi sbyor zhes bya ba bka' stsal nas /
translated: Having said, ‚ÄúOne does not unite form with the prior limit, ‚Äù

original: 'di ltar sngon gyi mtha' nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gtan tshigs kyang nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon gyi mtha' nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gtan tshigs kyang nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: he also stated the reason, ‚ÄúOne does not see the prior limit itself. ‚Äù

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dus gsum nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dus gsum nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: One does not see the three times, such as the prior limit, etc., as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na ji ltar sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na ji ltar sbyar bar bya /
translated: If one does not see them as real, how can one unite them?

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi pa'i mthar mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha'i las de'i rnam par smin pa phyi ma'i mtha' 'di 'dra ba myong ngo zhes las dang 'bras bu dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod na sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar sbyor ba dang
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi pa'i mthar mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha'i las de'i rnam par smin pa phyi ma'i mtha' 'di 'dra ba myong ngo zhes las dang 'bras bu dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod na sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar sbyor ba dang
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not connect the prior limit with the later limit‚Äù means that if one engages in the view that karma and its result are objects that are perceived, thinking, ‚ÄúThe ripening of that karma of the prior limit is experienced in this way in the later limit,‚Äù

original: / phyi ma'i mtha' dang yang sngon gyi mthar sbyor ro zhes bya'o //üîΩsngon gyi mtha'i las de'i rnam par smin pa ni da ltar byung ba na 'di yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa la spyod na sngon gyi mtha' dang da ltar byung bar sbyor ba dang / da ltar byung ba yang sngon gyi mthar sbyor ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / phyi ma'i mtha' dang yang sngon gyi mthar sbyor ro zhes bya'o // sngon gyi mtha'i las de'i rnam par smin pa ni da ltar byung ba na 'di yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa la spyod na sngon gyi mtha' dang da ltar byung bar sbyor ba dang / da ltar byung ba yang sngon gyi mthar sbyor ro zhes bya'o //
translated: then one connects the prior limit with the later limit and the later limit with the prior limit.üîΩ‚ÄúOne does not connect the prior limit with the present‚Äù means that if one engages in the view that conceptualizes, ‚ÄúThe ripening of that karma of the prior limit is present now,‚ÄùüîΩthen one connects the prior limit with the present and the present with the prior limit.

original: da ltar byung ba na las byas pas phyi ma'i mthar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes spyod na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na las byas pas phyi ma'i mthar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes spyod na /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not connect the present with the later limit‚Äù means that if one engages in the view that thinks, ‚ÄúKarma that is committed in the present will ripen in the later limit,‚ÄùüîΩthen one connects the present with the later limit and the later limit with the present.

original: da ltar byung ba dang phyi ma'i mthar sbyor ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar byung bar sbyor ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang phyi ma'i mthar sbyor ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar byung bar sbyor ro zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the connection of the present with the past and future, and the connection of the past and future with the present.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba la ni dus tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba la ni dus tha dad pa med de /
translated: In the vision of the equality of the three times, there is no difference in time,

original: bdag nyid thams cad du dus mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad du dus mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entire self is not perceived in time.

original: de bas na dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the equality of the three times.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang 'das par mi sbyor zhes bya ba bka' stsal nas 'di ltar 'das pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nyid kyis gtan @77a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'das par mi sbyor zhes bya ba bka' stsal nas 'di ltar 'das pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nyid kyis gtan @77a * //
translated: Having said, ‚Äúform is not connected with the past,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúin this way, one does not see even the past as real.‚Äù

original: tshigs gsungs te /
analyzed: tshigs gsungs te /
translated: He states the reason:

original: 'das pa na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to //
analyzed: 'das pa na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past, form was like this.‚Äù

original: ma 'ongs pa na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na gzugs 'di lta bu zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the future, form will be like this.‚Äù

original: da ltar byung ba na gzugs yod do zhes sbyor ba ni gzugs dus gsum du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba na gzugs yod do zhes sbyor ba ni gzugs dus gsum du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the present, form exists.‚Äù This is called ‚Äúthe connection of form with the three times.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul yin no zhes dmigs pa'i dngos por ram gzugs 'di ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos por yongs suüîΩbsngos nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes rgyu'i dngos por rtogs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul yin no zhes dmigs pa'i dngos por ram gzugs 'di ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams bya ba'i dngos por yongs su bsngos nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes rgyu'i dngos por rtogs na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Not to join form to the knowledge of all aspects means that if one understands form as an object of apprehension, thinking, ‚ÄúThis form is the object of the knowledge of all aspects,‚Äù or if one understands form as a cause, thinking, ‚ÄúThis form, dedicated to the things to be done such as generosity, will become the result, the knowledge of all aspects,‚Äù then one is said to join it to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis chos thams cad thugs su chud pas byang chub ces bya bar mi sbyor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis chos thams cad thugs su chud pas byang chub ces bya bar mi sbyor te /
translated: Not to join buddhahood to the knowledge of all aspects means not to join the knowledge of all aspects to buddhahood as its cause, thinking, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of all aspects is the cause of buddhahood,‚Äù or to enlightenment, thinking, ‚ÄúSince the knowledge of all aspects comprehends all phenomena, it is called enlightenment.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid gcig pas chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid gcig pas chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med do //
translated: Buddhahood, enlightenment, and omniscience are identical in nature, and so they are not different in being the nature of the Dharma Body.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid sangs rgyas so //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is Buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Buddhahood is omniscience, and so on.

original: gzugs 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: One does not apply the term ‚Äúform arises.‚Äù

original: gzugs 'jig go zhes bya bar mi sbyor zhes pa la 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dag ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba ste de mi skyed do //
analyzed: gzugs 'jig go zhes bya bar mi sbyor zhes pa la 'byung bar lta ba dang / 'jig par lta ba dag ni rtag pa dang chad par lta ba ste de mi skyed do //
translated: One does not apply the term ‚Äúform ceases.‚Äù The views of arising and cessation are the views of eternalism and nihilism, and he does not generate them.

original: rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not apply the term ‚Äòpermanent‚Äô‚Äù means by the power of views.

original: mi rtag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not apply the term ‚Äòimpermanent‚Äô‚Äù means by the power of conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this in the same way to the others.

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not apply form is calm because imagined form, etc. do not have the characteristic of nirvana.

original: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa la 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not apply form is not calm because form, etc. as reality do not have the characteristic of samsara.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba de lta de lta bu'i rtog pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro zhes bya ba de lta de lta bu'i rtog pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not apply the knowledge of all aspects is calm because there is no occasion for such a conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du @77b stong pa nyid dang / mtshan pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi skabs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du @77b stong pa nyid dang / mtshan pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi skabs med pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are not occasions for conceptualization.

original: spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the conceptualizations of practice, etc.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos nyid du tha dad pa med pa la tha dad du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos nyid du tha dad pa med pa la tha dad du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of the perfection of giving, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom. This is because it is not tenable to apprehend a difference in the intrinsic reality of all phenomena, which are undifferentiated.

original: thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du tha mi dad do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid du tha mi dad do //
translated: All of them are undifferentiated in the intrinsic reality of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of their difference,

original: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: one does not see any dharma at all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na byang chub sems dpa' lta ci smos te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na byang chub sems dpa' lta ci smos te /
translated: If one does not see even the perfection of wisdom itself, what need is there to mention a bodhisattva?

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mngon par shes pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni mngon par shes pa rnams kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mngon par shes pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni mngon par shes pa rnams kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
translated: How could there be any superknowledge at all in any way? This is explained because the superknowledges have an imagined intrinsic reality and an imagined object of observation.

original: bya ba'i 'gres dang phan yon thob pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyor ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i 'gres dang phan yon thob pa dag la yang de bzhin du sbyor ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the repetition of the action and the attainment of the benefit.

original: brtson pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de'i phan yon thob pa ste /
analyzed: brtson pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de'i phan yon thob pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of striving is the attainment of its benefit.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, when bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom in this way,

original: bdud sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: bdud sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: it is shown by the evil MƒÅra and so on.

original: gang chos rnams dang lhan cig 'du ba zhes bya bas ni 'khor ba bstan to //
analyzed: gang chos rnams dang lhan cig 'du ba zhes bya bas ni 'khor ba bstan to //
translated: That which comes together with phenomena shows sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: 'bral ba zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bral ba zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa bstan to //
translated: Separation shows nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: phrad pa'am mi phrad par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni de gnyis kyi las bstan to //
analyzed: phrad pa'am mi phrad par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas ni de gnyis kyi las bstan to //
translated: Whether it comes together or not shows the function of those two.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi byed do //
translated: The dharma-realm does not fully awaken to the dharma-realm means suchness does not fully awaken to suchness.

original: gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mi sbyor ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i ming du mi sbyor ba'o //üîΩstong pa nyid dang gzugs su mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang mi sbyor ba dang / stong pa nyid ces bya ba gzugs kyi ming yin no zhes mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mi sbyor ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i ming du mi sbyor ba'o // stong pa nyid dang gzugs su mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang mi sbyor ba dang / stong pa nyid ces bya ba gzugs kyi ming yin no zhes mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not unite form with emptiness‚Äù means do not unite form with the nature of emptiness, and do not unite the name ‚Äúform‚Äù with the name ‚Äúemptiness.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúDo not unite emptiness with form‚Äù means do not unite emptiness with the nature of form, and do not unite the name ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù with the name ‚Äúform.‚Äù

original: yang na gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ba ste /üîΩgzugs @78a * //
analyzed: yang na gzugs dang stong pa nyid du mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar mi sbyor ba ste / gzugs @78a * //
translated: Alternatively, ‚ÄúDo not unite form with emptiness‚Äù means do not unite form with the statement ‚ÄúForm is empty.‚Äù

original: dang stong pa nyid dag tha dad du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang stong pa nyid dag tha dad du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not make form and emptiness different‚Äù means do not make form and emptiness different things.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa thob pas lung bstan par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa yin par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa thob pas lung bstan par gyur pa 'am /
translated: Sariputra, a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva who is thus diligent should be considered to have been predicted.

original: lung bstan par 'os pa'i phyir lung bstan pa nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: lung bstan par 'os pa'i phyir lung bstan pa nye bar gyur to //
translated: Because he has attained the eighth stage, he has been predicted or is worthy of prediction, so prediction has approached.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa thob ste rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa thob ste rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: On the eighth stage, he attains the acceptance that dharmas do not arise, and the perfections of full recompense arise.

original: rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byung bas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
translated: Because the perfections of full recompense arise, he practices the perfections, ripens beings, ripens the qualities of a buddha, purifies the buddha-field,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba la rtsol ba dang bral zhing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du thams cad sgrub bo //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba la rtsol ba dang bral zhing lhun gyis grub pa nyid du thams cad sgrub bo //
translated: He accomplishes everything effortlessly and spontaneously, in order to manifest perfect enlightenment and turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i spyod pa lhun gyis grub pa yang sems can grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byed kyang /üîΩde 'di snyam du bdag la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par smin pa'i spyod pa lhun gyis grub pa yang sems can grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don byed kyang / de 'di snyam du bdag la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, even though he spontaneously accomplishes the activity of evolutionary development, he benefits countless, immeasurable, and innumerable sentient beings.üîΩHe does not think, ‚ÄúThe Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are prophesying me.

original: bdag ni lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur to snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag ni lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur to snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: I am approaching the point of being prophesied.‚Äù

original: de la lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la mtshan mar mi byed do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la mtshan mar mi byed do zhes gsungs te /
translated: The reason for his spontaneous accomplishment is stated: ‚ÄúHe does not take the reality realm as a sign.‚Äù

original: de phan chad ni de la chos kyi dbyings ma gtogs par dmigs pa gzhan nye bar mi gnas la /
analyzed: de phan chad ni de la chos kyi dbyings ma gtogs par dmigs pa gzhan nye bar mi gnas la /
translated: From that point on, he has no other objective reference, except for the reality realm.

original: chos kyi dbyings de la yang mtshan mar byas te mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de la yang mtshan mar byas te mi dmigs so //
translated: And that ultimate realm is not perceived as a sign.

original: de'i 'og tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phan yon ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la sems can gyi 'du shes mi skye'o //üîΩde ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar sems can shin tu skye ba med cing /üîΩ'gag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phan yon ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la sems can gyi 'du shes mi skye'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar sems can shin tu skye ba med cing / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The benefits of attaining the acceptance that phenomena are unborn are taught by the passage beginning ‚ÄúBodhisattvas, great beings, do not think of sentient beings,‚Äù

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: and ending ‚Äúbecause the nature of phenomena is nonarising and unceasing.‚Äù

original: sems can skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni de phan chad de'i spyod pa sems can dmigs pa med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba ni de phan chad de'i spyod pa sems can dmigs pa med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThey practice the perfection of wisdom by knowing that sentient beings are unborn and unceasing‚Äù and ending ‚Äúthey do not apprehend sentient beings‚Äù teaches that from that point on, their practice is not to apprehend sentient beings.

original: snying @78b rje'i mthus kun rdzob kyi shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: snying @78b rje'i mthus kun rdzob kyi shes pa skye ste /
translated: Through the power of compassion, conventional knowledge arises.

original: de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed du zin kyang sems can skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / sems can dmigs su med pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can rnams kyi don du sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed du zin kyang sems can skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / sems can dmigs su med pa dang /
translated: At that time, although they perfect generosity and so forth for the sake of sentient beings, they do so by abiding in the non-arising and non-ceasing of sentient beings, the emptiness of sentient beings, the non-apprehension of sentient beings, and the disengagement of sentient beings.

original: sems can dben pa nyid la gnas pas de ltar gnas shing thams cad byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dben pa nyid la gnas pas de ltar gnas shing thams cad byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus they abide and do everything.

original: de'i 'og tu de'i gnas pa shin tu khyad par can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i gnas pa shin tu khyad par can nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnal 'byor dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: After that, in order to teach the excellence of their abiding, it is said, ≈öƒÅriputra, this is the supreme yoga of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can dmigs su med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can dmigs su med du zin kyang /
translated: After that, although sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa sems can gyi don du bya ba rnam par 'byed pa byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa sems can gyi don du bya ba rnam par 'byed pa byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to /
translated: The great love and great compassion are the discernment of the activities for the sake of sentient beings, such as love, compassion, etc., generosity, morality, etc.

original: ser sna'i sems mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug gis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par bstan to //
analyzed: ser sna'i sems mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig drug gis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par bstan to //
translated: The six phrases beginning with ‚Äúthe mind of miserliness does not operate‚Äù indicate the absence of the counteragents to the six perfections.

original: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis 'khor rnams mgu bar bya ba dang / skabs de nyid las chos bshad pa chen por 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnas brtan gyis 'khor rnams mgu bar bya ba dang / skabs de nyid las chos bshad pa chen por 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to please the assembly and to make the present occasion one of great Dharma teaching,

original: de gang nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: de gang nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: the Elder asked, ‚ÄúFrom what Buddha-field did you pass away to be reborn here?‚Äù

original: de la mchog ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'pho'o //
analyzed: de la mchog ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas lhags nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'pho'o //
translated: The supreme ones pass away from a Buddha-field and are reborn in a Buddha-field.

original: bar ma ni dga' ldan nas lhags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar ma ni dga' ldan nas lhags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The intermediate one comes from Tu·π£ita.

original: tha ma ni mi'i nang nyid nas lhags par gyur to zhes rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma ni mi'i nang nyid nas lhags par gyur to zhes rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: The lowest one comes from among humans themselves.

original: de'i 'og tu skabs de las byang chub sems dpa' la rnam pa mang du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skabs de las byang chub sems dpa' la rnam pa mang du yod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach the many types of bodhisattvas in that context,

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir gtogs pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir gtogs pa rnams bstan to //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, there are also bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas who are unskilled in means. Thus it teaches the forty-four types of bodhisattvas.

original: thabs mi mkhas pa dang po gnyis las thabs mi mkhas pa snga ma ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod ma la brtson yang thabs mi mkhas par gyur pa'i phyir lha tshe ring por skyes te /
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pa dang po gnyis las thabs mi mkhas pa snga ma ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod ma la brtson yang thabs mi mkhas par gyur pa'i phyir lha tshe ring por skyes te /
translated: From the first two unskilled in means, the former unskilled in means is one who, though striving in the practice of concentration and the practice of the perfections, becomes unskilled in means and is reborn as a long-lived god.

original: dus de srid cig gi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson par gyur @79a * //
analyzed: dus de srid cig gi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson par gyur @79a * //
translated: For that long time, they strive in the perfections.

original: nas phyis mi'i nang du skye ba'i tshe /
analyzed: nas phyis mi'i nang du skye ba'i tshe /
translated: Later, when they are born among humans,

original: sngon gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i mthus brtson par byed kyang dbang po rtul por gyur to //
analyzed: sngon gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i mthus brtson par byed kyang dbang po rtul por gyur to //
translated: they are diligent due to the power of having previously practiced the perfections, but their faculties are dull.

original: gnyis pa ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams la brtson bas bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu btang nas lha'i nang dum skyes par mi'i nang du skyes kyang thabs mi mkhas pas dbang po rtul ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams la brtson bas bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu btang nas lha'i nang dum skyes par mi'i nang du skyes kyang thabs mi mkhas pas dbang po rtul ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The second are those who are diligent in the practice of concentration and the practice of the perfections. They give up the result of concentration and are born among humans, not in the god realms. But due to lack of skill in means, their faculties are dull.

original: de'i 'og ma rnams ni thams cad kyang thabs mkhas pa rnams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og ma rnams ni thams cad kyang thabs mkhas pa rnams te /
translated: The latter are all skilled in means.

original: de dag gi dang po bstan pa ni bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dang po bstan pa ni bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The first of them is taught: ‚ÄúThey will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment in this very fortunate eon.‚Äù

original: de dag gi ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslabs nas snying rje'i mthus bsam gtan gyi dbang gis skye ba yongs su spangs te sems can gyi don bya ba lhur len pa dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur len pas bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ni bsam gtan gyi spyod pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslabs nas snying rje'i mthus bsam gtan gyi dbang gis skye ba yongs su spangs te sems can gyi don bya ba lhur len pa dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur len pas bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: They will attain manifest, complete enlightenment in this Excellent Eon, because they have trained in the bodhisattva deeds and the practices of meditative stability, because they have relinquished births due to the power of meditative stability through the force of compassion, because they are intent on working for the welfare of sentient beings, and because they are intent on pleasing the buddhas.

original: gnyis pa dag ni yon tan de dag dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: gnyis pa dag ni yon tan de dag dang ldan zhing /
translated: The second group of bodhisattvas possesses those qualities and

original: sngon sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sngon sems can yongs su smin par ma byas pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: brings to maturity those sentient beings who have not previously been ripened.

original: gsum pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug gi nang du skyes te mthu phun sum tshogs pa la gnas nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gsum pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug gi nang du skyes te mthu phun sum tshogs pa la gnas nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang /
translated: The third group of bodhisattvas possesses those qualities and, having taken birth among the six classes of gods in the desire realm, they will bring sentient beings to maturity and purify a buddhafield while abiding in the perfection of power.

original: sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba rnams byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba rnams byed do //
translated: They do what pleases the Buddhas.

original: bzhi pa dag ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi nang du skyes nas rdzu 'phrul gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing chos nyan pa dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur len cing gsol ba gdab pa'i phyir smon lam btab pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor la bskor bar gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa dag ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi nang du skyes nas rdzu 'phrul gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing chos nyan pa dang / sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur len cing gsol ba gdab pa'i phyir smon lam btab pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring por ma lon pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor la bskor bar gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: The fourth, having been born in the world of Brahma, go from Buddha-field to Buddha-field by their miraculous power, and they listen to the Dharma and they pray to be able to make offerings to the Buddhas and to request them to teach. Having attained supreme enlightenment, they request the Buddhas who have not long been enlightened to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: lnga pa dag ni dper na bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das byams pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa dag ni dper na bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das byams pa lta bu'o //
translated: The fifth, like our Lord Maitreya,

original: drug pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du song nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed do //
analyzed: drug pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du song nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed do //
translated: The sixth, by the power of their superknowledges, go to all the Buddha-fields and make offerings to all the Tathagatas.

original: bdun pa dag ni mngon par shes pa la @79b gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nyid na gnas par 'dod pa skyed do //
analyzed: bdun pa dag ni mngon par shes pa la @79b gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nyid na gnas par 'dod pa skyed do //
translated: Those on the seventh stage, who have attained the superknowledges, generate the desire to remain in the pure buddhaverse.

original: brgyad pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshe dpag tu med par skyes nas tshe ji srid thub pa'i bar du gnas te /
analyzed: brgyad pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshe dpag tu med par skyes nas tshe ji srid thub pa'i bar du gnas te /
translated: Those on the eighth stage, by the power of their superknowledges, are born in the buddhaverse of Infinite Life and remain there for the duration of that life.

original: sems can dang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba nyid la brtsen  par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba nyid la brtsen  par byed do //
translated: They play with the power to mature sentient beings and the qualities of the Buddha.

original: dgu pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra dang bral bas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan mi shes pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dman pa rnams la dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan bsgrags te /
analyzed: dgu pa dag ni mngon par shes pa'i mthus sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra dang bral bas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan mi shes pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dman pa rnams la dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan bsgrags te /
translated: Those on the ninth stage, by the power of their superknowledges, proclaim the qualities of the Three Jewels to the inferior worlds of sentient beings who do not know the qualities of the Three Jewels because they are devoid of the sound of Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: sgra gsum dang ldan pa'i chos bshad pas dga' ba bskyed de de nyid kyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: sgra gsum dang ldan pa'i chos bshad pas dga' ba bskyed de de nyid kyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su skye bar byed do //
translated: By teaching the Dharma endowed with the three qualities, they generate joy and by the power of that, they are reborn in the buddhafields.

original: bcu pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa skyes nas rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba rnams rtsol ba chung dus sa dang po thob par byas te /
analyzed: bcu pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa skyes nas rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba rnams rtsol ba chung dus sa dang po thob par byas te /
translated: The tenth are those who are born in a pure buddhafield and, by the power of their natural weak defilements, attain the first level with little effort.

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams thob nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams thob nas /
translated: Having attained the concentrations, meditative stabilizations and meditative attainments,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
translated: they cultivate the elements that lead to enlightenment and the qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas shi 'phos te 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su ma dag par song nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas shi 'phos te 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su ma dag par song nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: Having passed away from the pure buddhafield, they go to the impure world systems and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bcu gcig pa dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan snga ma de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skyes te /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan snga ma de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skyes te /
translated: The eleventh are endowed with those former qualities of the bodhisattva and are born in a pure buddhafield.

original: sa dang po thob par byas nas 'phral du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs te phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob par byed do //
analyzed: sa dang po thob par byas nas 'phral du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs te phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob par byed do //
translated: Having attained the first stage, they immediately enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva and attain the stage of nonregression.

original: bcu gnyis pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi stobs bskyed pas bdag nyid yon tan rnams kyis sems kyi rgyud yongs su dag par byas nas /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi stobs bskyed pas bdag nyid yon tan rnams kyis sems kyi rgyud yongs su dag par byas nas /
translated: The twelfth are endowed with those very qualities and, by the power of the buddhafield, having purified their mental continuum with those qualities,

original: rtsol ba chung ngus sa dang po thob par byas nas /
analyzed: rtsol ba chung ngus sa dang po thob par byas nas /
translated: attain the first stage with little effort.

original: de ma thag tu chen po 'bad mi dgos par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te dus ji srid yod kyi bar du bstan pa gnas par byed do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu chen po 'bad mi dgos par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te dus ji srid yod kyi bar du bstan pa gnas par byed do //
translated: Immediately after that, without exertion, they fully awaken to buddhahood and, turning the wheel of the Dharma, they cause the teaching to remain for as long as existence endures.

original: bcu gsum pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs du dag par skyes nas rtsol ba chung ngus sang dang po thob par byas te /üîΩsa gong pa rnams pa skyes par shes rab kyi @80a * //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa dag ni yon tan de dag nyid dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs du dag par skyes nas rtsol ba chung ngus sang dang po thob par byas te / sa gong pa rnams pa skyes par shes rab kyi @80a * //
translated: The thirteenth stage is that of the one who is endowed with those qualities and, having been born in a completely pure buddhafield, has attained the first stage with little effort.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor thams cad la snyoms par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor thams cad la snyoms par zhugs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar byed do //
translated: The fourteenth stage is that of the one who, having entered into the meditative concentration of all the perfections of wisdom, is born from one buddhafield to another in order to purify the buddhafields, having understood that the higher stages are born from the lower ones.

original: bcu bzhi pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par bzhag nas snyoms par 'jug pa de rnams kyis gnas par byed do //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par bzhag nas snyoms par 'jug pa de rnams kyis gnas par byed do //
translated: The fifteenth stage is that of the one who, abiding in the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom, enters into meditative concentration by means of the meditative concentration of alternating meditative equipoise and post meditative equipoise.

original: bco lnga pa dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: bco lnga pa dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ldan zhing /
translated: The sixteenth stage is that of the one who is endowed with the factors of enlightenment and the qualities of the Buddha.

original: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su shes par byas kyang de dag mngon sum du mi byed par gzhan dag kyang lam dang 'bras bu de dag la so sor 'god do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su shes par byas kyang de dag mngon sum du mi byed par gzhan dag kyang lam dang 'bras bu de dag la so sor 'god do //
translated: By the knowledge of thorough familiarity, they know the fruits of stream-entry, etc., but do not actualize them. They establish others in those paths and fruits.

original: yongs su dris pa'i shes pa de nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dris pa'i shes pa de nyid la byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That very knowledge of thorough familiarity is called the bodhisattva‚Äôs highest forbearance.

original: bcu drug pa dag ni bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: bcu drug pa dag ni bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The sixteenth are the bodhisattvas of the Fortunate Eon.

original: gang bskal pa'i de nyid la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: gang bskal pa'i de nyid la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: They will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment in that very eon.

original: de dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas dga' ldan gyi gnas sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas nas dga' ldan gyi gnas sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Abiding in the six nonconceptual perfections, they purify the abode of the Heaven of Joy.

original: bcu bdun pa dag ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcu bdun pa dag ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ste /
translated: The seventeenth are those obstructed by a single birth.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan zhing /
translated: They possess all the qualities of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas.

original: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams tshol ba la gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams tshol ba la gnas so //
translated: By means of the knowledge of thorough familiarization, they abide in the search for the noble truths.

original: bco brgyad pa dag ni bskal pa grangs med pa bye ba brgya stong pang po sa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba la brtson par gnas te /
analyzed: bco brgyad pa dag ni bskal pa grangs med pa bye ba brgya stong pang po sa mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas par byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba la brtson par gnas te /
translated: The eighteenth abide in striving to benefit sentient beings after having fully awakened to buddhahood in a hundred thousand one hundred million asa·πÉkhyeya eons.

original: dper na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩbcu dgu pa dag ni de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la brtun nas sems can rnams la chos 'chad cing gnas so //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sogs pa lta bu'o // bcu dgu pa dag ni de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la brtun nas sems can rnams la chos 'chad cing gnas so //
translated: For example, it is like the noble youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.üîΩThe nineteenth abide in teaching the Dharma to sentient beings after having fully awakened to buddhahood in that way.

original: nyi shu pa dag ni de bzhin du sems can gyi don byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gnas so //
analyzed: nyi shu pa dag ni de bzhin du sems can gyi don byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gnas so //
translated: The twentieth abide in benefiting sentient beings and going from buddha realm to buddha realm in that way.

original: nyi shu gcig pa dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas kyang sbyin pa nyid kyis sems can rnams tshim par byas te sems can rnams sbyin pa nyid la 'god do //üîΩnyi shu gnyis pa @80b dag ni tshul khrims kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: nyi shu gcig pa dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas kyang sbyin pa nyid kyis sems can rnams tshim par byas te sems can rnams sbyin pa nyid la 'god do // nyi shu gnyis pa @80b dag ni tshul khrims kyis bsdus te /
translated: The twenty-first are those who, while abiding in the six perfections, satisfy sentient beings with generosity and establish them in generosity.

original: tshul khrims la 'god do //
analyzed: tshul khrims la 'god do //
translated: The twenty-second are those who gather sentient beings through morality and establish them in morality.

original: nyi shu gsum pa dag ni bzod pa la 'god do //
analyzed: nyi shu gsum pa dag ni bzod pa la 'god do //
translated: The twenty-third are those who establish them in patience.

original: nyi shu bzhi pa dag ni brtson 'grus la 'god do //
analyzed: nyi shu bzhi pa dag ni brtson 'grus la 'god do //
translated: The twenty-fourth are those who establish them in effort.

original: nyi shu lnga pa dag ni bsam gtan la 'god do //
analyzed: nyi shu lnga pa dag ni bsam gtan la 'god do //
translated: The twenty-fifth are those who establish them in concentration.

original: nyi shu drug pa dag ni shes rab la 'god do //
analyzed: nyi shu drug pa dag ni shes rab la 'god do //
translated: The twenty-sixth are those who establish them in wisdom.

original: nyi shu bdun pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyis shar phyogs kyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas te /
analyzed: nyi shu bdun pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi cha byad kyis shar phyogs kyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas te /
translated: The twenty-seventh are those who, in the form of the Buddha, ripen sentient beings in the east.

original: der sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur blangs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mthong ba'i yon tan rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: der sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba lhur blangs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mthong ba'i yon tan rnams bzung ste /
translated: Having made it their priority to please the Buddha there, they take up the good qualities that are seen in that buddhafield.

original: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas skye ba gcig gis thogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas skye ba gcig gis thogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: Having purified a buddhafield, I will remain, having attained the state of irreversibility.

original: nyi shu brgyad pa dag ni lho phyogs su de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams par dgod cing gnas so //
analyzed: nyi shu brgyad pa dag ni lho phyogs su de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams par dgod cing gnas so //
translated: The twenty-eighth [bodhisattva] is in the south, purifying a buddhafield in the same way and remaining there.

original: nyi shu dgu pa dag ni nub phyogs su'o //üîΩsum cu pa dag ni byang phyogs su'o //
analyzed: nyi shu dgu pa dag ni nub phyogs su'o // sum cu pa dag ni byang phyogs su'o //
translated: The twenty-ninth is in the west.üîΩThe thirtieth is in the north.

original: sum cu gcig pa dag ni byang shar gyi mtshams su'o //üîΩsum cu gnyis pa dag ni shar lho'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: sum cu gcig pa dag ni byang shar gyi mtshams su'o // sum cu gnyis pa dag ni shar lho'i mtshams su'o //
translated: The thirty-first is in the northeast.üîΩThe thirty-second is in the southeast.

original: sum cu gsum pa dag ni lho nub kyi mtshams su'o //
analyzed: sum cu gsum pa dag ni lho nub kyi mtshams su'o //
translated: The thirty-third is in the southwest.

original: sum cu bzhi pa bdag ni nub byang gi mtshams su'o //
analyzed: sum cu bzhi pa bdag ni nub byang gi mtshams su'o //
translated: The thirty-fourth is in the northwest.

original: sum cu lnga pa dag ni 'og gi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: sum cu lnga pa dag ni 'og gi phyogs su'o //
translated: The thirty-fifth is below.

original: sum cu drug pa dag ni steng gi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: sum cu drug pa dag ni steng gi phyogs su'o //
translated: The thirty-sixth is above.

original: sum cu bdun pa dag ni phyogs bcu'i sems can yongs su smin par byas nas /
analyzed: sum cu bdun pa dag ni phyogs bcu'i sems can yongs su smin par byas nas /
translated: The thirty-seventh, having brought sentient beings in the ten directions to full maturity,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byas te /
translated: worships the buddhas in the ten directions.

original: de nas mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi khyad par rnams bzung nas bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bsgrubs te de na skye ba gcig gis thogs par gnas so //
analyzed: de nas mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi khyad par rnams bzung nas bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bsgrubs te de na skye ba gcig gis thogs par gnas so //
translated: Then, having taken up the special qualities of the Buddha-fields that he has seen, he accomplishes them in his own Buddha-field and abides there, hindered by only one birth.

original: sum cu brgyad pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sum cu brgyad pa dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang ldan zhing /
translated: In the thirty-eighth, he is endowed with all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du rnam par sprul pa chen po dang / spyod lam zhi ba dang / dbang po gsal ba dang / skye bo mang po dga' bar byas nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du rnam par sprul pa chen po dang / spyod lam zhi ba dang / dbang po gsal ba dang / skye bo mang po dga' bar byas nas /
translated: By the power of his former vow, he creates a great transformation-body of the Buddha, with peaceful deportment, clear senses, and pleasing to many people.

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba'i mthu de nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byas te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba'i mthu de nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin par byas te /
translated: By the power of that very joy and satisfaction, he brings beings to maturity.

original: mthar gyis theg pa gsum gyi rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: mthar gyis theg pa gsum gyi rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
translated: Finally, he causes them to pass into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa by means of the three vehicles.

original: sum bcu dgu pa dag ni dbang po gsal ba de dag nyid dang ldan zhing de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang bdag la stod par mi byed pa dan @81a * //
analyzed: sum bcu dgu pa dag ni dbang po gsal ba de dag nyid dang ldan zhing de bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang bdag la stod par mi byed pa dan @81a * //
translated: The twenty-ninth are those who are endowed with those very clear faculties and, likewise, work for the welfare of sentient beings, but do not praise themselves

original: gzhan la smod par mi byed par btang snyoms su gnas pas lhur blangs te gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan la smod par mi byed par btang snyoms su gnas pas lhur blangs te gnas so //
translated: and do not disparage others, but abide in equanimity.

original: bzhi bcu pa dag ni sa rab tu dag pa la gnas te /
analyzed: bzhi bcu pa dag ni sa rab tu dag pa la gnas te /
translated: The fortieth are those who abide in the very pure bh≈´mis.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Having abided in the perfections of generosity and ethics,

original: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal rnams mi myong bar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la thug gi bar du /
analyzed: dbul ba'i sdug bsngal dang / ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal rnams mi myong bar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la thug gi bar du /
translated: they do not experience the suffering of poverty and the suffering of the miserable realms,

original: sems can gyi don lhur len cing gnas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don lhur len cing gnas so //
translated: but are intent on working for the welfare of sentient beings until they reach the irreversible bh≈´mi.

original: bzhi bcu gcig pa dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur len cing /
analyzed: bzhi bcu gcig pa dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur len cing /
