translated: The forty-first are those who are intent on the perfections of generosity and ethics.

original: tshe rabs kun du 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas /
analyzed: tshe rabs kun du 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas /
translated: In all their lives, they become cakravartins.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs des sems can rnams bsdus te sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la 'god do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs des sems can rnams bsdus te sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la 'god do //
translated: By the power of their supernormal accomplishments, they attract sentient beings and establish them in generosity and morality.

original: bzhi bcu gnyis pa dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur len cing /
analyzed: bzhi bcu gnyis pa dag ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur len cing /
translated: The twelfth are intent on the perfections of generosity and morality.

original: de bzhin du tshe rabs kun du 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshe rabs kun du 'khor los sgyur bar gyur nas /
translated: And likewise, in all their lives, they become universal monarchs.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu chen po dang ldan pas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / mchod par byed cing gnas so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu chen po dang ldan pas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed pa dang / mchod par byed cing gnas so //
translated: And by possessing great supernormal powers, they please and worship the buddhas of the ten directions.

original: bzhi bcu gsum pa dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: bzhi bcu gsum pa dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: The thirteenth are intent on the six perfections.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba thams cad kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba nyid kyis bdag nyid kyang yongs su smin par byed cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba thams cad kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snang ba nyid kyis bdag nyid kyang yongs su smin par byed cing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du gnas so //
translated: And by all the light of the Buddha‚Äôs teachings, they bring sentient beings to maturity, and by the light of the Buddha‚Äôs teachings themselves, they bring themselves to maturity, and they remain until they are fully enlightened.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the bodhisattvas,

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang dag par byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang dag par byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, this is the emergence of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas into the qualities of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi myu gu sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'phel ba'i rim pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi myu gu sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'phel ba'i rim pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that this is the stage of the growth of the sprouts of the bodhisattvas into the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to open the section explained by the Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag chad mar mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag chad mar mdzad de /
translated: those bodhisattvas were silent.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, therefore, when bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: they do not open the way for physical, verbal, or mental actions that are accompanied by wrongdoing.‚Äù

original: gnas brtan nyid kyis de nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan nyid kyis de nyid bzung ste /
translated: The Elder himself took up that very point:

original: @81b bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @81b bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the divisions,

original: bcom ldan 'das lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus so //
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, what is the reprehensible bodily action?‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis lus dang ngag dang yid du dmigs pa'i 'du shes pa bka' ma stsal bar lus gang gis lus kyi las brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das kyis lus dang ngag dang yid du dmigs pa'i 'du shes pa bka' ma stsal bar lus gang gis lus kyi las brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, without teaching the perception of the observation of body, speech, and mind, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe body by which one should undertake bodily action,

original: ngag gang dang yid gang gis las brtsam par bya snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ngag gang dang yid gang gis las brtsam par bya snyam du sems na /
translated: the speech by which one should undertake verbal action, and the mind by which one should undertake mental action‚ÄîüîΩif one thinks, ‚ÄòThis is the body, this is speech, this is the mind,‚Äô

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa'i skyon yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtsom pa'i skyon yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: this is a fault in the undertaking of a bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: de dag nyid lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yin no //
translated: Those are the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'di nyid gnas ngan len sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'di nyid gnas ngan len sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it is taught that since the body, speech, and mind are not observed, this very non-observation is the purification of the negative tendencies.

original: de'i 'og tu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas nas kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas nas kyang /
translated: Then, if a bodhisattva, even while dwelling on the ground of Very Joyful,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la rjes su spyod cing /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la rjes su spyod cing /
translated: He practices the paths of the ten virtues.

original: nyan thos kyi sems dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spangs nas dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spangs nas dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gnas te /
translated: Abandoning the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and the thought of the pratyekabuddha, he always has the thought of great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: de lta bus kyang gnas ngan len sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bus kyang gnas ngan len sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: In this way, he will purify the negative tendencies.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa las tha mi dad par brjod pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub kyi lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa las tha mi dad par brjod pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva‚Äôs path to enlightenment?‚Äù This is the question regarding the purification of the path to enlightenment, because it is said to be inseparable from the perfections.

original: de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu byang chub kyi lam gang la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor byang chub kyi lam gang yin par ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sh'a ri'i bu byang chub kyi lam gang la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor byang chub kyi lam gang yin par ston to //
translated: Then, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, when practicing on the path to enlightenment‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth teaches the path to enlightenment that is the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: de nas yang bar skabs su byang chub kyi lam rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: de nas yang bar skabs su byang chub kyi lam rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: Then, in the middle, the path of enlightenment is taught in two parts:

original: mi dmigs par sbyor ba dang / rlom sems med par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par sbyor ba dang / rlom sems med par sbyor ba'o //
translated: application without reference points and application without conceit.

original: 'gres de gnyis ni mi dmigs pas rlom sems med pa'i phyir sbyor ba gong ma ni sbyor ba phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'gres de gnyis ni mi dmigs pas rlom sems med pa'i phyir sbyor ba gong ma ni sbyor ba phyi ma'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The latter two are the causes of the former two applications because the application without reference points is the cause of the application without conceit.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi yin gyi /
translated: The wisdom of omniscience belongs to the TathƒÅgata himself,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: but it does not belong to the bodhisattvas.

original: gnas brtan gyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes de dang ldan pa @82a * //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes de dang ldan pa @82a * //
translated: Thinking this, the elder asked the BhagavƒÅn, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, what is the wisdom of omniscience of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas?‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes de lta bu skye ba de ni rang bzhin yin te rnam par smin pa'i ye shes so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa brgyad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes de lta bu skye ba de ni rang bzhin yin te rnam par smin pa'i ye shes so zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the knowledge of the bodhisattvas on the eighth stage is of this kind. It is natural knowledge, that is, knowledge that is the result of evolution.

original: rnam par smin pa'i ye shes kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs /üîΩpar byed kyang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i ye shes kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs / par byed kyang /
translated: By means of this knowledge that is the result of evolution, all the perfections and so on are perfected.

original: de dag la rtsol ba'i yid la byed pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag la rtsol ba'i yid la byed pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: But the mental activity of striving for them does not occur.

original: ye shes de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ye shes de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because this knowledge is the cause of the knowledge of all the modes,

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: the effect is figuratively designated by the name of its cause.

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs thams cad la 'jug pa'i shes pa ni sha'i mig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs thams cad la 'jug pa'i shes pa ni sha'i mig go //
translated: After that, the knowledge that penetrates all forms is the fleshly eye.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad shes pa ni lha'i mig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad shes pa ni lha'i mig go //
translated: The knowledge of all the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments is the divine eye.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi mig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi mig go //
translated: The knowledge of all the modes is the knowledge eye.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa ma gtogs pa'i shes pa dgu po dag ni chos kyi mig go //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa ma gtogs pa'i shes pa dgu po dag ni chos kyi mig go //
translated: The nine knowledges except for the knowledge of what is possible and impossible are the Dharma eye.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan yin no zhes de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan yin no zhes de dag gi rnam par dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The knowledge of the vajra-like samadhi is the Buddha eye. Thus the distinctions among them are shown.

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pas gnas pa la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pas gnas pa la /
translated: After that, in the station of the superknowledges,

original: mngon par shes pas thams cad la yang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas thams cad la yang /
translated: in all the superknowledges,

original: sngar kun rdzob kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa la gnas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: sngar kun rdzob kyi shes pas mngon par shes pa la gnas pa bstan nas /
translated: having previously shown the station of the superknowledges by means of conventional knowledge,

original: shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir phyis don dam pa'i shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir phyis don dam pa'i shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa yin par bstan to //
translated: in order to show their complete perfection, subsequently it is shown that they are nonconceptual by means of knowledge of the ultimate.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show their complete purity,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa thams cad kyang kun rdzob kyi shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa thams cad kyang kun rdzob kyi shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: it is said that all the stations of the bodhisattvas, having completed the conventional knowledge,

original: phyis don dam par mi dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: phyis don dam par mi dmigs par byed de /
translated: subsequently are made to be nonapprehended in the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are extremely complete and extremely pure.

original: de bas na thams cad kyi tha mar sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad kyi tha mar sh'a ri'i bu de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, ≈öƒÅriputra, in this way, when bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed cing yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed cing yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: they perfect and purify the six superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: By purifying the superknowledges, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: des gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyis so //üîΩgang rlom sems su byed ces bya ba ni @82b rdzu 'phrul bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: des gang gis rlom sems su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyis so // gang rlom sems su byed ces bya ba ni @82b rdzu 'phrul bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: By what would they become conceited? By magical power.üîΩWhat would they become conceited about? The performance of magical feats.

original: gang gis rlom sems su byed ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rlom sems su byed ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul bya ba shes pa ste /
translated: By what would they become conceited? The knowledge of the performance of magical feats.

original: des rdzu 'phrul de dag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: des rdzu 'phrul de dag mi dmigs so //
translated: By that, they do not apprehend those magical powers.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of essential nature is the non-existence of essential nature.

original: rang bzhin dben pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin dben pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu yongs su dag pa nyid do //
translated: The isolation of essential nature is the state of being completely pure.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The non-arising of essential nature is the unconditioned.üîΩHe does not even generate the idea that this is a magical creation.

original: de rdzu 'phrul du sems pa yang mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni de ni rdzu 'phrul yin no snyam du sems pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul 'di dag mngon par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul du sems pa yang mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni de ni rdzu 'phrul yin no snyam du sems pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul 'di dag mngon par bsgrub par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The idea that this is a magical creation is the idea that this is a magical creation. The idea of accomplishing magical creations is the idea of accomplishing these magical creations.

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, those bodhisattva great beings who, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang dag mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: through the emptiness of the other side,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: dwell in the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la gnas kyang rung pha rol tu phyin pa re re la gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong ba dag kyang yod do zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug car la gnas kyang rung pha rol tu phyin pa re re la gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: Thus, whether one abides in all six nonconceptual perfections or in each perfection,

original: byang chub kyi lam sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam sbyong bar byed do //
translated: one trains in the path to enlightenment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag gi mos pa tha dad pa bstan to //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag gi mos pa tha dad pa bstan to //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, there are those who say ‚Äúit exists,‚Äù and so on. This teaches their different inclinations.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya bas ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
translated: Because of the emptiness that transcends extremes, one abandons the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Because of the absence of grasping, one does not cling to the three spheres.

original: gang gi phyir de 'dzin pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas byang chub kyi lam la sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'dzin pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas byang chub kyi lam la sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Because of that non-grasping, one trains in the path to enlightenment by abiding in the perfection of generosity.

original: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bar byed do zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sbyong bar byed do zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Since it is said that the path of omniscience purifies,

original: gal te lam yod na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i 'os kyang yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa las dgongs nas /
analyzed: gal te lam yod na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i 'os kyang yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa las dgongs nas /
translated: if there were a path, then coming and going would also be appropriate.

original: de dag med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: With that thought in mind, it is said that because they do not exist.
