original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i don de thabs mkhas pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sogs pa'i don de thabs mkhas pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Having taken up the characteristic that is imagined by skillful means for the sake of bringing sentient beings to full maturity, etc.,

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul du sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdams par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul du sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdams par bya'o //
translated: one should instruct sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom in the manner of the conventional.

original: gzhan du na ni sems can gyi don rab tu nyams bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni sems can gyi don rab tu nyams bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
translated: Otherwise, the welfare of sentient beings would be greatly impaired.

original: dang por btags pa'i gdams pa bstan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming dang brdar btags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhungüîΩgis bstan to //
analyzed: dang por btags pa'i gdams pa bstan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming dang brdar btags pa rnams de ltar khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: Having taught this, the instruction in the imagined is taught first, from ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should understand names and conventional designations in this way‚Äù up to the end.

original: de ltar btags pas gdams nas don dam par btags pa bstan dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar btags pas gdams nas don dam par btags pa bstan dgos te /
translated: Having instructed in the imagined in that way, one must teach the ultimate imagined.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba gnas brtan gyis zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba gnas brtan gyis zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Lord, having taken up the words of the Elder,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: said, Subhuti, what do you think?

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is form a Bodhisattva?üîΩIs something other than form a Bodhisattva?

original: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri ba rim pa lnga nye bar btags nas /üîΩbcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri ba rim pa lnga nye bar btags nas / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: Having thus applied the fivefold question,üîΩthe Lord said, Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, is not, and cannot be apprehended, how much less can form, etc. be apprehended as a Bodhisattva?

original: de la gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi tshig rnams kyis sems can rnams dmigs su med pa'i gdams pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi tshig rnams kyis sems can rnams dmigs su med pa'i gdams pa bstan to //
translated: The Elder Subhuti, with the words, The Bodhisattva, the great being, is not, and cannot be apprehended, taught the instruction in the nonapprehension of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis bstan to //
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom in that way, by not apprehending sentient beings.

original: de nas yang 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas yang 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas /
translated: Then, having taken up the words of the question, What is the word for the dharma called 'bodhisattva'?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: the Blessed One said, What do you think, Subh≈´ti?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris nas /
translated: Is the word 'bodhisattva' a designation for form? and so on, he asked.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs shin tu ma mchis shing mi @85a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs shin tu ma mchis shing mi @85a * //
translated: The Blessed One said, Form does not exist,

original: dmigs na / byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dags su 'gyur ba lta gal mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs par bstan nas /üîΩrab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dmigs na / byang chub sems dpa' gzugs kyi tshig bla dags su 'gyur ba lta gal mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs par bstan nas / rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If you focus on it, then the bodhisattva would become a designation for form.üîΩThe passage from ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, it is so‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe bodhisattva great being should train in the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the instruction in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe passage from ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, it is so‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe bodhisattva great being should train in the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the instruction in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tuüîΩphyin pa la gdams pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tuüîΩphyin pa la gdams pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, it is so‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe bodhisattva great being should train in the perfection of wisdom‚Äù teaches the instruction in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos de bdag gi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas /
translated: Then, the Lord, having taken up the words ‚Äúthe bodhisattva should not be seen as a real entity,‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: the Lord said to Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúThe dharmadhƒÅtu should not be seen,‚Äù and so on, up toüîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas should practice the perfection of wisdom by not objectifying all dharmas.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis chos thams cad mi dmigs par bstan nas de
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya ste zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung dag gis chos thams cad mi dmigs par bstan nas de
translated: Having taught the non-objectification of all dharmas with this passage,

original: nyid kyis gdams pa mdzad do //
analyzed: nyid kyis gdams pa mdzad do //
translated: he gave instructions with just that.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams pa'o //
translated: That is the instruction for bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya bas gdams pa bzhi po de dag nyid kyis mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes bya bas gdams pa bzhi po de dag nyid kyis mjug bsdus so //
translated: Thus, he concludes with just those four instructions.

original: de la ming dang brdar gdags pa'i gdams pa sngar smos pa las /
analyzed: de la ming dang brdar gdags pa'i gdams pa sngar smos pa las /
translated: Among those, the instruction on the designation of names and symbols was mentioned previously.üîΩHere, after teaching that this is mere name, that there is no other phenomenon called ‚Äúname,‚Äù he explains the reason for the non-existence of a different phenomenon called ‚Äúname‚Äù with the words:

original: 'di ni ming tsam ste ming zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa med par bstan nas ming de ni nang na yang med /
analyzed: 'di ni ming tsam ste ming zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa med par bstan nas ming de ni nang na yang med /
translated: ‚ÄúThat name is not found to exist internally,

original: phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med /
translated: externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ming gi chos gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ming gi chos gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad do //
translated: or in both.‚Äù

original: gal te ming zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te ming zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan du gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If there were some other phenomenon called ‚Äúname,‚Äù

original: nang ngam phyi rol lam de gnyis las gzhan pa gang yang rung ba gsum las 'ga' zhig gi nang nas dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: nang ngam phyi rol lam de gnyis las gzhan pa gang yang rung ba gsum las 'ga' zhig gi nang nas dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: it would be found among any of the three: internally, externally, or other than those two.

original: 'di ltar de gsum car la yang rna par dpyad na mi rigs te de bas na de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gsum car la yang rna par dpyad na mi rigs te de bas na de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: However, when those three are analyzed, it is unreasonable, and therefore it does not exist.

original: 'dir yang @85b chos dang mthun pa'i dpe rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sems can sems can zhes bya bar mid du brjod kyang sems can gang yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs bstan to //üîΩde nas yang ming las chos gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa brtags pa'i chos de ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang @85b chos dang mthun pa'i dpe rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na sems can sems can zhes bya bar mid du brjod kyang sems can gang yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs bstan to // de nas yang ming las chos gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa brtags pa'i chos de ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
translated: Here, in accord with the Dharma, it is said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is thus. For example, although sentient beings are said to exist, no sentient being is observed.‚Äù

original: 'gag pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gag pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, as a second reason for the nonexistence of phenomena other than names, it is said, ‚ÄúThat phenomenon that is imputed as a convention, as a mere name and symbol, is neither produced nor does it cease.‚Äù

original: gal te chos rnams kyi ming chos gzhan zhig tu gyur pa zhig yod na ni ming de skad ces bya ba'i chos skye bar gyur pa na de yang skye bar gyur pa zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi ming chos gzhan zhig tu gyur pa zhig yod na ni ming de skad ces bya ba'i chos skye bar gyur pa na de yang skye bar gyur pa zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the name of phenomena were a different phenomenon, then when the phenomenon called ‚Äúname‚Äù were produced, it would be produced, but it is not.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad du gdags su rung bar bya ba'i phyir brda'i tshul gyis gzhan dag la 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes phyir rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad du gdags su rung bar bya ba'i phyir brda'i tshul gyis gzhan dag la 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes phyir rnam par 'jog go //
translated: In this way, in order to make it suitable to be designated conventionally, one posits to others by the method of a conventional symbol, ‚ÄúThe name of this is such and such.‚Äù

original: gal te chos nyid skye ba'i dus nyid na ming skyes par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos nyid skye ba'i dus nyid na ming skyes par gyur na ni /
translated: If the name were to arise at the time of the arising of the phenomenon,

original: gzhan dag gis mthong ma thag tu brdar mi shes pas kyang 'di'i ming 'di yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mthong ma thag tu brdar mi shes pas kyang 'di'i ming 'di yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then as soon as it was seen by others, even those who did not know the conventional symbol would understand, ‚ÄúThe name of this is such and such.‚Äù

original: khong du yang mi chud de /
analyzed: khong du yang mi chud de /
translated: But they do not understand.

original: de bas na chos skyes kyang ming mi skye la chos 'gag kyang ming mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos skyes kyang ming mi skye la chos 'gag kyang ming mi 'gag ste /
translated: Therefore, even though the phenomenon arises, the name does not arise, and even though the phenomenon ceases, the name does not cease.

original: 'dir ming de skad ces bya ba'i dngos po 'gag kyang ming de skad tha snyad du 'dogs shing med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ming de skad ces bya ba'i dngos po 'gag kyang ming de skad tha snyad du 'dogs shing med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, even though the thing called by that name ceases, the designation by that name is not nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa med par chos gzhan du gyur pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa med par chos gzhan du gyur pa ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, without arising and ceasing, the phenomenon does not become something else.

original: bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad du zad do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin du tha snyad du zad do zhes bstan to //
translated: Like ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúsentient being,‚Äù it is merely a conventional expression.

original: 'dir yang dpe'i tshul gyis chos rnam pa bzhi bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dpe'i tshul gyis chos rnam pa bzhi bzung ste /
translated: Here, four kinds of things are taken up in the manner of examples.

original: tha snyad tsam du zad pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi tshul la grags pa bdag dang sems can la sogs pa dang / kun brtags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul la grags pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams /
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du zad pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi tshul la grags pa bdag dang sems can la sogs pa dang / kun brtags pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul la grags pa phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams /
translated: Since they are mere conventions, the self, sentient beings, and so forth, which are renowned in the way of the ≈õrƒÅvakas; and the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres, which are renowned in the way of the bodhisattvas, are mere imputations.

original: nye bar bzung nas btags pa'i ming tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar bzung nas btags pa'i ming tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are mere names that are imputed,

original: gnyi ga la grags pa nang dang phyi'i bye brag las lus dang rtsa shing la sogs pa dang / shin tu med pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa rmi lam dang brag ca dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grags pa nang dang phyi'i bye brag las lus dang rtsa shing la sogs pa dang / shin tu med pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa rmi lam dang brag ca dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa'o //
translated: the body and the internal and external distinctions, such as the channels, trees, and so forth, which are renowned to both; and dreams, echoes, mirages, and so forth, which are renowned to all worlds, are utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i 'og tu ming du btags pa'i gdams pa mjug bsdus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ming du btags pa'i gdams pa mjug bsdus pa'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to summarize the instructions that are named,

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /üîΩming @86a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / ming @86a * //
translated: Thus, Subhuti, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, train in the designation by name,üîΩin the designation by convention, in the designation by instruction, in the designation by Dharma.

original: dang brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan te sgro btags pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang pa'i phyir ming dang brdar btags pa sngar smos so //
analyzed: dang brdar btags pa dang / gdams ngag tu btags pa dang / chos su btags pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan te sgro btags pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang pa'i phyir ming dang brdar btags pa sngar smos so //
translated: Here, the designation by name is mentioned first in order to avoid the extremes of reification and repudiation.

original: de la gnas te chos bshad pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang gdams pa'i btags pa phyis smos so //
analyzed: de la gnas te chos bshad pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang gdams pa'i btags pa phyis smos so //
translated: The designation by instruction is mentioned later because, based on that, one teaches the Dharma in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: de'i 'og tu de gnyi gas chos rnams tha snyad du 'dogs so zhes kun brtags pa'i chos su gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de gnyi gas chos rnams tha snyad du 'dogs so zhes kun brtags pa'i chos su gsungs so //
translated: After that, both of those designate phenomena conventionally, thus the imagined phenomena are mentioned.

original: de nas yang btags pa de gsum gyi yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang btags pa de gsum gyi yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to demonstrate the qualities of those three designations, it is said:üîΩ

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ni gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩrnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa ni btags pa tsam du zad par slob pa'i 'bras bur bstan to /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pas ni gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa ni btags pa tsam du zad par slob pa'i 'bras bur bstan to /
translated: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way does not see form as impermanent, and so on.

original: // / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: The abandonment of all conceptualization is taught as the result of training in mere designation.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The conceptualizations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are also threefold:

original: lhag mthong gi spyod yul dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i spyod yul dang / chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi spyod yul dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i spyod yul dang / chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of insight, the domain of the doors of liberation, and the domain of correct discernment of phenomena just as they are.

original: de la lhag mthong gi spyod yul ni blang ba dang dor ba'i dbang gis nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i gnas su gyur pa chos kyi mdor rnam par rtog pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la lhag mthong gi spyod yul ni blang ba dang dor ba'i dbang gis nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i gnas su gyur pa chos kyi mdor rnam par rtog pa bzhi ste /
translated: The object of insight is the four conceptual thoughts that are the basis of the four noble truths, which are the dark and bright sides by way of the power of taking up and rejecting.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi bar rnam par rtog pa rnams dang / de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / ma zhi bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi bar rnam par rtog pa rnams dang / de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / ma zhi bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: They are the conceptual thoughts of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and peace, and their opposites, the conceptual thoughts of permanence, happiness, self, and non-peace.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i spyod yul ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa rnams dang / des spang bar bya ba stong pa ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma dang smon pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i spyod yul ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par rtog pa rnams dang / des spang bar bya ba stong pa ma yin pa dang / mtshan ma dang smon pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: The object of the door of liberation is the conceptual thoughts of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and their opposites, the conceptual thoughts of non-emptiness, sign, and wish.

original: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa ni lhag ma rnams te /üîΩ'dus byas dang / skye ba dang / mi dben pa rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba @86b dang bcas pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa ni lhag ma rnams te / 'dus byas dang / skye ba dang / mi dben pa rnams dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba @86b dang bcas pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: The remaining ones are the correct analytical discrimination of phenomena.üîΩThey are the ten: the compounded, arising, non-isolation, non-virtue, with-sins-requiring-confession, with-outflows, with-afflictions, mundane,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'khor bar rnam par rtog pa ste bcu dang / de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa 'dus ma byas dang / 'gog pa dang / dben pa dang / dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'khor bar rnam par rtog pa ste bcu dang / de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa 'dus ma byas dang / 'gog pa dang / dben pa dang / dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: and the conceptualizations of samsara, and their antidotes, the uncompounded, cessation, isolation, virtue, without-sins-requiring-confession,

original: zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa ste /
translated: without-outflows, without-afflictions, supramundane, purification, and nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa bcu po de dag thams cad kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bcu po de dag thams cad kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin te /
translated: All of these ten conceptualizations are the sphere of activity of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya'o //
translated: But the bodhisattvas should abandon them all in every way.

original: rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po de dag spangs pa ni btags pa tsam du zad par slob pa'i phan yon du bstan to //üîΩ'dus byas kyi khams na yod pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po de dag spangs pa ni btags pa tsam du zad par slob pa'i phan yon du bstan to // 'dus byas kyi khams na yod pa'am /
translated: The abandonment of these thirty-four concepts is taught as the benefit of training in mere designation.üîΩHe does not see it as existing in the compounded element,üîΩor as existing in the uncompounded element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa'i nang du mi 'grang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams na yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa'i nang du mi 'grang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that the perfection of wisdom and so forth are not included in the compounded or uncompounded.

original: de nyid la dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs gnyis su brjod pa la mi rtog par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid la dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs gnyis su brjod pa la mi rtog par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach non-conceptuality with regard to just that, which is expressed as the two sides of virtue and non-virtue,

original: chos thams cad la mi rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúHe does not conceptualize any phenomena.‚Äù

original: mu stegs can la sogs pa ltar rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag yod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag tu rnam par mi rtog pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa ltar lhag mthong la sogs pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can la sogs pa ltar rtag pa dang bde ba dang / bdag yod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag tu rnam par mi rtog pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa ltar lhag mthong la sogs pas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: It is not conceptualized in terms of the specific attributes of permanence, happiness, a self, and so on, as is the case with the tƒ´rthikas, and it is not conceptualized in terms of impermanence, suffering,üîΩ

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag tu mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag tu mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is not conceptualized in terms of the distinctions of permanence, happiness, self, and so on, as are the non-Buddhists, and it is not conceptualized in terms of the distinctions of impermanence, suffering, and selflessness, and so on, as are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de ltar rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa /
translated: In this way, it is the antidote to all conceptual thoughts and conceptual discriminations.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the training of the bodhisattvas,

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas shing /
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas shing /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúthey abide in the nonconceptual Dharma

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: and cultivate the applications of mindfulness‚Äù and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: the unique qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa de'i yul du gyur pa chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid nyan thos rnams kyi yul gyi gnyen por gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i @87a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa de'i yul du gyur pa chos rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid nyan thos rnams kyi yul gyi gnyen por gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i @87a * //
translated: In order to teach that the suchness of phenomena, which is the object of that non-conceptual wisdom, is the antidote to the object of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, it is said:

original: tshe / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtog pa yin te chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtog pa yin te chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom, they thoroughly understand the characteristics of phenomena. The characteristics of phenomena are not defiled.

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //üîΩde bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so // de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med la /
translated: They are not purified.üîΩBecause suchness is naturally pure, it is not defiled in the phase with stains.

original: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi rnam par byang ba yang med de /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na glo bur gyi rnam par byang ba yang med de /
translated: And it is not purified in the phase without stains, because adventitious defilements are removed.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid du gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it abides as suchness at all times,

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught as suchness.

original: de bas na sngar bstan pa de dag thams cad kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na sngar bstan pa de dag thams cad kun brtags pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all those things taught above are imagined.

original: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa bden pa ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma yin pa bden pa ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They are not real, not the way they seem to be.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in that way, when bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthey should understand the designation of phenomena that are objects of names and signs.

original: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya bas brtags pa de dag nyid bstan nas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin pas /
analyzed: ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gdags pa khong du chud par bya ste zhes bya bas brtags pa de dag nyid bstan nas chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin pas /
translated: Having taught just those imagined things, since non-attachment to all phenomena is its result,

original: des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gang gas pa khong du chud na gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan yon gnyis pa ston to /
analyzed: des ming dang brdar bya ba'i chos kyi gang gas pa khong du chud na gzugs la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa phan yon gnyis pa ston to /
translated: it teaches the second benefit: ‚ÄúWhen they understand the designation of phenomena that are objects of names and signs, they do not become attached to form, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du zad par rig nas gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs mkhas pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du zad par rig nas gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs mkhas pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag la mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, having understood that all phenomena are mere designations, one does not cling to the phenomena of imagined form and so on, up to the skillful means of the pure qualities of a buddha. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: One does not cling to suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: One does not cling to the limit of reality.üîΩOne does not cling to the dharma-realm.

original: chos kyi dbyings la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i rim pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi spyod yul byang chub sems dpa'i sas bsdus pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i rim pas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi spyod yul byang chub sems dpa'i sas bsdus pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is the domain of the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of wisdom that is the domain of the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi spyod yul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi spyod yul nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of the knowledge of all aspects is the dharmakƒÅya belonging to the level of the Buddha, and is called the ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù.üîΩThe object of the knowledge of paths is the path of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas, and is called the ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod yul sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'i chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings zhes @87b bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi spyod yul sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa'i chos kyi sku ni chos kyi dbyings zhes @87b bya'o //
translated: The object of the knowledge of all aspects is the dharmakƒÅya belonging to the level of the Buddha, and is called the ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù.

original: de nas yang mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de nas yang mngon par zhen pa med par bsgom pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of meditating without clinging

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: The benefits of meditating without clinging are taught in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, in that way, when bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they increase the perfection of generosity without clinging to any phenomena‚Äù and so on,

original: nas / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: nas / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: up to ‚Äúthey attain the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways and the samƒÅdhi gateways.‚Äù

original: de ltar brdar btags pa'i gdams pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar brdar btags pa'i gdams pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus completed the instructions on the conventional,

original: sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: the instructions on the ultimate, the non-observation of sentient beings, will now be explained.

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis dang po zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis dang po zhus pa las /
translated: In this regard, the elder Subh≈´ti first asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba 'byung bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi na zhes bya ba 'byung bas /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavan, when you say ‚Äòbodhisattva great being,‚Äô

original: tshig de'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod do snyam pa'i bsam pas /
analyzed: tshig de'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos 'ga' zhig yod do snyam pa'i bsam pas /
translated: thinking that there is some phenomenon called ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô because of those words,üîΩthe elder said that.‚Äù

original: gnas brtan gyis de skad smras so snyam du kha cig the tshom de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis de skad smras so snyam du kha cig the tshom de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is form a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /üîΩgzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is something other than form a bodhisattva?üîΩIs a bodhisattva in form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
translated: Is form in a bodhisattva?

original: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba dri ba rnam pa lnga dris so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba dri ba rnam pa lnga dris so //
translated: Are you thinking that a formless being is a bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sems can du 'dzin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sems can du 'dzin cing /
translated: If one grasps a bodhisattva as a sentient being,

original: bdag la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par rtog na rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad par rtog na rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: and conceives of it as distinct, like a self, etc., then there are three kinds of misconceptions:

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi dbang dang gzhi dang / gnas pa'i dngos po dang / de las gzhan par ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi dbang dang gzhi dang / gnas pa'i dngos po dang / de las gzhan par ro //
translated: the power of sameness and difference, the basis, and the entity that abides in that.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' la sems can nyid du mngon par zhen na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' la sems can nyid du mngon par zhen na /
translated: Thus, if one conceives of a bodhisattva as a sentient being,

original: ji ltar chad par smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu yongs su btags pa ltar phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dam /üîΩji ltar rtag par smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu yongs su btags pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar chad par smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu yongs su btags pa ltar phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid dam / ji ltar rtag par smra ba rnams kyis bdag tu yongs su btags pa ltar /
translated: is it the nature of the five aggregates, as the proponents of annihilationism impute a self?

original: phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig yin grang na /
translated: Or is it something other than the five aggregates,üîΩas the proponents of eternalism impute a self?

original: de la dang po gcig pa'i phyogs nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de la dang po gcig pa'i phyogs nye bar bzung ste /
translated: First, taking the position of sameness,

original: gzugs byang chub sems @88a * //üîΩdpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems @88a * // dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is form a bodhisattva?

original: tshor ba byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: tshor ba byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is feeling a bodhisattva?üîΩIs perception a bodhisattva?üîΩIs formation a bodhisattva?

original: 'du shes byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du shes byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Is consciousness a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: gnyis pa tha dad pa'i phyogs nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa tha dad pa'i phyogs nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Second, taking the position of difference,

original: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIs something other than form a bodhisattva?

original: tshor ba ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Is something other than feeling a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: yang phyogs gnyis pa gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po nye bar bzung nas gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: yang phyogs gnyis pa gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po nye bar bzung nas gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Again, taking the second position, the entity of the basis and the abode, it says, ‚ÄúIs a bodhisattva in form?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /üîΩtshor ba la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam / tshor ba la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: Is form in a bodhisattva?üîΩIs a bodhisattva in feeling?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la tshor ba yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la tshor ba yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Is feeling in a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad du 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa thams cad du 'brel pa med de /
translated: Form, feeling, etc. and the bodhisattva are not related in any way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de dag las byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de dag las byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattva is not at all the same as those, i.e., form, etc.

original: phyogs gsum pa nye bar gzung nas /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa nye bar gzung nas /
translated: The third alternative is taken up:

original: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Is one who is formless a bodhisattva?

original: tshor ba med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Is one who is without feeling a bodhisattva?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di la rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di la rnam par dpyad na /
translated: Thus, when this bodhisattva is investigated,

original: gcig pa'am / tha dad pa'am /üîΩgzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: gcig pa'am / tha dad pa'am / gzhi dang gnas pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: he is not the same as form, etc.üîΩHe is not a different entity from form, etc.üîΩHe is not a basis for form, etc.üîΩHe is not a basis for form, etc.

original: de med pa'i dngos por yang dpyad du mi bzod de /
analyzed: de med pa'i dngos por yang dpyad du mi bzod de /
translated: He is not a non-entity.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid med do snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid med do snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhas gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhas gsungs so //
translated: Thinking this, the Lord said, ‚ÄúNo, Subh≈´ti, he is not.‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra ba'i nang nas kha cig rtog par byed pa mthong ba ni yul thams cad pa'o zhes 'byung bas sems can ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i bdag nyid la sems can du rtog cing /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i nang nas kha cig rtog par byed pa mthong ba ni yul thams cad pa'o zhes 'byung bas sems can ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i bdag nyid la sems can du rtog cing /
translated: Some who propound a self see that the mind is the nature of all objects, and so they imagine that the sentient being is the nature of the eye and so on.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la sems can zhes bya ba bsams te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin la sems can zhes bya ba bsams te /
translated: They think that the sentient being is the nature of form.

original: mthong ba po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir /
translated: They think that the seer is the self.

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúDo you think that form is a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du ba lang rdzi la sogs pa ltar za ba po ni sems can yin no snyam du rtog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang rdzi la sogs pa ltar za ba po ni sems can yin no snyam du rtog cing /
translated: Similarly, like cowherds and so on, they think that the sentient being is the experiencer.

original: tshor ba'i @88b ngo bo nyid du bzung nas tshor ba po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir tshor ba byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i @88b ngo bo nyid du bzung nas tshor ba po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir tshor ba byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: They apprehend the nature of feeling and think that the feeler is the self. Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúDo you think that feeling is a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gcer bu la sogs pa ltar byed pa po sems can yin par rtog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcer bu la sogs pa ltar byed pa po sems can yin par rtog cing /
translated: Similarly, like the Jains and so on, they think that the sentient being is the agent.

original: 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid du bzung ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang 'du byed kyi ngo bo nyid du bzung ste /
translated: It is held to be the entity of discernment and formation.

original: byed pa po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir 'du shes byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: byed pa po ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir 'du shes byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Because of the thought, ‚ÄúThe self is the agent,‚Äù do you think that discernment is the bodhisattva?

original: 'du byed rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Or do you think that formation is the bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rig byed smra ba la sogs pa ltar shes pa po ni bdag yin no snyam du rtog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du rig byed smra ba la sogs pa ltar shes pa po ni bdag yin no snyam du rtog cing /
translated: Likewise, like the proponents of the Vedas and so on, it is thought that the self is the knower.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du bzung ste /
translated: It is held to be the entity of consciousness.

original: shes par byed pa ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ni bdag yin no snyam du sems pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because of the thought, ‚ÄúThe self is the one who causes knowledge,‚Äù do you think that consciousness is the bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: de bzhin du grangs can pa dag ltar shin tu phra zhing khyab la mi gsal ba'i skyes bur rtog cing gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par gyur pa'i bdag cig yod par sems pa de'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs can pa dag ltar shin tu phra zhing khyab la mi gsal ba'i skyes bur rtog cing gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par gyur pa'i bdag cig yod par sems pa de'i phyir gzugs ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam
translated: Likewise, because the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine a person that is extremely subtle, pervasive, and unclear, and think that there is a self that is different from form and so on, it says, ‚ÄúDo you think that something that is not form is a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: mam / tshor ba ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mam / tshor ba ma yin pa gzhan zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúDo you think that something that is not feeling is a bodhisattva?‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du kun tu rgyu la sogs pa ltar /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun tu rgyu la sogs pa ltar /
translated: Likewise, because the ƒÄjƒ´vikas and so on imagine

original: sems can mthe bo tsam mam /
analyzed: sems can mthe bo tsam mam /
translated: that sentient beings exist in the size of a thumb

original: nas la sogs pa tsam zhig yod par rtog cing phung po bdag nyid kyi lus la skyes bu 'di gnas so snyam du rtog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: nas la sogs pa tsam zhig yod par rtog cing phung po bdag nyid kyi lus la skyes bu 'di gnas so snyam du rtog pa de'i phyir /
translated: or in the size of a pea and so on, and think that this person exists in the body that is the nature of the aggregates, it says,

original: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you think that a bodhisattva exists in form?‚Äù

original: tshor ba la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba la byang chub sems dpa' yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúDo you think that a bodhisattva exists in feeling?‚Äù and so on.

original: de de bzhin du 'ug pa la sogs pa ltar gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni skyes bu rtag pa la gnas pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'ug pa la sogs pa ltar gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni skyes bu rtag pa la gnas pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: Likewise, they assert that impermanent forms and so on abide in a permanent person, like an owl and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bdag la gnas so snyam du sems shing gnas kyi dngos por rtog pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bdag la gnas so snyam du sems shing gnas kyi dngos por rtog pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la gzugs yod snyam mam /
translated: They think and conceive that form and so on abide in the self, but since the self does not exist, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúDo you think that form exists for the bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la tshor ba yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la tshor ba yod snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Do you think that feeling exists for the bodhisattva?‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug tu smra ba la sogs pa kha cig lngar /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug tu smra ba la sogs pa kha cig lngar /
translated: Similarly, some such as the proponents of ƒ™≈õvara assert five objects.

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba shin tu phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba zhig yod par rtog cing /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las @89a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba shin tu phra zhing rtogs par dka' ba zhig yod par rtog cing / gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las @89a * //
translated: They conceive of an ƒ™≈õvara that is extremely subtle and difficult to realize.üîΩThey conceive of something that is different from the nature of form and so on.

original: gzhan pa zhig yod par rtog pa de'i phyir gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzhan pa zhig yod par rtog pa de'i phyir gzugs med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: Therefore the Buddha said, ‚ÄúDo you think that the bodhisattva is formless?‚Äù

original: tshor ba med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩrnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad rigs pa dang mi mthun no snyam du dgongs nas /üîΩphung po lnga dang / khams drug dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad rigs pa dang mi mthun no snyam du dgongs nas / phung po lnga dang / khams drug dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Do you think that a bodhisattva is without feeling? and so on.

original: so sor dris pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: so sor dris pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Thinking that all of these conceptualizations are not in accord with reason, [Subh≈´ti] asks about the five aggregates, the six elements, the twelve sense-spheres, the eighteen elements, and the twelve links of dependent origination, saying, Are they a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bkag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bkag go //
translated: The elder Subh≈´ti responds, No, Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dis chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig yod na 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dis chos gzhan du gyur pa zhig yod na 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: Then the Blessed One says, If this bodhisattva were a different dharma, it would be either conditioned or unconditioned.

original: gal te 'dus byas yin na ni phung po lnga la sogs pa 'di dag la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs par ma gyur to //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas yin na ni phung po lnga la sogs pa 'di dag la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs par ma gyur to //
translated: If it were conditioned, it would be observed among these five aggregates and so on, but it is not observed.

original: gal te 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin pa khas len na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma byas pa zhig yin pa khas len na yang /
translated: If you accept that it is unconditioned,

original: dogs pa de bsal pa'i phyir yang phung po la sogs pa de bzhin nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: dogs pa de bsal pa'i phyir yang phung po la sogs pa de bzhin nyid bzung ste /
translated: then in order to dispel that doubt, the aggregates and so on are taken as the reality.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, what do you think? Is the reality of form the bodhisattva?

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subh≈´ti,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid tha dad pa dang / 'dus pa de dag bsdus te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid tha dad pa dang / 'dus pa de dag bsdus te /
translated: having included the reality of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination, whether separate or combined,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la yod na ni byang chub sems dpa' gcig nyid la ngo bo nyid tshad med grangs med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la yod na ni byang chub sems dpa' gcig nyid la ngo bo nyid tshad med grangs med par 'gyur te /
translated: thought, If it existed in the bodhisattva, then in a single bodhisattva there would be an immeasurable, countless number of natures.

original: de lta bu'i rigs pa yang med do snyam nas bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes de yang bkag go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rigs pa yang med do snyam nas bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes de yang bkag go //
translated: But there is no such reasoning, and he refuted that as well, saying, Blessed One, it is not so.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor khyod kyis don gyi dbang yin pa nye bar bzung nas de skad zer zhes gtan tshigs dris pa dang / de'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor khyod kyis don gyi dbang yin pa nye bar bzung nas de skad zer zhes gtan tshigs dris pa dang / de'i gtan tshigs bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs na /
translated: Then the Lord asked Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúIs it the case that you are speaking with the authority of the meaning?‚ÄùüîΩThe reason for that is as follows: ‚ÄúLord, if a bodhisattva is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended,

original: de la gzugs byang chub sems dpa' 'gyur ba ltag la mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩri bong gi rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gzugs byang chub sems dpa' 'gyur ba ltag la mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ri bong gi rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa la /
translated: how could the suchness of a bodhisattva be said to exist?‚ÄùüîΩIt is like the conceptual thoughts of the horns of a rabbit, the son of a barren woman, and so on.

original: ring ba dang / thung ba dang / dkar @89b sham dang / sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du sems can shin tu med pa las /
analyzed: ring ba dang / thung ba dang / dkar @89b sham dang / sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du sems can shin tu med pa las /
translated: In the same way, in the utterly nonexistent sentient beings,

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: the form aggregate and so on, which are the nature of the conditioned,

original: de bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and suchness, which is the nature of the unconditioned, do not exist.

original: 'di la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid du ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could the reality of form be an object? This means how could the reality of form be an essence?

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid thams cad bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid thams cad bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted all essences,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: the Blessed One concludes the instruction on the non-apprehension of sentient beings, saying, ‚ÄúExcellent, Subh≈´ti, excellent!

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom in this way, without apprehending sentient beings.‚Äù

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes 'phags pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar tshig bla dags zhus pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' yod pa lta bur bstan pa la /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de chos gang gi tshig bla dags lags zhes 'phags pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar tshig bla dags zhus pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' yod pa lta bur bstan pa la /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, having been asked by the noble elder Subh≈´ti earlier through the question about the term, ‚ÄúWhat is the referent of the term ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô?‚Äù taught that a bodhisattva exists as an appearance.

original: kha cig 'di snyam du gal te byang chub sems dpa' don dam par phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
analyzed: kha cig 'di snyam du gal te byang chub sems dpa' don dam par phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
translated: Some think that even though the entities of the aggregates and so on are ultimately essenceless,

original: kun rdzob kyi sgo nas phung po la sogs par btags pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod do snyam du sems te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi sgo nas phung po la sogs par btags pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod do snyam du sems te /
