original: de'i phyir btags pa de yang yod pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btags pa de yang yod pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that even that designation does not exist.

original: de'i 'og tu tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhus pa'i tshig de nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhus pa'i tshig de nyid bzung ste /
translated: After that, in order to teach the instruction on the non-apprehension of designations, the BhagavƒÅn took up the very words of Subh≈´ti‚Äôs question.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam /
translated: He asked, ‚ÄúWhat do you think, Subh≈´ti? Is this ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô a designation of form?

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' 'di tshor ba'i tshig bla dags yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' 'di tshor ba'i tshig bla dags yin snyam mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: Is this ‚Äòbodhisattva‚Äô a designation of feeling?‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If the bodhisattva were the entity of a designation,

original: gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / de dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bcu bzhi'i tshig bla dags rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa lnga dang / de dag rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa bcu bzhi'i tshig bla dags rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te de'i phyir /
translated: It would be the reality of the terms ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù and ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù as the natures of the five such as form, and the fourteen such as permanent and impermanent.üîΩTherefore,

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gzugs kyi tshig bla dags yin snyam mam /
translated: is the term ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù the term ‚Äúform‚Äù?üîΩis the term ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù the term ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù?

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba tshor ba'i tshig dags yin snyam mam zhes so so'i tshig bla dags rnams bzung ste dris so //
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba tshor ba'i tshig dags yin snyam mam zhes so so'i tshig bla dags rnams bzung ste dris so //
translated: Thus, having taken up the individual terms, he asked.

original: @90a * // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu med pa nyid yin na de dag gi tshig bla dags dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: @90a * // de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu med pa nyid yin na de dag gi tshig bla dags dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: Then, the elder Subh≈´ti, since the imagined such as form are utterly nonexistent, how could their terms be apprehended?

original: tshig bla dags mi dmigs na byang chub sems dpa' lta ga la 'gyur zhes tshig bla dags med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid med par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig bla dags mi dmigs na byang chub sems dpa' lta ga la 'gyur zhes tshig bla dags med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' tshig bla dags kyi ngo bo nyid med par bstan to //
translated: If the terms are not apprehended, how could there be a bodhisattva? Thus, he taught that terms do not exist and that a bodhisattva does not have the nature of a term.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dags rnams mi dmigs pa nyid la brten nas rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dags rnams mi dmigs pa nyid la brten nas rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: Then the Lord, based on the non-apprehension of the epitomes of the Dharma, said to Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent, Subh≈´ti!

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gzugs kyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gzugs kyi tshig bla dags mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag yod pa dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: Subh≈´ti, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom by way of the epitomes of the Dharma, which are the non-apprehension of the epitomes of the Dharma, from ‚Äòform‚Äô up to ‚Äòconsciousness‚Äô and ‚Äòhappy‚Äô and ‚Äòunhappy‚Äô and ‚Äòself‚Äô and ‚Äòselfless‚Äô and ‚Äòpeaceful‚Äô and

original: ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig bla dags rnams kyis gdams so //
analyzed: ma zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mi stong pa dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig bla dags mi dmigs par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshig bla dags rnams kyis gdams so //
translated: ‚Äònot peaceful‚Äô and ‚Äòempty‚Äô and ‚Äònot empty‚Äô and ‚Äòsignless‚Äô and ‚Äòwith signs‚Äô and ‚Äòwishless‚Äô and ‚Äòwith wishes.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù Thus he instructed him with the epitomes of the Dharma.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba don dam pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba don dam pa dang / kun rdzob tu yang med par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown that the so-called bodhisattva does not exist in either the ultimate or the conventional,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig med par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig med par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there no Bodhisattva,üîΩbut also all dharmas are non-existent.

original: chos thams cad kyang med do zhes chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas /üîΩrab 'byor gang yang khyod 'di skad du zhes bya bas skabs phyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang med do zhes chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar zhus pa'i tshig bzung nas / rab 'byor gang yang khyod 'di skad du zhes bya bas skabs phyi'o //
translated: In order to teach the instruction of the non-apprehension of all dharmas, the Lord, having taken up the words previously spoken by the Elder Subh≈´ti,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sdang bcom ldan 'di lta ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos bdag gi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sdang bcom ldan 'di lta ste / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'i chos bdag gi yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes /
translated: says, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, you have said, ‚ÄòThus have I understood the meaning of the Lord‚Äôs teaching, etc.‚ÄôüîΩThe Elder Subh≈´ti has said, ‚ÄòI do not see any dharma called ‚ÄúBodhisattva,‚ÄùüîΩand I do not see any dharma called ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù‚Äô

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes smras pas don dam par sus kyang ci 'ang ma mthong ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes smras pas don dam par sus kyang ci 'ang ma mthong ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: By saying, ‚ÄòI do not see any dharma called ‚ÄúBodhisattva,‚Äù‚Äô he teaches that ultimately nothing is seen by anyone.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i gnas skabs na sus kyang ci yang ma mthong la de yang gzhan gyis mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i gnas skabs na sus kyang ci yang ma mthong la de yang gzhan gyis mi mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, the Lord, in order to teach that ultimately, in the state of non-establishment, no one sees anything at all, and that is not seen by another,

original: rab 'byor chos kyis dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi @90b mngon ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyis dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi @90b mngon ngo //
translated: said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the dharma-element does not see the perfect,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and the dharma-element is not seen by the dharma-element.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: The imagined dharma does not see the perfect, the dharma-element,

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang /
translated: and the perfect, the dharma-element,

original: kun brtags pa'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: does not see the imagined dharma.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams kyis chos kyi dbyings yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach just that, he said, ‚ÄúThe form element does not see the dharma-element,‚Äù and so forth.

original: de nas yang tha dad pa de'i gtan tshigs su de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dus byas ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas gdags par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas yang tha dad pa de'i gtan tshigs su de ci'i phyir zhe na 'dus byas ma gtogs par 'dus ma byas gdags par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then, in order to establish their difference, it says, ‚ÄúWhy is that? Because it is not possible to designate an unconditioned thing apart from a conditioned thing.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos tha dad par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas kyi chos dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos tha dad par gyur na /
translated: If a conditioned thing and an unconditioned thing were different,

original: de lta na ni gcig gis gcig mthong bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na ni gcig gis gcig mthong bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then one would see the other.

original: 'dus byas rnams la 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba tha dad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams la 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba tha dad pa ci yang med do //
translated: But there is no difference at all in conditioned things called ‚Äúunconditioned.‚Äù

original: de yang 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de nyid ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'dus byas zhes bya la /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de nyid ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'dus byas zhes bya la /
translated: It is like this: that suchness itself, in the impure stage, is called ‚Äúconditioned.‚Äù

original: de nyid dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
translated: And that itself, in the pure stage, is called ‚Äúunconditioned.‚Äù

original: dper na cu sngar ma dangs pa las phyis rab tu dangs par gyur pa la yang chu de nyid ces bya ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' sprin la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pa la phyis dri ma med par gyur pa la yang /
analyzed: dper na cu sngar ma dangs pa las phyis rab tu dangs par gyur pa la yang chu de nyid ces bya ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' sprin la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pa la phyis dri ma med par gyur pa la yang /
translated: For example, water that was previously impure later becomes pure, and it is called ‚Äúthat same water.‚Äù And just as space, being defiled by clouds and so on, later becomes undefiled,

original: nam mkha' de nyid ces ba ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha' de nyid ces ba ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is not different in the pure and the impure parts of the sky,

original: sngar ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid phyis shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa na yang de nyid de bzhin nyid yin pas 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas pa rnams la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: sngar ma dag pa'i de bzhin nyid phyis shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa na yang de nyid de bzhin nyid yin pas 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas pa rnams la ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med do //
translated: so also the suchness of the former impure state and the later very pure state are not different. Thus, there is no difference in the intrinsic reality of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de bas na ji ltar bdag nyid kyis bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings mi mthong la /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bdag nyid kyis bdag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba de bzhin du kun brtags pa'i chos kyis yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings mi mthong la /
translated: Therefore, just as one does not see a self by means of a self, so also one does not see the reality realm of phenomena that is accomplished by means of a phenomenon that is imagined.

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang kun brtags pa'i chos mi mthong ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis kyang kun brtags pa'i chos mi mthong ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: And also, one does not see a phenomenon that is imagined by means of the reality realm of phenomena that is accomplished.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na gzhan gyis ni gzhan mthong bar 'gyur gyi bdag nyid kyis ni bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na gzhan gyis ni gzhan mthong bar 'gyur gyi bdag nyid kyis ni bdag nyid mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is this? It is because one sees something else by means of something else, but one does not see something by means of itself.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs par sbyor ba 'di'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs par sbyor ba 'di'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefit of this practice of non-apprehension of all phenomena,üîΩthe sutra says:

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @91a * //üîΩrol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha @91a * // rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, when the bodhisattva mahasattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: he does not see any phenomena at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
translated: Since he does not see any phenomena,

original: mi skrag / mi dngang /
analyzed: mi skrag / mi dngang /
translated: he is not frightened, not terrified,

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: and does not become terrified.

original: de'i sems zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sems zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: His mind does not become timid,

original: kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become extremely timid,

original: yid la 'gyod pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yid la 'gyod pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and he does not experience mental regret.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs par sbyor ba 'di'i 'bras bu yang dad pa mngon par 'phel ba dang / shes rab mngon par 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs par sbyor ba 'di'i 'bras bu yang dad pa mngon par 'phel ba dang / shes rab mngon par 'phel ba ste /
translated: The result of this practice of non-apprehension of all phenomena is the increase of faith and the increase of wisdom.

original: dad pa mngon par 'phel ba ni skrag pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: dad pa mngon par 'phel ba ni skrag pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: The increase of faith is the absence of fear and so forth.

original: shes rab mngon par 'phel ba ni sems 'gong ba dang / 'bying ba med do //
analyzed: shes rab mngon par 'phel ba ni sems 'gong ba dang / 'bying ba med do //
translated: The increase of wisdom is the absence of a timid or sunken mind.

original: dad pa de yang gnas gsum la lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa de yang gnas gsum la lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that faith is superior with regard to three things:

original: chos zab mo bshad pa dang / shin tu bya dka' ba bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: chos zab mo bshad pa dang / shin tu bya dka' ba bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos shin tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba rnams la bya ste /
translated: the explanation of the profound Dharma, the practice of what is very difficult to do, and the very amazing and marvelous qualities of the Buddha.

original: gnas de gsum la dad pa mngon par 'phel na de la ma dad pa las byung ba'i skrag pa skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnas de gsum la dad pa mngon par 'phel na de la ma dad pa las byung ba'i skrag pa skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If faith increases with regard to these three things, fear arising from lack of faith does not arise.

original: zab mo'i gnas gsum po de dag nyid la mi shes pa las byung ba'i sems zhum pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas gsum po de dag nyid la mi shes pa las byung ba'i sems zhum pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And with regard to these three profound things, mental dejection arising from ignorance does not arise. This is the meaning.

original: de la dang po 'byung ba'i tshe chung ngu'i gnas skabs la ni skrag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po 'byung ba'i tshe chung ngu'i gnas skabs la ni skrag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of its first arising, when it is in a weak state, it is called fear.

original: bar gyi gnas skabs la ni dngang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyi gnas skabs la ni dngang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is in an intermediate state, it is called terror.

original: chen por gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ni dngang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ni dngang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is in a strong state, it is called panic.

original: de bzhin du sems 'gong ba la yang gnas skabs gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems 'gong ba la yang gnas skabs gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, mental contraction should be applied to the three states.

original: de nas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de nyid rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de nas gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de nyid rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Then, from ‚ÄúHe does not see form‚Äù and so on, that very non-observation of all phenomena is taught in detail.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa bcu gsum dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa bcu gsum dang /
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, links of dependent origination, desire, anger, ignorance, the thirteen such as self, sentient being, and life,

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / nyan thos dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / nyan thos dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang /
translated: the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, the hearers and the dharmas of the hearers, the solitary realizers and the dharmas of the solitary realizers, the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: @91b sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: @91b sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub ces bya ba ste /
translated: the buddhas and the dharmas of the buddhas, and ‚Äúawakening‚Äù

original: chos de dag thams cad bstan to //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad bstan to //
translated: all of those phenomena are taught.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyis ni phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams kyis ni phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, and members of dependent origination include all internal and external phenomena.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi phyogs thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi phyogs thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion include all the aspects of afflictions and negative tendencies.

original: bdag dang sems can la sogs pas ni shin tu med cing btags pa'i chos rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can la sogs pas ni shin tu med cing btags pa'i chos rnams bsdus so //
translated: The self, sentient beings, and so on include all phenomena that are utterly nonexistent and imputed.

original: khams gsum gyis ni 'khor ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: khams gsum gyis ni 'khor ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: The three realms include all phenomena of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: nyan thos la sogs pas ni rnam par byang ba dkar po'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas ni rnam par byang ba dkar po'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: The hearers and so on include all the virtuous phenomena of purification.

original: sems dang sems kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba des ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: sems dang sems kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba des ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bstan to //
translated: The mind and mental factors indicate the six active consciousnesses, the all-base consciousness, and what is concomitant with it.

original: yid dang yid kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba des ni nyon mongs pa'i yid dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba des ni nyon mongs pa'i yid dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams bstan to //
translated: The phrase the mind and mental phenomena indicates the afflicted mind and those phenomena that are concomitant with it.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i gdams pa lnga pa ste rdzogs par byas nas de'i 'og tu brtson pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba drug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i gdams pa lnga pa ste rdzogs par byas nas de'i 'og tu brtson pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba drug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having completed the fifth instruction on striving in this way, in order to teach the sixth, the qualities of striving,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs yongs su rtogs par 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: the Lord said, Subhuti, a Bodhisattva-Mahasattva who wishes to fully understand form should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyis la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum po dag rgya cher bstan to zhes bya ba'i gzhung gi tshig mang pos bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyis la bslab par bya ba'i theg pa gsum po dag rgya cher bstan to zhes bya ba'i gzhung gi tshig mang pos bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are taught in detail, in which the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas should train: the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di la yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here, too, there are four benefits:

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa dang / spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnams bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba rnams thob pas mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams yongs su shes pa dang / spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnams bsgoms pas yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon sum du bya ba rnams thob pas mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: understanding the dharmas that are to be understood, abandoning what is to be abandoned, perfecting what is to be perfected through meditation, and realizing what is to be realized through attainment.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das gzugs yongs su rtogs par @92a * //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das gzugs yongs su rtogs par @92a * //
translated: Here, the Blessed One has fully understood form,

original: 'tshal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su shes pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: 'tshal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yongs su shes pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúknowing‚Äù teaches the benefit of thorough knowledge.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams yongs su shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams yongs su shes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThe aggregates, elements, sense bases, and links of dependent origination should be thoroughly known.‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spang par 'tshal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug spang par 'tshal bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúknowing‚Äù teaches the quality of thorough abandonment.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba dang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams spang par bya zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba dang mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams spang par bya zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúAttachment, aversion, and delusion should be abandoned, as well as the ten unwholesome courses of action.‚Äù

original: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phan yon ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phan yon ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: The benefit of thorough completion is taught by the words of thorough completion of the ten wholesome courses of action, the perfections, and so on up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i phan yon ni gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i phan yon ni gzungs kyi sgo dang ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: The benefit of direct realization is indicated by the words: ‚Äúthe attainment of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways and samƒÅdhis.‚Äù

original: de nas yang tha mar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: de nas yang tha mar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: Then, finally, the benefit of fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings and the benefit of fulfilling all roots of virtue are taught.

original: de gnyis kyang yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid sngar smos pa de dag nyid de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid sngar smos pa de dag nyid de /
translated: These two are characterized by fulfillment, as mentioned above.

original: skyon chen po'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
analyzed: skyon chen po'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
translated: They are taught at the end in order to open the door to great faults.

original: skyon chen po zhes bya ba ni spyi bor gyur pa'am /
analyzed: skyon chen po zhes bya ba ni spyi bor gyur pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat faults‚Äù means faults that are like the head,

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i nyes pa'am /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i nyes pa'am /
translated: or faults that are like the main part.

original: lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid spyi bor gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi skyon yin pas skyon chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid spyi bor gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi skyon yin pas skyon chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, since the characteristic of vipa≈õyanƒÅ is like the head, the faults in the stage of that are called ‚Äúgreat faults.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i chos la sred pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log spong pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos la sred pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log spong pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Craving for the Dharma is so called because it is the cause for the abandonment of error.

original: chos su rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos su rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called craving for the Dharma because it is associated with the discrimination of the Dharma.

original: mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lta bas mngon par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen cing gnas te kun tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i lta bas mngon par zhen par byed do //
translated: It is attachment, abiding, and cognizing because, in the stage of the great, it is attachment through the discrimination of views.

original: 'bring gi gnas skabs na sems kyis gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'bring gi gnas skabs na sems kyis gnas par byed do //
translated: In the stage of the middling, it is abiding through the mind.

original: chung ngu'i gnas skabs na 'du shes kyis kun tu shes par byed do //
analyzed: chung ngu'i gnas skabs na 'du shes kyis kun tu shes par byed do //
translated: In the stage of the small, it is cognizing through discrimination.

original: chos rnam pa gsum ni phyin ci log dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum ni phyin ci log dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of Dharma are in accord with error.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
translated: They are the error of discrimination, the error of mind, and the error of view.

original: chos la sred pa @92b yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: chos la sred pa @92b yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: Craving for the Dharma is also taught in two ways.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par lta ba'i chos nyid dang / sgrub pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par lta ba'i chos nyid dang / sgrub pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: and the reality of practice.

original: skyon med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa'i don te /
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúfaultless‚Äù means ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: skyon gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyon gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the thing called a fault is called ‚Äúfaultless.‚ÄùüîΩOne does not see the emptiness of the external in the emptiness of the internal.

original: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid gzhan dag gis stongüîΩpar byas pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde bas na nang stong pa nyid la de stong par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la phyi stong pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong gi phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid gzhan dag gis stong par byas pa ni ma yin te / de bas na nang stong pa nyid la de stong par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The emptiness of the internal is empty of the intrinsic reality of the emptiness of the internal, but it is not made empty by other kinds of emptiness, such as the emptiness of the external.üîΩTherefore, in the emptiness of the internal, one does not seek the emptiness of the external

original: phyi stong pa nyid mi tshol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid la yang nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid mi tshol lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid la yang nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: in order to make it empty.üîΩThis is the meaning.üîΩSimilarly, in the emptiness of the external, one does not seek the emptiness of the internal

original: stong par bya ba'i phyir mi tshol te /
analyzed: stong par bya ba'i phyir mi tshol te /
translated: in order to make it empty.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar slob pa'i tshe gzugs shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i tshe gzugs shes par bya ste /
translated: When training in that way, one should know form,üîΩbut one should not even falsely project it.

original: de la rlom sems su yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ming tsam du zad par shes par byas te /
analyzed: de la rlom sems su yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ming tsam du zad par shes par byas te /
translated: This means that because all phenomena are empty of intrinsic reality, one should know that they are merely names.

original: ming tsam du zad par shes pa des kyang chos rnams la rlom sems su mi bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming tsam du zad par shes pa des kyang chos rnams la rlom sems su mi bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that is that one should not falsely project phenomena even with the knowledge that they are merely names.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught in that way up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha,

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya bas byang chub kyi sems yon tan dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya bas byang chub kyi sems yon tan dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: then the bodhisattva should not even falsely project the thought of awakening, which is the teaching of the thought of awakening together with its qualities.

original: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i sems la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de ni sems ma yin te zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i sems la bya'o //
translated: In this way, that mind is not mind. The term ‚Äúmind‚Äù refers to the imagined mind.

original: yongs su grub pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems chos kyi skur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems chos kyi skur gyur pa ni /
translated: The fulfilled mind, which is the dharmakƒÅya, is the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las 'das pas sems kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad las 'das pas sems kyi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot mind‚Äù because it is beyond all characteristics of conceptualization and discrimination, and thus has no characteristics of mind.

original: de bas na sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be ‚Äúthe luminous nature of mind.‚Äù

original: chos kyi sku'i sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The nature of the mind of the dharmakƒÅya is luminous.

original: de bas na sems ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na sems ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúnot mind‚Äù means it is not the imagined mind.

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'od gsal ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'od gsal ba nyid ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúNeither conjoined with nor disjoined from attachment‚Äù teaches its natural luminosity.

original: sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la @93a * //
analyzed: sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la @93a * //
translated: Previously, during the stage of being an ordinary being, attachment and aversion were conjoined with the mind.

original: sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i phyir bden pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa skye ba'i dus na yang nam mkha' bzhin du dri ma thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i phyir bden pa yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: And when it is born, it is not true, because it is not sullied by any stain, like space.

original: phyis sangs rgyas su gyur pa'i tshe yang sems de glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir dri ma de dag shin tu mi skye bas /
analyzed: phyis sangs rgyas su gyur pa'i tshe yang sems de glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang bral bas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir dri ma de dag shin tu mi skye bas /
translated: And when it becomes a Buddha later on, that mind is not free, because it is naturally pure, being free from the adventitious afflictions, and those stains are not produced at all.

original: sprin la sogs pa de dag dang mi ldan pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du 'od gsal ba'i phyir bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sprin la sogs pa de dag dang mi ldan pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du 'od gsal ba'i phyir bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And it is not non-free, because it is luminous, like space, which is not associated with clouds, etc.

original: gal te sngon ldan par gyur na ni phyis bral bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sngon ldan par gyur na ni phyis bral bar yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were previously associated, it would be free later on.

original: 'di ltar sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang /
translated: But in this way, even in the state of being previously sullied,

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pas de dag dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not associated with them, because it is naturally pure.

original: de'i phyir phyis kyang de dag dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyis kyang de dag dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not free from them later on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems gang la sems ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sems de yod dam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, what is the meaning of Is there a mind that is not a mind?

original: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin no zhes bya ba la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de'i gnas skabs na yang sems zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pas sems de sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du yod par gyur to snyam nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de sems ma yin no zhes bya ba la gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de'i gnas skabs na yang sems zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pas sems de sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du yod par gyur to snyam nas dris pa'o //
translated: Thus, the elder Subh≈´ti, thinking At that time, the mind is called 'mind,' so that mind exists as having the characteristic of not being a mind, asked this.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de la bdag ni sems kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de la bdag ni sems kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Then, the elder Subh≈´ti said, I do not say 'The characteristic of mind exists,'

original: sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yod do zhes ni mi smra'o brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa shin tu yongs su dag pa la tha dad du brjod pa'i dus na rnam pa gzhan du brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yod do zhes ni mi smra'o brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa shin tu yongs su dag pa la tha dad du brjod pa'i dus na rnam pa gzhan du brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: or 'The characteristic of not being a mind exists.' Because when the very pure state of inexpressibility is differentiated, it is not suitable to express it in another way.

original: sngon gyi shugs kyi rjes su 'brang bas sems zhes bya ba dang / sems ma yin zhes bya bar smra'o snyam du dgongs nas /üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'ang med pas dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩsems ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'am med pa gnyis kar yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi shugs kyi rjes su 'brang bas sems zhes bya ba dang / sems ma yin zhes bya bar smra'o snyam du dgongs nas / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang sems ma yin pa de la yod pa'ang med pas dmigs pa'am yod par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba gsungs te / sems ma yin pa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'am med pa gnyis kar yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Following the force of the past, one says mind and not mind.

original: mtha' gnyis la brten par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //üîΩde nas yang gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gal te de'i gnas skabs na mtha' gnyis kyis 'jigs pas gnyi ga ltar yang brjod du mi rung na /

original: @93b ci'i phyir khyod 'di skad du 'dri zhes khyod kyis brgal zhing brtags pa 'di cig rigs sam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: @93b ci'i phyir khyod 'di skad du 'dri zhes khyod kyis brgal zhing brtags pa 'di cig rigs sam zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Why do you ask this? Is this objection of yours appropriate?‚Äù

original: de skad gsungs pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te yod pa dang med pa dag med na /
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gal te yod pa dang med pa dag med na /
translated: When this was said, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra thought, ‚ÄúIf existence and nonexistence do not exist,

original: de lta na ni sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med par 'gyur na /üîΩci'i phyir sems ma yin pa zhes smra snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med par 'gyur na / ci'i phyir sems ma yin pa zhes smra snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: then the characteristic of non-mind would not exist.üîΩWhy then do you say ‚Äònon-mind‚Äô?‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thinking this, he said, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, what is this ‚Äònon-mind‚Äô that you speak of?‚Äù

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subh≈´ti thought,

original: de la bdag ni sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pas bsams te sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba mi smra'i sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gang 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa rtog pa can yin pa'i phyir de la sems zhes bya ba da ni de lta bu med pa'i phyir sems zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa tsam zhig khas blangs nas sems ma yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bdag ni sems ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pas bsams te sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba mi smra'i sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na gang 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa rtog pa can yin pa'i phyir de la sems zhes bya ba da ni de lta bu med pa'i phyir sems zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa tsam zhig khas blangs nas sems ma yin zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the self is not said to be non-mind because it has a different characteristic, but because it is not like the mind that existed previously in the state of impurity, which was changeable and conceptual. Now, since it is not like that, it is said to be non-mind, merely accepting the non-existence of the thing called mind.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu sems ma yin pa ni 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: To teach this, it is said: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, non-mind is unchanging and non-conceptual.

original: sngon sems kyi gnas skabs ltar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa can gyi dngos po med pa la 'dir sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon sems kyi gnas skabs ltar 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa can gyi dngos po med pa la 'dir sems ma yin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-existence of the thing that was changeable and conceptual, like the previous state of mind, is what is meant by non-mind here.

original: de skad smras pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus ci de'i gnas skabs na sems kho na 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: de skad smras pa dang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus ci de'i gnas skabs na sems kho na 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: When he said this, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra said, ‚ÄúIs it only the mind that is unchanging in that situation?

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam /
translated: When he said that, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra thought, ‚ÄúIs it only the mind that is unchanging and nonconceptual?

original: 'on te chos thams cad kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin snyam nas /üîΩtshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: 'on te chos thams cad kyang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin snyam nas / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar sems la 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: Or are all phenomena also unchanging and nonconceptual?‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: [≈öƒÅriputra] asked the venerable Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, just as the mind is unchanging and nonconceptual,üîΩis form also unchanging and nonconceptual?‚Äù

original: gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
analyzed: gzugs la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris so //
translated: and so on.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yang 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Then the elder Subh≈´ti taught, ‚ÄúThe qualities of a buddha up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are also unchanging and nonconceptual.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni brdzus te skyes pa'i bu dag ni pha'i snying las skyes pas na thugs las skyes pa'i sras zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sras thugs las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni brdzus te skyes pa'i bu dag ni pha'i snying las skyes pas na thugs las skyes pa'i sras zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One‚Äôs son, called ‚Äúborn of the heart,‚Äù is so called because he was born miraculously from his father‚Äôs heart.

original: yang na sras kyi thu bo la bya ste /üîΩde bzhin du gnas @94a * //
analyzed: yang na sras kyi thu bo la bya ste / de bzhin du gnas @94a * //
translated: Or he is the eldest son.

original: brtan 'di yang thugs kyi sems las skyes pas na thugs las skyes pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtan 'di yang thugs kyi sems las skyes pas na thugs las skyes pas zhes bya ste /
translated: In the same way, this elder is called ‚Äúborn of the heart‚Äù because he was born from the heart of the mind.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yid la byed pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yid la byed pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he arose from the mental attentions of serenity and insight.

original: zhal nas skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhal nas skyes pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called ‚Äúborn of the mouth‚Äù because he arose from the Dharma that is taught.

original: chos las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i chos las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called ‚Äúborn of the Dharma‚Äù because he arose from the Dharma of practice.

original: chos kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang 'bras bu dang rtog pa'i chos rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sprul pa zhes bya ba ni lam dang 'bras bu dang rtog pa'i chos rnams las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called ‚Äúan emanation of the Dharma‚Äù because he arose from the Dharma of the path, the result, and realization.

original: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi bdag por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi bdag por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey enjoy their share of the Dharma‚Äù means that they become the owners of the Dharma of nirvana.

original: zang zing gi bgo skal la spyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sred pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi bgo skal la spyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sred pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey do not enjoy their share of material things‚Äù means that they have abandoned craving.

original: chos rnams la mngon sum gyi ming dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid las gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la mngon sum gyi ming dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid las gzhan dag gis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are called those who have direct experience of the Dharma‚Äù means that they are not deprived of the Dharma by anyone else.

original: lus mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa dang / chos kyi sku mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus mngon sum du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa dang / chos kyi sku mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey have direct experience of the body‚Äù means that they have attained the meditative absorption of the formless realm and the meditative absorption of the form realm, and they have realized the Dharma body.

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi tshul gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgra dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la nyon mongs pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi tshul gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgra dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la nyon mongs pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are the supreme ones among those who abide in the absence of affliction‚Äù means that, in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, the meditative absorption that is the antidote to the afflictions is called the meditative absorption of the absence of affliction.

original: des gnas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des gnas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, it is called ‚Äúabiding in the absence of affliction.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad la nyon mongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All conceptual elaborations are called ‚Äúafflictions.‚Äù

original: de dag med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they do not exist, the meditative absorption that is free of conceptualization is called ‚Äúthe absence of affliction.‚Äù

original: des gnas pa la nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des gnas pa la nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, it is called ‚Äúabiding in the absence of affliction.‚Äù

original: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus legs so zhes bya ba'i bsngags pa la sogs pas mngon par dga' bar byas nas de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus legs so zhes bya ba'i bsngags pa la sogs pas mngon par dga' bar byas nas de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa yin par bstan te /
translated: Then the elder ≈öƒÅriputra, having expressed his approval with the word ‚Äúgood,‚Äù and so on, taught that a bodhisattva who practices in that way is irreversible.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la slob pa thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i phan 'dogs pa yin par brjod nas 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan to zhes rjes su yiüîΩrang bar byas te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la slob pa thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i phan 'dogs pa yin par brjod nas 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum rgya cher bstan to zhes rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, the three vehicles are extensively taught in this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: brtson pa'i phan yon gyi mjug bsdus so //
analyzed: brtson pa'i phan yon gyi mjug bsdus so //
translated: This concludes the summary of the benefits of diligence.

original: de ltar brtson pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits of diligence,

original: brtson pa la rnam pa @94b du yod snyam pa la brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan dgos te /
analyzed: brtson pa la rnam pa @94b du yod snyam pa la brtson pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan dgos te /
translated: it is necessary to teach the divisions of diligence, wondering how many types of diligence there are.

original: 'di man chad nges par 'byin pa sgrub pa drug bstan to //
analyzed: 'di man chad nges par 'byin pa sgrub pa drug bstan to //
translated: From here on, the six accomplishments of definite deliverance are taught.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i sgrub pa drug ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba sgrub pa dang / mi gnas par sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa dang / yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa dang / thabs la sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i sgrub pa drug ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba sgrub pa dang / mi gnas par sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa dang / yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa dang / thabs la sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par sgrub pa ste /
translated: The six practices that definitely bring about deliverance are the practice free from the two extremes, the practice of nonabiding, the practice of nonapprehending, the practice of thorough investigation, the practice of means, and the practice of quickly attaining manifest, complete buddhahood.

original: 'di ltar de dag nges par 'byin pa yin par yang mjug bsdus nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nges par 'byin pa yin par yang mjug bsdus nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn himself concludes that they are practices that definitely bring about deliverance, saying, ‚ÄúIn this way, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva abides in the stage of irreversibility by way of nonabiding.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung zhing /
translated: He is delivered into the state of omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: He approaches omniscience.‚Äù

original: drug po de dag kyang 'og nas go rims bzhin du so so'i gnas gnas nas ston to //
analyzed: drug po de dag kyang 'og nas go rims bzhin du so so'i gnas gnas nas ston to //
translated: Those six are taught below in their respective places.

original: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sgrub pa de drug gi skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sgrub pa de drug gi skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, the elder Subh≈´ti, in order to open up the occasion for those six perfections,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma 'tshal /
translated: says, ‚ÄúBlessed One, I do not know the bodhisattva,

original: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
analyzed: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
translated: I do not apprehend, I do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What bodhisattva, what perfection of wisdom should I instruct and edify?‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: This shows four things:

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i dbang gis tshad ma gsum po dag gis mi dmigs par gdams par 'os pa'i gang zag dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i dbang gis tshad ma gsum po dag gis mi dmigs par gdams par 'os pa'i gang zag dang /
translated: The person who is fit to be instructed not to apprehend by means of the three valid cognitions, by the power of direct perception, inference, and scriptural authority, the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gdams su rung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong nas gang zag la sbyor bar bya snyam ste /
analyzed: gdams su rung ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong nas gang zag la sbyor bar bya snyam ste /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom that is suitable to be instructed, and not seeing them as real, one thinks, ‚ÄúI will apply to the person.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis gsol to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis gsol to //
translated: and also the perfection of wisdom that is suitable to be instructed, and not seeing any person, I thought, ‚ÄòTo which perfection of wisdom should I give instructions and follow up with teachings?‚ÄôüîΩThe text up to the end is the request.

original: de nas yang gdams su rung ba'i dngos po gang yang tshad ma gsum gyis mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa'i chos kyis dngos po med pa'i chos la gdams par bya ba de nyid bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur te /üîΩchos dmigs @95a * //
analyzed: de nas yang gdams su rung ba'i dngos po gang yang tshad ma gsum gyis mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa'i chos kyis dngos po med pa'i chos la gdams par bya ba de nyid bdag gis 'gyod par 'gyur te / chos dmigs @95a * //
translated: Then again, since any thing that is suitable to be instructed is not observed by the three valid cognitions, I would regret teaching a nonexistent phenomenon with a nonexistent phenomenon.üîΩSince the phenomenon is not observed,

original: su med pa'i phyir gdams pa mi nus so snyam nas /
analyzed: su med pa'i phyir gdams pa mi nus so snyam nas /
translated: it is not possible to teach it.üîΩI do not know

original: bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
translated: any thing,

original: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ma dmigs / yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not observe it, and I do not see it.üîΩBlessed One, I do not know

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis dngos po ma 'tshal /
translated: any thing.

original: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bzhin du chos gang gis /
analyzed: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bzhin du chos gang gis /
translated: While not apprehending and not seeing any dharma, by what dharma should one instruct and teach in regard to any dharma?

original: chos gang la rjes su gdams shing bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba nas 'di nyid bdag 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: chos gang la rjes su gdams shing bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba nas 'di nyid bdag 'gyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: Up to: ‚ÄúI myself would have regret.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa la mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa la mi bya'i /
translated: Here, ‚Äúregret‚Äù does not mean remorse.

original: nyes par byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyes par byas pa'i dngos po la 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It means regret in regard to a thing that was done wrongly.

original: mi shes par byas te skyon du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes par byas te skyon du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it would be a fault to do it without knowing.

original: de nas yang de ltar sngar bstan pa'i gdams pa gzhag pas gang zag dang chos rnams dngos po med na /
analyzed: de nas yang de ltar sngar bstan pa'i gdams pa gzhag pas gang zag dang chos rnams dngos po med na /
translated: Then, in that way, by setting forth the instruction as previously taught, if persons and dharmas are not things,

original: ming tsam du zad par bzung ste /
analyzed: ming tsam du zad par bzung ste /
translated: they are apprehended as being just names.

original: ji ltar gang zag dang chos rnams la 'phel ba dang 'grib par bya snyam nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag dang chos rnams la 'phel ba dang 'grib par bya snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúHow should I increase and decrease persons and dharmas?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis chos thams cad ma 'tshal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis chos thams cad ma 'tshal /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, in that way I do not know any dharma.

original: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
analyzed: ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
translated: If one does not apprehend, does not see,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'am /
translated: the bodhisattva or the perfection of wisdom,üîΩhow can one increase or decrease a mere name?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i ming tsam gyis ji ltar 'phel ba dang / 'grib par bgyi zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa'i ming tsam gyis ji ltar 'phel ba dang / 'grib par bgyi zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bstan to //
translated: The text explains this.

original: yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The superimposition of what is not really existent is called ‚Äúincrease.‚Äù

original: yang dag par yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'grib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni 'grib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The denial of what is really existent is called ‚Äúdecrease.‚Äù

original: de nas ming de nyid kyang dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nas ming de nyid kyang dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Then, in order to show that even that name does not exist,

original: bcom ldan 'das ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis thug pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ming de yang gnas pa ma mchis thug pa ma mchis te /
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúThat name also has no basis, no foundation.‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming de ma mchis pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ming de ma mchis pas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúBecause that name does not exist.‚Äù

original: gnas pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos de ltar gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos de ltar gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo basis‚Äù means that conditioned phenomena do not exist in that way.

original: thug pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa lta bur gnas pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thug pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa lta bur gnas pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase no contact means that they do not abide like unconditioned things such as space.

original: de ltar bstan nas /üîΩgnas brtan gyis chos gzhan re re la yang sgro btags pa dang skur pa btab pa'i mtha' spangs par yang dag par mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming du gdags par 'os pa'i chos yang dag par
analyzed: de ltar bstan nas / gnas brtan gyis chos gzhan re re la yang sgro btags pa dang skur pa btab pa'i mtha' spangs par yang dag par mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming du gdags par 'os pa'i chos yang dag par
translated: Having taught that,

original: @95b rjes su ma mthong bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs /
analyzed: @95b rjes su ma mthong bar bstan pa'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das bdag gis gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa ma dmigs /
translated: the Elder, seeing that each of the other dharmas is also free from the extremes of superimposition and denial, in order to teach that he does not see any dharma that is worthy of being designated by the name of a bodhisattva or perfection of wisdom,üîΩhe says,

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, I do not see or observe the increase or decrease of form, etc.

original: phung po rnams dang khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / reg pa drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
analyzed: phung po rnams dang khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / reg pa drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / khams drug dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang /
translated: the aggregates, the elements, the sense spheres, the six contacts, the six groups of feeling, the six elements, the links of dependent origination, desire, anger, and ignorance,

original: kun nas ldang ba rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / bag la nyal ba rnams dang / kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa bcu gsum dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang / bag la nyal ba rnams dang / kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / srog la sogs pa bcu gsum dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang /
translated: the entanglements, the obscurations, the latent tendencies, the fetters, the views, the thirteen such as self, sentient being, and life force, all the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas dang /
translated: all the emptinesses, the factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the formless absorptions, the buddhas,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha dang lus su gyur pa la skyo ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / mig lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang /üîΩstobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang /
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba dang / lha dang lus su gyur pa la skyo ba dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'chi ba rjes su dran pa dang / mig lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang /
translated: the Dharma, the Sa·πÖgha, morality, generosity, the gods, the body, disenchantment, inhalation and exhalation, mindfulness of death, the five eyes, the six superknowledges,üîΩthe ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the correct understandings, the unique qualities of a buddha, dreams, illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, echoes,

original: mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar lin  pa'i phung po rnams dang / dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar lin  pa'i phung po rnams dang / dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
translated: optical illusions, reflections, and emanations, the aggregates that are conducive to enlightenment, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, the unconditioned, the conditioned, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the unobservable, the

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang /üîΩchos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang @96a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang @96a * //
translated: the absence of defilement and the absence of purification, suchness, unmistaken suchness, unaltered suchness, the real nature, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas,üîΩthe certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable element, virtue, nonvirtue,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: that with an offense, that without an offense, that with outflows, that without outflows, that with afflictions, that without afflictions, the mundane,üîΩand the supramundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang /
translated: The transcendent, the conditioned, the unconditioned, the afflictive, the purified, cyclic existence, and nirvana, as well as the phenomena of the past, present, and future,

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni /
translated: are all taught to be the suchness of all phenomena.

original: bdag cag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / phyogs bcu gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid so sor bstan to //
analyzed: bdag cag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / phyogs bcu gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid so sor bstan to //
translated: Our own Buddha Bhagavan and the Tathagatas together with the Sangha of Shravakas and Bodhisattvas in the worlds of the ten directions as numerous as the sands of the Ganges have individually taught the suchness of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams la bye brag ci yod ce na /
