translated: What is the difference between the terms suchness, unmistaken suchness, and so on?

original: yongs su grub pa'i 'jug pa tha dad pas tha dad de /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i 'jug pa tha dad pas tha dad de /
translated: They are different due to the different engagements of the fully present reality.

original: 'di la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'di la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The characteristic of the consummate is ninefold:

original: 'jigs pa med par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa dang / ngo bo nyid du yongs su grub pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yongs su grub pa dang /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa dang / ngo bo nyid du yongs su grub pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yongs su grub pa dang /
translated: consummate as fearless, consummate as nonerroneous, consummate as immutable, consummate as the nature, consummate as the cause of all purified phenomena,

original: dus thams cad du yongs su grub pa dang / phyir mi sdog par yongs su grub pa dang / de kho na nyid du yongs su grub pa dang / rtog ge'i lam las 'das par yongs su grub pa dang / 'jigs pa med par yongs su grub pa ni de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste /üîΩrtag tu de bzhin nyid du gnas shing mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yongs su grub pa dang / phyir mi sdog par yongs su grub pa dang / de kho na nyid du yongs su grub pa dang / rtog ge'i lam las 'das par yongs su grub pa dang / 'jigs pa med par yongs su grub pa ni de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste / rtag tu de bzhin nyid du gnas shing mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: consummate at all times, consummate as irreversible, consummate as reality, consummate as beyond the path of speculation, and consummate as fearless.

original: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yongs su grub pa ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is said that the consummate as fearless is suchness tathatƒÅ because it always abides as suchness and is fearless.üîΩThe consummate as nonerroneous is said to be the undifferentiated suchness of nonerroneous tathatƒÅ because it is the suchness of nonerroneous phenomena.

original: nor ba dang phyin ci log tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor ba dang phyin ci log tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error or perversion.

original: 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa ni gzhan ma yin ba de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa ni gzhan ma yin ba de bzhin nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: The perfected nature that is unchanging is called ‚Äúsuchness that is not other.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no change into something else.

original: ngo bo nyid du yongs su grub pa ni chos nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du yongs su grub pa ni chos nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: The perfected nature that is the reality of the three natures is called ‚Äúreality.üîΩ‚Äù

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reality that is the emptiness which is the universal characteristic of all dharmas.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yongs su @96b grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yongs su @96b grub pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The perfected nature that is the cause of all the purified dharmas is called ‚Äúthe dharma-dhƒÅtu.üîΩ‚Äù

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dbyings dang / rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dbyings dang / rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the dharmadhƒÅtu of the buddhadharmas, such as the ten powers and the four fearlessnesses.

original: dus thams cad du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos gnas pa nyid ces gsungs te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos gnas pa nyid ces gsungs te /
translated: The perfected nature that is the characteristic of all times is called ‚Äúthe stability of the dharmas.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether tathƒÅgatas appear or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The reality of phenomena is their abiding nature,

original: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in that way at all times.

original: phyir mi ldog par yongs su grub pa ni chos skyon med pa nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par yongs su grub pa ni chos skyon med pa nyid ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: Perfecting the irreversible is called the faultless quality of phenomena,

original: sa dang po yan chad de rab tu rtogs pas /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad de rab tu rtogs pas /
translated: because, having realized the first stage,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la zhugs par 'gyur te /
translated: one enters into the correct certainty,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub skyon med pa la zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub skyon med pa la zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has entered into the faultless, perfect enlightenment.

original: de kho na nyid du yongs su grub pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du yongs su grub pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Perfecting the reality is called the correct limit,

original: yang dag pa nyid de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtog ge'i lam las 'das par yongs su grub pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro // rtog ge'i lam las 'das par yongs su grub pa ni /
translated: because that reality is the ultimate, unerring limit.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Perfecting the transcendence of the path of speculation is called the inconceivable realm,üîΩbecause it is the ultimate object of the path of meditation.

original: brjod du med pa dang / so sor rang gis rig pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa dang / so sor rang gis rig pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inexpressible and is to be realized personally, and so it is beyond the scope of all inference.

original: gzhan yang kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: Moreover, all imagined things are like dreams,üîΩbecause they are not as they are imagined to be by the ignorant.

original: rab tu rtogs par gyur pa rnams la /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs par gyur pa rnams la /
translated: But for those who have realized the truth,

original: de ltar mi 'gyur bas de las bzlog pa la ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur bas de las bzlog pa la ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: the opposite of that is called ‚Äúsuchness,‚Äù

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness exists at all times.

original: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: All things are like illusions,

original: nor bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear as something that they are not.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called ‚Äúnonerroneous suchness,‚Äù

original: ma nor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature that is not erroneous.

original: chos thams cad ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni smig rgyu lta bu ste /
translated: All things are like mirages,

original: gzhan du gnas la gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gnas la gzhan du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear as something other than what they are.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called ‚Äúnondifferent suchness,‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is the nature that is not different.

original: dus thams cad du gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it never changes into anything else at any time.

original: chos thams cad ni chu zla lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chu zla lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like the moon in the water,

original: chos de'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: chos de'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: because they are not the nature of that phenomenon,

original: chos de'i bdag nyid du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de'i bdag nyid du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but they appear as if they were the nature of that phenomenon.

original: chu zla ni zla ba'am yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chu zla ni zla ba'am yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The moon in the water is not the moon,üîΩbut it is not something other than the moon.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the ‚Äúnature of phenomena,‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ultimate nature.

original: chos thams cad ni dri za'i grong khyer @97a * //üîΩlta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dri za'i grong khyer @97a * // lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like a city of gandharvas,

original: don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unreal.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the ‚Äúdharma-constituent,‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu yin zhing don yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu yin zhing don yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the qualities of a buddha and is not unreal.

original: chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni brag ca lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like an echo,

original: yun thung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun thung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are short-lived.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the ‚Äústability of the Dharma,‚Äù

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of stability.

original: chos thams cad ni mig yor lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mig yor lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like optical illusions,

original: ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have an uncertain nature.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the faultless nature of phenomena,

original: nges pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a certain nature.

original: chos thams cad ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like reflections,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rnam par 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are transformations of consciousness.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the limit of reality,

original: don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ultimate.

original: chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like magical incarnations,

original: sems kyi 'du byed las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from the formative forces of the mind.

original: de las bzlog pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is called the inconceivable realm,

original: yid kyi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends all mental objects.

original: don dam par ni thams cad kyang yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad kyang yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: In the ultimate sense, all are included in the category of the perfected nature.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dmigs su med pas /
translated: Thus, since the increase and decrease of all phenomena are not observed,

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' yongs su spang bar bstan nas /üîΩda ni ming dmigs su med par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' yongs su spang bar bstan nas / da ni ming dmigs su med par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gang yang 'di lta ste /
translated: the extremes of superimposition and denial are completely abandoned.üîΩNow, in order to teach that names are not observed, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMoreover, this so-called bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes chos nyid kyi brdar gdags pa de yang /üîΩphung po rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes chos nyid kyi brdar gdags pa de yang / phung po rnams sam /
translated: which is a designation for the reality of phenomena,üîΩis not described as being in any of the aggregates,

original: khams sam / skye mched rnams gang du yang brjod du ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khams sam / skye mched rnams gang du yang brjod du ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: elements, or sense sources.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: This teaches two things.

original: gang du yang brjod par bgyi ba ma lags zhes bgyi ba'i 'gres kyis ni ming dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs su bsdur med par bstan to //
analyzed: gang du yang brjod par bgyi ba ma lags zhes bgyi ba'i 'gres kyis ni ming dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs su bsdur med par bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis not described as being in any of‚Äù teaches that it is not included in the collection of phenomena such as names, aggregates, elements, sense sources, and so on.

original: gang yang brjod du ma mchis zhes bya ba'i 'gres kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi nang du bsdur med par bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang brjod du ma mchis zhes bya ba'i 'gres kyis dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi nang du bsdur med par bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not expressed by anything at all‚Äù indicates that the nature of phenomena cannot be subsumed within the categories of virtue and nonvirtue, objectionable and unobjectionable, and so forth.

original: gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchis pa lags so zhes bgyi ba'i 'gres kyis shin tu med kyang /
analyzed: gang gis kyang brjod du ma mchis pa lags so zhes bgyi ba'i 'gres kyis shin tu med kyang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not expressed by anything at all‚Äù indicates that the nature of phenomena is not even nonexistent.

original: 'jig rten na grags pa @97b rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams dang / kun brtags pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid du grags pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa @97b rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa rnams dang / kun brtags pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid du grags pa dang /
translated: It is known in the world as a mere imputation, as in the case of dreams, illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, echoes, optical illusions, reflections, and emanations.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du grags pa /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du grags pa /
translated: It is known as the perfected nature in the case of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
translated: the establishment of dharmas,üîΩthe certification of dharmas,üîΩthe very limit of reality,üîΩthe expanse of reality,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid du grags pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid du grags pa /
translated: the dharma-constituent of bodhisattvas,üîΩthe perfection of morality,üîΩthe perfection of concentration,üîΩthe perfection of wisdom,üîΩthe perfection of liberation,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / nyan thos kyi chos nyid du grags pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / nyan thos kyi chos nyid du grags pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the vision of wisdom of liberation,üîΩthe stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang /
translated: the fruits of once-returner, non-returner, and arhat, the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of stream-enterers and so forth, the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi ming smros nas bstan to /üîΩ// / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi ming smros nas bstan to / // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: the buddhas, and the dharmas of the buddhas.

original: de nas yang mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa de nyid tha mang mjug bsdus nas nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas yang mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa de nyid tha mang mjug bsdus nas nges par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to teach the definite emergence by way of a concluding summary of that very establishment free from the two extremes,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
translated: the text explains from ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, not abiding in the stage of irreversibility, abides in the manner of non-abiding, and should be known as one who has definitely emerged into omniscience.‚Äù

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa'i chos rnams dang / ming smos te bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa'i chos rnams dang / ming smos te bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the Dharma that establishes freedom from the two extremes, and having taught by mentioning the names,

original: de'i 'og tu mi gnas par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi gnas par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: after that, in order to teach the establishment of non-abiding,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúMoreover, BhagavƒÅn, when bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: they should not abide in form, and so on.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: This establishment is also taught in two aspects:

original: chos rnams la mi gnas pa dang / chos nyid la mi gnas pa'o //üîΩde la chos @98a * //
analyzed: chos rnams la mi gnas pa dang / chos nyid la mi gnas pa'o // de la chos @98a * //
translated: not abiding in phenomena and not abiding in the intrinsic nature.

original: rnams la mi gnas pa ni gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnams la mi gnas pa ni gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Among those, not abiding in phenomena is taught from ‚Äúthey should not abide in form‚Äù up to

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, for these reasons, when bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthey should not abide in form, and so on.‚Äù

original: yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
translated: The text explains up to ‚Äúone should not dwell on the letters.‚Äù

original: chos nyid la mi gnas pa ni /
analyzed: chos nyid la mi gnas pa ni /
translated: Dwelling neither in the reality nor in the non-reality of form, etc.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar gnas par mi bgyi ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The text explains up to ‚Äúthe bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should not dwell thinking ‚Äòform is impermanent,‚Äô etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis bshad do //
translated: up to ‚Äòwithout completing the perfection of wisdom, one will not emerge in the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩThe summary verse for the proof of freedom from the two extremes is:

original: mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa'i 'gres kyis tha mar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang bral bar sgrub pa'i 'gres kyis tha mar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas te /
translated: In the end, one dwells on the irreversible ground by the method of non-dwelling,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ngo zhes bya ba las /
translated: and emerges in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes smos pa'i phyir tshig tha ma'i gnas skabs su mi gnas par sgrub pa'i 'gres smos pa yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis zhes smos pa'i phyir tshig tha ma'i gnas skabs su mi gnas par sgrub pa'i 'gres smos pa yin par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Because it says ‚Äúin a non-abiding way,‚Äù the repetition ‚Äúdoes not abide‚Äù in the context of the last phrase should be applied.

original: da ni mi gnas par sgrub pa thams cad kyi 'gres dang po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mi gnas par sgrub pa thams cad kyi 'gres dang po bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the repetition of all the proofs of non-abiding should be explained first.

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Do not abide in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya bas phung po lnga la gnas par mi bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya bas phung po lnga la gnas par mi bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Do not abide in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. Having taught that one should not abide in the five aggregates,

original: de nas yang so sor gnas par mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir gzugs las brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas yang so sor gnas par mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir gzugs las brtsams te /
translated: then, in order to teach the reason for not abiding in each, beginning with form,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong te /
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúThus, Subh≈´ti, form is empty of form.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags /
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gzugs ma mchis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gzugs ma mchis te /
translated: Form is not apart from emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
translated: Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: And also emptiness is form.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste sngar gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs nas /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste sngar gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs nas /
translated: The intention is as follows: Having previously stated, ‚ÄúOne should not abide in form,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di la gzugs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa 'di la gzugs kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: it is stated here, ‚ÄúIn this way, form is empty of form.‚Äù Here, form is threefold:

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i @98b gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i @98b gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs so //
translated: imagined form, conceptually differentiated form, and the reality of form.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung ba dngos po'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung ba dngos po'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the form that is apprehended by foolish, ordinary beings as having the characteristics of being suitable as form and so on is called ‚Äúimagined form.‚Äù

original: de nyid rnam pa gang gi don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa gang gi don du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: That very [form] which becomes the object of consciousness appearing in some aspect is called ‚Äúconceptually differentiated form.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa de gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa de gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: The form that is the ultimate, which is the mere suchness that is the thoroughly established nature that is free from the aspects of the imputed and the conceived, is called the ‚Äúform of reality.‚Äù

original: de la yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs su yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzugs su rnam par brtags pa yul gyi rnam par snang ba'i gzugs kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs su yod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzugs su rnam par brtags pa yul gyi rnam par snang ba'i gzugs kyis stong pas na /
translated: The form that is the ultimate, which is the thoroughly established nature, is empty of the form that is the imputed, which has the characteristics of existing and so on, and the form that is the conceived, which is the appearance of objects.

original: stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: de skad bshad pa dang / kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de la ci gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig kyang yod dam /
analyzed: de skad bshad pa dang / kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de la ci gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzhan zhig kyang yod dam /
translated: If it is explained in this way, then is there another characteristic of form apart from the form of reality that is empty of the imputed and conceived forms?

original: gang gi phyir de la yang gzugs zhes bya snyam du the tshom za ba de'i phyir gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags zhes bya bsad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang gzugs zhes bya snyam du the tshom za ba de'i phyir gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs ma lags zhes bya bsad de /
translated: Because of that, there is doubt, thinking ‚ÄúIs it form?‚Äù Therefore, ‚ÄúWhatever is the emptiness of form, that is not form.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi gzugs de ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs kyis stong pa gang yin pa de nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi gzugs de ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: The emptiness of the imagined and the conceptually differentiated forms is the form of reality, the characteristic of the perfected. That is not the reality of form.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi rnam pa las dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi rnam pa las dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is because it is completely isolated from the aspect of form.

original: de skad bshad pa dang gal te gzugs rnam pa thams cad du med na /
analyzed: de skad bshad pa dang gal te gzugs rnam pa thams cad du med na /
translated: If it is explained in that way, if form does not exist in any way,

original: 'o na gang gis stong na 'di la stong pa nyid ces bya /
analyzed: 'o na gang gis stong na 'di la stong pa nyid ces bya /
translated: then by what is it empty that this is called emptiness?

original: yul med pa'i stong pa nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: yul med pa'i stong pa nyid kyang med la /
translated: There is no emptiness of a non-existent object.

original: chos las chos nyid gzhan pa yang mi rigs pa dang / chos nyid las chos gzhan pa yang mi rigs so snyam du the tshom za ba de'i phyir stong pa nyid las gud nas yang gzugs ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos las chos nyid gzhan pa yang mi rigs pa dang / chos nyid las chos gzhan pa yang mi rigs so snyam du the tshom za ba de'i phyir stong pa nyid las gud nas yang gzugs ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúApart from emptiness, there is no form.‚Äù

original: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that taught?üîΩIt is like this.

original: de ni 'di ltar chu ma dangs pa la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chu ma dangs pa la /
translated: In the case of turbid water,

original: ma dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnyog pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: ma dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnyog pa zhes bya la /
translated: at the time of turbidity it is called ‚Äúturbid,‚ÄùüîΩand at the time of clarity it is called ‚Äúclear water.‚Äù

original: dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni chu dangs pa zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' ma dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rmugs pa @99a * //üîΩzhes bya la /
analyzed: dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni chu dangs pa zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' ma dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rmugs pa @99a * // zhes bya la /
translated: Just as in the case of the sky, at the time of turbidity it is called ‚Äúhazy,‚Äù

original: dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni nam mkha' gsal ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dangs pa'i gnas skabs na ni nam mkha' gsal ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: and at the time of clarity it is called ‚Äúclear sky.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid 'di yang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo dang tha dad par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di yang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo dang tha dad par ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in the case of emptiness, at the time of impurity it is not different from childish ordinary beings.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs na ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: In the impure state, it is called form and so on, and in the pure state, it is called emptiness.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid las tha dad par gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid las tha dad par gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no dharma such as form that is separate from emptiness.

original: de ltar chos dang chos nyid dag la tha dad pa med par gyur pas /üîΩgang gi tshe chos nyid kyis chos brjod pa de'i tshe gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos dang chos nyid dag la tha dad pa med par gyur pas / gang gi tshe chos nyid kyis chos brjod pa de'i tshe gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no difference between dharmas and their reality,üîΩwhen reality is expressed by means of dharmas, at that time, form itself is called emptiness.

original: gang gi tshe chos kyis chos nyid brjod par gyur pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos kyis chos nyid brjod par gyur pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya'o //
translated: When dharmas are expressed by means of reality, at that time, emptiness itself is called form.

original: yang na gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
analyzed: yang na gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid /
translated: Or, form itself is emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de chos nyid kyi gzugs la bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de chos nyid kyi gzugs la bya'o //
translated: and emptiness itself is form. Emptiness here is suchness, which is the reality of form.

original: de ltar kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de dag shin tu med pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i gzugs la yang gnas su mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs de dag shin tu med pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i gzugs la yang gnas su mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because those imagined and discriminated forms do not exist at all, and because they are not suitable as the basis of the perfected form,

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äúone should not settle down on form.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to feeling, etc.

original: yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru rnams la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge rnams la gnas par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru rnams la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not settle down on the letters‚Äù means one should not settle down on the syllables of letters such as ‚Äúa.‚Äù

original: yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la gnas par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge'i 'bru rnams la brten nas skye ba med pa'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs kyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de la yi
analyzed: yi ge mngon par sgrub pa la gnas par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge'i 'bru rnams la brten nas skye ba med pa'i don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs kyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de la yi
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not settle down on the manifestation of letters‚Äù means that one should not settle down on the consciousness of form that arises in dependence on the syllables of letters such as ‚Äúa,‚Äù and which follows the meaning of non-arising.

original: ge mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: ge mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: That is expressed by the term ‚Äúmanifestation of letters.‚Äù

original: de la yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should not settle down on that either.

original: gzungs kyi shes pa de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzungs kyi shes pa de yang gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: And that cognition of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is also primordially unborn.

original: aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba de lta bur brjod pa las mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi sgo zhes bya ba de lta bur brjod pa las mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The syllable a is called the door of all dharmas. It is accomplished by such expressions.

original: tshig tu brjod pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab tu rno ba kha cig gis ni skye ba med pa'i don gcig la brten te zhugs na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang po bar ma rnams kyis ni yi ge gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa de yang byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rab tu rno ba kha cig gis ni skye ba med pa'i don gcig la brten te zhugs na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rkyen du 'gyur ro // dbang po bar ma rnams kyis ni yi ge gnyis la brten nas /
translated: Moreover, that verbal expression, for some bodhisattvas of sharp faculties, when engaged in based on the meaning of non-arising, becomes a condition for perfect enlightenment.

original: tshig tu brjod pa gnyis la goms par byas pa las @99b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa gnyis la goms par byas pa las @99b 'gyur ro //
translated: For those of middling faculties, it becomes a condition for perfect enlightenment when they are familiar with two verbal expressions based on two syllables.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams kyis ni tshig tu brjod pa du ma la brten nas goms par byas na mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams kyis ni tshig tu brjod pa du ma la brten nas goms par byas na mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: For those of dull faculties, it becomes a condition for perfect enlightenment when they are familiar with it based on many verbal expressions.

original: de bas na gcig brjod pa dang gnyis brjod pa dang mang po brjod pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gcig brjod pa dang gnyis brjod pa dang mang po brjod pa la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, one should not dwell on the expression of one, two, or many.

original: chos nyid mi gnas pa'i 'gres la yang /
analyzed: chos nyid mi gnas pa'i 'gres la yang /
translated: The same is true of the non-abiding pattern of reality.üîΩForm is impermanent, because the nature of form is empty.

original: gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi rtag pa ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste zhes bya ba la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mi rtag pa ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The impermanence of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is characterized by arising and ceasing.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the imagined characteristic.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
translated: The bodhisattvas, based on the characteristic of impermanence, explain the meaning of non-existence as the meaning of impermanence.

original: 'di ltar rtag tu yod pa la rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag tu yod pa la rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which always exists is called permanent.

original: de las brjod pa rtag tu med cing dus thams cad du med pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las brjod pa rtag tu med cing dus thams cad du med pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is never expressed, which does not exist at all times, is called impermanent by the bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na med pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam par mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of non-existence is ultimate impermanence.

original: gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don dam par mi rtag pa gang yin pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa ni gzugs mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don dam par mi rtag pa gang yin pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: Impermanent form is empty of the nature of impermanent form. This is the ultimate impermanence of bodhisattvas, which is empty of the nature of impermanence that has the characteristic of arising and ceasing imagined by the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs mi rtag pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid ma lags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa'i stong pa nyid gang lags pa de yang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid ma lags so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The emptiness of impermanent form is not impermanent form itself.

original: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de /
translated: Thus, the suchness of ultimate impermanent form

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: is not the nature of imagined impermanent form.

original: de bas na don dam pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the impermanence of ultimate form is empty of the impermanence of imagined form.

original: de lta na ni chos las chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos las chos nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: If that is so, then the reality of form would be different from form.

original: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gzugs mi rtag pa ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gud na yang gzugs mi rtag pa ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúApart from emptiness, form is not found.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid las gud na kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gud na kun brtags pa'i gzugs mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The impermanence of imagined form does not exist apart from suchness.

original: chu dangs pa dang / nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chu dangs pa dang / nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like clear water and space.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad par gyur pa med pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya @100a * //üîΩba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad par gyur pa med pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang gzugs mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya @100a * // ba gsungs te /
translated: Since it is not different, therefore it is said, ‚ÄúEmptiness is the impermanence of form.‚Äù

original: gzugs mi rtag pa'i stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyi sgrar brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag pa'i stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid kyi sgrar brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The emptiness of the impermanence of form is called the term ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: de ltar mi gnas par sgrub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas par sgrub pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the practice of non-abiding,

original: gnas pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to teach the faults of abiding,üîΩthe Lord said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if a bodhisattva great being, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gal te thabs mi mkhas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung ba'i yid kyis gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod kyi /
analyzed: gal te thabs mi mkhas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung ba'i yid kyis gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod kyi /
translated: through lack of skill in means, with a mind fallen into grasping at self and grasping at ‚Äúmine,‚Äù abides in form, then he practices the accumulation of form,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: but does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te thabs mi mkhas pas /
analyzed: gal te thabs mi mkhas pas /
translated: If, through lack of skill in means,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par bzung nas chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mi shes pas bdag ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par bzung nas chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mi shes pas bdag ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: one grasps incorrectly, not knowing the characteristic of the nature of non-entityness of phenomena, one thinks ‚ÄúI am the nature of form‚ÄùüîΩor ‚Äúthis form is me‚Äù

original: gzugs 'di ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or ‚Äúmine is form.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du byed pa ste gzugs su rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su song ba 'du byed kyi chos la spyod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya bar gzugs la gnas na de gzugs mngon par 'du byed pa ste gzugs su rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su song ba 'du byed kyi chos la spyod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the characteristic of form. If one abides in form, then one is engaged in the formation of form, one is engaged in the conditioned phenomena that follow after the conceptualization of form.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one is not engaged in the perfection of wisdom, which follows after the characteristic of emptiness.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the danger of being engaged in formation,

original: mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bgyi ba la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, One who is engaged in formation is not cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar thabs mi mkhas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung bas mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar thabs mi mkhas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung bas mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na /
translated: Why is it that, by such lack of skill in means, one who has fallen into the grasping of 'I' and 'mine' is engaged in formation?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnal 'byor la 'jug pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pas nges par 'byung ba rnams thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i rnal 'byor la 'jug pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pas nges par 'byung ba rnams thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: The Blessed One said, If they do not attain the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, they will not attain the practice of the perfection of wisdom, the engagement in the yoga of non-apprehension, and the definite emergence through completion.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni yongs su gzung ba ma mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzugs ni yongs su gzung ba ma mchis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, Because form is non-apprehensible, etc.

original: 'di ni yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the accomplishment of non-apprehension.

original: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This accomplishment is also taught through three aspects:

original: chos yongs su mi 'dzin @100b pa dang / mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chos yongs su mi 'dzin @100b pa dang / mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: not apprehending phenomena, not apprehending signs, and not apprehending cognition.

original: de las chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni /
analyzed: de las chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni /
translated: Among those, the continuation of not apprehending phenomena is:

original: gzugs ni yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From form is non-apprehensible up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang nang stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang nang stong pa nyid nas /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is inner emptiness, up toüîΩthe emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚Äònon-apprehension‚Äô because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: The repetition for not apprehending signs is: Why is that?

original: de ni mtshan mar brjod pa ma lags te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni mtshan mar brjod pa ma lags te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: It is not described as a sign, and so on, up to

original: de de ltar zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: de de ltar zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
translated: Having entered like that, he does not apprehend form,

original: tshor ba yongs su ma bzung ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba yongs su ma bzung ba nas /
translated: does not apprehend feeling, and so on, up to

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: does not apprehend the very limit of reality.

original: shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni /
analyzed: shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres ni /
translated: The repetition for not apprehending cognition is:

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Because he does not apprehend the existence of all phenomena that are empty of their own marks, and so on, up to

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: Blessed One, it is because all phenomena are not apprehended.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva.

original: de la dang po chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres las /
analyzed: de la dang po chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres las /
translated: In that context, the first of the series on not grasping at dharmas is:

original: gzugs ni yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbdag gi phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung ba'i rgyu gang gis kyang /
analyzed: gzugs ni yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni / bdag gi phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin par lhung ba'i rgyu gang gis kyang /
translated: Form is ungraspable.

original: gzugs su gzung ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs su gzung ba med de /
translated: Because of the nature of form, there is no form that is grasped by any cause that has fallen into the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyad pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, if one engages in conditioning, one is not engaging in the practice of the perfection of wisdom of ultimate reality.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs yongs su gzung ba med ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs yongs su gzung ba med ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is form said to be ungraspable?

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi slad du gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de yang rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi slad du gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because the ungraspability of form is not form, due to the emptiness of its own nature.

original: 'di la yongs su gzung ba med ces bya ba ni yongs su bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste /üîΩde skad brjod de chos nyid kyi gzugs kyis yongs su gzung ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la yongs su gzung ba med ces bya ba ni yongs su bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid la bya ste / de skad brjod de chos nyid kyi gzugs kyis yongs su gzung ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúit is not apprehended‚Äù should be understood as having the character of being fully accomplished.üîΩThe fully accomplished nature that is not apprehended by the form of reality is not the nature of imagined form.

original: chos nyid kyi chos ni yongs su gzung ba med do zhes bya bar @101a * //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi chos ni yongs su gzung ba med do zhes bya bar @101a * //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe reality of phenomena is not apprehended‚Äù should be applied to the fully accomplished nature.

original: sbyar ro // rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa gang yang sngar yongs su bzung nas phyis gnyen po gzhan gang gis kyang stong par bya ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: sbyar ro // rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa gang yang sngar yongs su bzung nas phyis gnyen po gzhan gang gis kyang stong par bya ba ni med kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the emptiness of essential nature‚Äù means that no aspect of a phenomenon such as form is apprehended as empty by any other antidote after it has been fully apprehended.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe emptiness of essential nature‚Äù means that its essential nature is emptiness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to feelings and so on up to the perfect end.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bgyi ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bgyi ba ste /
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings‚Äô meditative stabilization called the unapprehended circle of all phenomena.

original: rgya che ba phul du bgyi ba /
analyzed: rgya che ba phul du bgyi ba /
translated: It is vast, sublime,

original: tshad ma mchis pa /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa /
translated: immeasurable,

original: nges pa / mi 'phrogs pa /
analyzed: nges pa / mi 'phrogs pa /
translated: certain, and invincible.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni de'i chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni de'i chos bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not shared in common with all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.‚Äù This is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor de la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor de la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in that meditative stabilization‚Äù and so on teaches the benefits.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang /
translated: And that knowledge of all aspects

original: nang stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas /
translated: is unapprehended because of the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyi ye shes yongs su sbyangs pa chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i mthar phyin pa ni rnam
analyzed: dngos po med pa ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyi ye shes yongs su sbyangs pa chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i mthar phyin pa ni rnam
translated: up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.‚Äù This is the knowledge of all aspects that has purified all the emptinesses and has reached the culmination of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: would be called ‚Äúthe knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: de bas na de yang yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de yang yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is also not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir de ni mtshan mar brjod pa ma lags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mtshan mar brjod pa ma lags zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is not described as a causal sign.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is also free from the causal sign of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam pa yong ye med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam pa yong ye med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it never has the aspect of a causal sign.

original: 'di ltar mtshan ma ni nyon mongs pa ma lags pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma nyid sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par 'gyur bas na nyon mongs pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma ni nyon mongs pa ma lags pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma nyid sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par 'gyur bas na nyon mongs pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause a causal sign is not a mental affliction.‚Äù The causal signs of the conceptual thoughts of bodhisattvas are taught to be mental afflictions because they cause the mind-stream to become afflicted.

original: de dag gis kyang mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i 'gres bstan te /
translated: They also teach the pattern of not apprehending causal signs.

original: mtshan ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma gang zhe na /
translated: What are causal signs?

original: gzugs ni mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are form, etc.

original: de dag thams cad kyang don dam par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pas spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang don dam par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yin pas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: All of these are afflictions of bodhisattvas ultimately, and so are to be abandoned.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not like attachment and so on.‚ÄùüîΩIf the perfection of wisdom were apprehended as a sign, even the wandering mendicant Subhadra would have had faith in it.

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @101b mtshan mar bzung ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma med par sgrub pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @101b mtshan mar bzung ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma med par sgrub pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: This passage clarifies the establishment of the absence of signs.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni kun tu rgyu de sngon mtshan ma med par sgrub pa ma gtogs pa de la dad pa bskyed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni kun tu rgyu de sngon mtshan ma med par sgrub pa ma gtogs pa de la dad pa bskyed de /
translated: ‚ÄúEven the wandering mendicant Subhadra would have had faith in this gnosis of omniscience‚Äù means that he would have generated faith in it, except for the fact that he had previously established the absence of signs.

original: dad pa de nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa skyes shing thob par gyur gyi /
analyzed: dad pa de nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa skyes shing thob par gyur gyi /
translated: Through that very faith, the knowledge of the absence of signs arose and he attained it.

original: chos thams cad yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad yul du ma gyur pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because all phenomena are not objects, it is not by a cognition that is signless.

original: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la so sor zhugs nas /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la so sor zhugs nas /
translated: The so-called limited cognition is that which, having engaged with phenomena individually,

original: gzugs bzung ste so sor brtags na gzugs kyi mtshan ma ma dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs bzung ste so sor brtags na gzugs kyi mtshan ma ma dmigs so //
translated: having taken up form, and having investigated, does not observe the sign of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: Similarly, having taken up feeling, etc.,

original: so sor brtags na tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma yang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: so sor brtags na tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma yang ma dmigs so //
translated: having investigated, it does not observe the sign of the phenomena of feeling, etc.

original: de bas na de de ltar zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: de bas na de de ltar zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
translated: Therefore, having engaged in that way, it does not apprehend form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and similarly, it does not apprehend feeling, discrimination, composites, or consciousness, and so on up to:

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar du bshad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yongs su ma bzung zhes bya ba'i bar du bshad de /
translated: it does not apprehend the very limit of reality.

original: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba bshad de /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba bshad de /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, it explains, ‚ÄúHe does not observe the apprehension of any phenomena that are empty of their own characteristics.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa des re re la mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par zhugs pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa des re re la mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par zhugs pas /
translated: The cognition of signlessness engages in the aspect of signlessness with regard to each of those phenomena.

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes par 'gyur te /üîΩde bas na yongs su 'dzin pa'i gang zag gam /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes par 'gyur te / de bas na yongs su 'dzin pa'i gang zag gam /
translated: Thus, it comes to know that all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics.

original: shes pa ma dmigs so //
analyzed: shes pa ma dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, he does not observe the person who apprehends them or the cognition that apprehends them.

original: yang de'i gtan tshigs su 'di ltar des shes pa thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /üîΩphyi rol tu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: yang de'i gtan tshigs su 'di ltar des shes pa thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong / phyi rol tu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, it explains, ‚ÄúIn that way, he does not see that cognition as inner, outer, or both inner and outer by way of attaining knowledge and realization.‚Äù

original: thos pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: thos pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: He does not see that cognition as inner, outer, or both inner and outer by way of attaining knowledge and realization.

original: thos pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩkun tu rgyu des bdag gi shes pa bzung nas bdag gi shes pa 'dis chos kyi khyad par ma thob pa rnams thob po zhe 'am /
analyzed: thos pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyis shes pa de bzhin du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba gsungs te / kun tu rgyu des bdag gi shes pa bzung nas bdag gi shes pa 'dis chos kyi khyad par ma thob pa rnams thob po zhe 'am /
translated: Just as it is known through hearing and realization, it is said because it is not seen as real.üîΩ That wandering mendicant, having taken up his own knowledge, thinks,

original: bdag @102a * //
analyzed: bdag @102a * //
translated: Either Through this knowledge of mine, I have obtained the special qualities that were not obtained before,üîΩor Through this knowledge of mine, I have realized the qualities that were not realized before.

original: shes pa 'dis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par ma rtogs so zhes thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa yongs su brtags nas shes pa de bdag la gnas pa dang / phyi rol la gnas pa dang / gnyis ka la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa 'dis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par ma rtogs so zhes thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa yongs su brtags nas shes pa de bdag la gnas pa dang / phyi rol la gnas pa dang / gnyis ka la gnas pa dang /
translated: Having imagined attainment and realization, he does not see that knowledge as abiding in himself, in external things, in both,üîΩor as abiding in something other than those.

original: de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bas na 'di ltar des gang gis rtogs par bgyi ba dang / gang rtogs par bgyi ba'i shes pa de mi dmigs te yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar des gang gis rtogs par bgyi ba dang / gang rtogs par bgyi ba'i shes pa de mi dmigs te yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the consciousness that realizes and the object realized are not apprehended, i.e., not seen.

original: de la gang gis zhes bya ba ni shes pa des zhes bya bar ston to //üîΩgang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis thob po //
analyzed: de la gang gis zhes bya ba ni shes pa des zhes bya bar ston to // gang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis thob po //
translated: Therein, ‚Äúby which‚Äù indicates ‚Äúby that consciousness.‚Äù

original: mngon par rtogs so zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs so zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù indicates ‚ÄúI have attained‚Äù and ‚ÄúI have realized.‚Äù

original: gang zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa dang / mngon par ma rtogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù indicates ‚Äúthe phenomena that have not been attained and not realized.‚Äù

original: de ltar thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa bzhi med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa bzhi med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the absence of the four conceptualizations with regard to the consciousness of attainment and realization,

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yul du gyur pa'i shes pa la yang rnam par rtog pa de bzhi mi 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yul du gyur pa'i shes pa la yang rnam par rtog pa de bzhi mi 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: subsequently, in order to teach that those four conceptualizations do not engage with regard to the consciousness that takes all phenomena such as form as its object,üîΩthe root text says:

original: des shes pa de gzugs kyi nang du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
analyzed: des shes pa de gzugs kyi nang du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
translated: That consciousness does not see form as real.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yul du gyur pa'i shes pa yang nang dang phyi rol dang / gnyi ga dang / de las gzhan pa la yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yul du gyur pa'i shes pa yang nang dang phyi rol dang / gnyi ga dang / de las gzhan pa la yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness, which is the object of all phenomena such as form, is not seen as real either internally, externally, both, or other than those.

original: de nyid yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de nyid yang gsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang mos par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In order to clarify that very point, the following is explained: ‚ÄúIn this enumeration, the wandering ascetic will be inspired, up to‚Ä¶

original: mtshan ma ma mchis par yid la bgyid pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar du bshad do //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis par yid la bgyid pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar du bshad do //
translated: because of mental attention to signlessness.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni gzhan gyi pha rol du mchis pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa yongs su shes pa 'di'i phan yon bstan to //
