analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni gzhan gyi pha rol du mchis pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa yongs su shes pa 'di'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who has gone to the other shore, Blessed One. This shows the benefit of knowing the accomplishment of non-apprehending.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad las gzhan pa'i pha rol ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad las gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad las gzhan pa'i pha rol ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad las gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, the other shore of all phenomena is beyond all conceptualization and all signs.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni pha rol te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni pha rol te /
translated: Non-conceptuality is the other shore.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i pha rol du zhes bya ba'i tha @102b tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i pha rol du zhes bya ba'i tha @102b tshig go //
translated: The phrase gone to the other shore of signlessness means the same.

original: gzhan gyi pha rol de gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi pha rol de gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is that other shore?

original: gang la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: Where there is no grasping of form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi pha rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi pha rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there is no grasping of form, etc., it is called the other shore.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni kun tu rgyu de sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni kun tu rgyu de sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Not passing into parinirvana in the intermediate state means that because that wandering mendicant is of the Buddha's lineage,

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: he does not pass into parinirvana in the intermediate state.

original: bar du zhes bya ba smos pa ni smon lam de dag smon lam ma lags /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba smos pa ni smon lam de dag smon lam ma lags /
translated: The word in the intermediate state indicates that those aspirations are not aspirations,

original: stobs de dag stobs ma lags /
analyzed: stobs de dag stobs ma lags /
translated: those powers are not powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa de dag mi 'jigs pa ma lags /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa de dag mi 'jigs pa ma lags /

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa de dag so so yang dag par rig pa ma lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: those correct understandings are not correct understandings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma lags zhes bya ba la /
translated: up to those Buddha-dharmas are not Buddha-dharmas.

original: bar du zhes bya ba smos pa 'dis gzhan gyi pha rol ston to //üîΩde ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba smos pa 'dis gzhan gyi pha rol ston to // de ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: The word in the intermediate state indicates the other shore.üîΩHaving thus completed the practice without grasping,

original: de'i 'og tu yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa brtsams te /
translated: subsequently one should undertake the practice of thorough examination.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su brtags par bgyi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: they should investigate as follows.

original: yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
translated: This investigation is taught in four parts:

original: 'di ni gang zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni gang gi zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni gang gi zhes bya ba dang / 'di ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is this? Whose is this? Why is this? What is this like?

original: de de ltar yongs su rtog cing de ltar sems pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su rtog cing de ltar sems pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'di gang zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: up to ‚ÄúWhen he practices the perfection of wisdom in this way, he is not separated from the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù This shows ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, form is devoid of the intrinsic nature of form,

analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya'i bar du ni 'di gang zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: up to the very limit of reality is devoid of the intrinsic nature of the very limit of reality.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, form does not have the defining characteristic of form,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gzugs la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba nas gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'diüîΩni @103a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gzugs la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba nas gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'di ni @103a * //
translated: up to ‚Äòthose who train in this training will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúAll phenomena are non-arisen and unceasing,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / nges par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / nges par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: up to

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba ston
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba ston
translated: The bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way is close to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: to // de la 'di gang zhes bya ba de'i rang bzhin 'dri ba ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúwhat is this?‚Äù is asking about its nature.

analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs pa'o zhes de skad brjod par bya'o //

original: 'di ni gang gi zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba 'dri ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhose is this?‚Äù is asking about the connection.

analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi'o zhes de skad brjod par bya'o //

original: 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is this?‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhes gtan tshigs 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhes gtan tshigs 'dri ba ste /
translated: is asking for the reason, ‚ÄúWhy is this called the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should say, ‚ÄúBecause it realizes the nature of things as they are.‚Äù

original: 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba ni byed pa 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba ni byed pa 'dri ba ste /

analyzed: de la nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The answer is: because it definitely delivers.

original: de dag thams cad kyi re zhig lan gdab par bya ba la 'di gang yin zhes bya ba sngar dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi re zhig lan gdab par bya ba la 'di gang yin zhes bya ba sngar dris pa'i lan du /
translated: The answer to the question, which of all these is this?

analyzed: de de ltar yongs su rtog cing de ltar nges par sems pa'i tshe / gal te 'di ltar chos med cing mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par yang dag par rjes su mthong na de yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: ci las dgongs she na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: de'i tshe chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyang nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos thams cad dmigs su med pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyang nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the non-apprehension of all dharmas would be their intrinsic nature, like space.

original: de bas na gang gis de la bltas na /
analyzed: de bas na gang gis de la bltas na /
translated: Therefore, if one sees that,

analyzed: rang bzhin med par mthong ba de yang dag par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And seeing that they are without intrinsic nature is the same as seeing reality.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar chos thams cad ma mchis shing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar chos thams cad ma mchis shing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúThus, all phenomena are nonexistent and non-apprehensible.‚Äù

original: de'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med par mthong na /
translated: Thus, when all phenomena such as form are seen to be unreal,üîΩone should know that one is not separated from the knowledge of all aspects, and that one will not be timid, afraid, and so on.

original: gang la zhum pa dang / skrag pa la sogs pa med par gyur pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis smras pa la /
analyzed: gang la zhum pa dang / skrag pa la sogs pa med par gyur pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis smras pa la /
translated: When the elder Subh≈´ti said this,

analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus ma bral ba'i mtshan nyid bstan @103b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the elder ≈öƒÅriputra, in order to teach the characteristic of non-separation,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba yin par rig par bya zhes dris so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba yin par rig par bya zhes dris so //
translated: asked, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, why should one be known as not separated from the knowledge of all aspects?‚Äù

original: de'i tshe gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: At that time, the elder Subhuti taught,

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba de'i phyir de ltar mthong ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba de'i phyir de ltar mthong ba de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause all phenomena are devoid of essence, therefore, it should be known that seeing in this way is not separate from the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na 'di ltar gzugs la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med ces bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi yin zhes dris pa'i lan bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu rnam grangs des na 'di ltar gzugs la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med ces bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi yin zhes dris pa'i lan bshad pa yin te /
translated: Venerable Shariputra, by this one of many explanations, it is explained that the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhose is this perfection of wisdom?‚Äù is as stated in ‚ÄúThus, form is not the intrinsic nature of form.‚Äù

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bral bas dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bral bas dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: Because in this way, all phenomena are devoid of their own essence and are non-existent,

original: 'o na chos gang rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na chos gang rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba bstan pa yin /
translated: then, what phenomenon is realized by which it is taught as the perfection of wisdom?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gzugs la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gang 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang gzugs la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gang 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni
translated: Moreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, the statement ‚ÄúIn form, there is no characteristic of form‚Äù and so on, up to ‚ÄúWhoever trains in this will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the question ‚ÄúWhy is this perfection called wisdom?‚Äù

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it realizes the characteristics of all phenomena,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: it is established as the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te chos thams cad mtshan nyid med cing mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mtshan nyid med cing mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are without characteristics and free from characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid gang dag rtogs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang dag rtogs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: what characteristics are realized?‚Äù

analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid thams cad ni kun brtags pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, since all characteristics do not exist as imagined,

analyzed: de'i phyir / chos nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore, the intrinsic nature is said to be free from the characteristics of form and so on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus byang chub
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus byang chub
translated: The Lord: He will go forth to the knowledge of all modes.üîΩSubhuti: A Bodhisattva, a great being who thus courses in the perfection of wisdom, comes near to full enlightenment.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tuüîΩphyin pa 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba de bstan pa ste /üîΩnges par 'byin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu @104a * //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nye bar gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ci zhig na zhes bya ba de bstan pa ste / nges par 'byin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu @104a * //
translated: The Lord: He comes near to full enlightenment.üîΩSubhuti: What is this perfection of wisdom?üîΩThe Lord: It is the going forth.

original: phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhuti: What is the going forth?

original: nges par 'byung ba de yang chos thams cad la med de /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba de yang chos thams cad la med de /
translated: The Lord: The nonexistence of all dharmas.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing nges par 'byung ba med pas de'i phyir de yang de'i nges par 'byin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing nges par 'byung ba med pas de'i phyir de yang de'i nges par 'byin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since all phenomena are non-arisen and do not definitely emerge, therefore, that [emptiness] also does not cause their definite emergence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, form is empty of the entityness of form.üîΩIn that [emptiness], arising and definite emergence are not observed.

original: de la skye ba dang / nges par 'byung ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang / nges par 'byung ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Thus, the form of the nature of phenomena, which is fully established, is empty of the entityness of the form that is imagined.

original: de'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni 'khor ba'i gnas skabs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid skye ba dang / 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs la ni 'khor ba'i gnas skabs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid skye ba dang / 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, in the form of the nature of phenomena, the arising and emergence of the entity of affliction during the state of sa·πÉsƒÅra do not exist.

original: dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid la phyin ci log gi dngos po med pas glo bur gyis nges par 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid la phyin ci log gi dngos po med pas glo bur gyis nges par 'byung ba med de /
translated: And in the state of purity, since the entity of purification does not have the nature of error, adventitious definite emergence does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of the purity of its very essence and because of the immutability of reality.

original: skye ba med ces bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: skye ba med ces bya ba ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Non-production refers to the stage with defilement.

original: nges par 'byung ba med ces bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba med ces bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Non-extinction refers to the stage without defilement.

original: de ltar yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtags pa'i sgrub pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the establishment of investigation,

original: de'i 'og tu brtson par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brtson par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the establishment of striving,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: the Lord says, Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, when he courses in the perfection of wisdom, through lack of skill in means, should course in form, etc.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar la thug pa'i gzhung gis bshad de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar la thug pa'i gzhung gis bshad de /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, this bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva is close to the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù up to the end explains this.üîΩ

original: brtson par bsgrub pa 'di yang thabs ma yin pa spang bar bya ba dang / thabs la brten par bya ba dang / nam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: brtson par bsgrub pa 'di yang thabs ma yin pa spang bar bya ba dang / thabs la brten par bya ba dang / nam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: The passage from the sutra that begins, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, this bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva is close to the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù and ends with ‚Äúhe is not far from the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù explains that this practice of striving is the avoidance of what is not a method and the reliance on a method, and it teaches two kinds of method.

original: thabs ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: What is not a method is taught in two ways:

original: mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: the practice of signs and the practice of manifest effort.

original: thabs kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: thabs kyang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The method is taught in two ways:

original: chos la spyod pa med pa dang / chos kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos la spyod pa med pa dang / chos kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa med pa'o //
translated: the nonpractice of phenomena and the nonpractice of the signs of phenomena.

original: de la thabs ma yin pas mtshan ma la spyod pa ni gzugs la spyod pa na mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la thabs ma yin pas mtshan ma la spyod pa ni gzugs la spyod pa na mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice of signs that is not a method is the practice of signs when practicing with form.

original: @104b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
analyzed: @104b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes bya ba nas bzung ste de ni byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mi mkhas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
translated: From He does not practice the perfection of wisdom up to That should be known as a bodhisattva's lack of skill in means.

original: thabs ma yin pas mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Practice with non-means is explained as follows:

original: gzugs la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos na zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzugs la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos na zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: If one abides in form, fully cognizes, and is intent on it, up to...
